jobs.title: API Specialist
jobs.content:
About Us:


Every time you pay for an Uber ride or book on Airbnb, you’re using our product. Braintree lets you move money from one place to another safely and securely. It sounds complex (and it is), but we make it so simple, you wouldn't know we were there.


At Braintree, opportunities to shine happen daily. We value what makes you different, and encourage you to act on your ideas -- no matter how pie-in-the-sky. You bring skills and a customer-first mentality, and we'll bring the tools and environment you need to do the best work of your life.


Check us out - Braintree on The Muse.


API Specialist:


Our API Specialists leverage their technical prowess and in-depth product knowledge to assist our merchants with seamless API integrations into our SDK. While you don’t need to be a seasoned developer, you should be comfortable writing code, building API integrations, and running point on complex data migrations. You’ll be the first point of escalation for the more complicated technical issues that reach our support team, so you’ll often find yourself in the thick of conversations with developers from many of our different product teams - be prepared to learn a lot!  Skills you might pick up include basic networking diagnostics, writing efficient search queries, and sleuthing through our extensive gateway code.


Beyond the technical skill-set, we are looking for someone who can delight our merchants with promptness, thoroughness, accuracy and even the occasional pun.


Examples of work you’ll be doing:



  • Assist merchants integrating with the Braintree API; you’ll be an expert in our best practices. We offer client libraries in Ruby, Python, Java, .NET, PHP, and Node.js. You won’t be familiar with all these on Day 1, but over time you will add more languages to your tool-belt

  • Field support inquiries from developers and business users about account integration and the payments features we offer to best serve a merchant platform and their customers

  • Diving in and debugging web services by building custom example integrations and experiment with merchant problems

  • Run point on merchant data migrations into our systems in a way that is least disruptive to their business and workflow

  • Spot problems and trends in support tickets, and work with our developers to improve existing workflows


What we look for in you:



  • Solid understanding of at least one programming language and capability to take that knowledge and build a simple web app that uses our API

  • Must be a self-starter. Those that require a playbook need not apply

  • 1+ year experience in a technical or support role that puts you in direct contact with merchants or customers

  • Willingness to spin up a Digital Ocean or EC2 instance to test network connectivity or integration issues

  • Resourcefulness that puts Angus MacGuyver to shame

  • Someone who possess infinite patience and devotion to their contacts … and someone who is secure in their ping-pong abilities. Watch out. You might get schooled


Braintree Perks:


Daily catered lunches: salad bar and entree buffet. Yum!


Tuition reimbursement: we take education and skills development seriously


Commuter reimbursement: take the L or Metra to work? We cover the monthly expenses


Give Time: program to encourage volunteering in local communities - 5 PTO days annually after first year of employment

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
About Us:


Braintree builds products that make payments easier—so easy that they fade into the background, making entirely new kinds of interactions possible. The Braintree full-stack payment platform lets companies build their own experiences and then scale their businesses around the globe. We're known for our technology but we're also known for our support, with internal risk and underwriting, account management and technical support teams who ensure a frictionless payments experience.

Our technology fuels companies like GitHub, 37Signals, Uber, Airbnb, OpenTable, Heroku and more.


Headquartered in Chicago, Braintree has offices in San Francisco, New York, Sydney, and London with employees stationed around the world. 

Check us out - Braintree on The Muse: http://muse.cm/1wWa28H


Senior Software Engineer:

We’re looking for Software Engineers to join the squad and help us continue building solutions to complex problems and innovate in the space. Here is a little info on our team:


We are polyglots... 

Although most of our software is written in Ruby, we don’t confine ourselves to a single programming language. We believe in using the best tool for the job while maintaining a slight bias toward the tools the team knows the best. We’ve written infrastructure components in Python, and we build client libraries for integrating with Braintree in Ruby, Python, Node.js, PHP, Java, and .NET.


We pair program…


We work on Macbook Pros with two keyboards and dual 27" cinema displays. We work in an open team room; no cubicles or private offices. Communication is key to our process, and we don't want to hinder it with walls. 

We test... 

Testing is at the forefront of our development philosophy. We never need to check our code coverage to know that it's at 100%: with disciplined TDD, no line of code will be written without a test. We're confident that our automated testing is thorough and will catch any regression bugs - and that’s critical given the software we write! We use continuous integration to test every version of every client library against our gateway.


We are agile...


Agile development methodologies mean different things to different people. For us, the most important part of Agile is doing what works best for the team. We have a story card wall and release a few times a week. We keep the team in sync with daily stand-ups and have a retrospective once a month to discuss things that are going well and opportunities for improvements. We’re pragmatic, not dogmatic. Although we have strong opinions, we're never afraid to try to new things to see if they work and reconsider our positions if the situation warrants it. 

We value our people... 

-Two paid conferences annually to everyone on the Products Team


-Open Dev Day twice a month 


-Catered lunches daily


-Commuter reimbursement program


Take a look at some of our blog posts and scope our code on GitHub


Braintrust

Braintree GitHub

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Commerce
jobs.content:
About Us:


Every time you pay for an Uber ride or book on Airbnb, you’re using our product. Braintree lets you move money from one place to another safely and securely. It sounds complex (and it is), but we make it so simple, you wouldn't know we were there.


At Braintree, opportunities to shine happen daily. We value what makes you different, and encourage you to act on your ideas -- no matter how pie-in-the-sky. You bring skills and a customer-first mentality, and we'll bring the tools and environment you need to do the best work of your life.


Check us out - Braintree on The Muse | LinkedIn | Glassdoor | Facebook | Twitter


Engineering Team Culture:


We are hiring Software Engineers to join our Commerce Team. The focus is to build the future of commerce. We simply look to hire smart people. No emphasis on a CS degree, or deep understanding of our tech stack, but instead Engineers who are passionate about their craft and excited to join a collaborative environment building the future of commerce. We are a largely remote team and have built a strong set of principles around our communication and workflow to support this.


Types of projects we work on:


Contextual commerce — With one seamless Braintree integration, you’ll pave a simple path for retailers to sell, and users to buy what they see - when they see it - on your platform.


PayPal Commerce iOS SDK — building a better way to sell on mobile and giving customers a shopping experience with less typing, smarter purchasing, and more flexibility.


Think — dropping a buy button into an email or online article to reduce friction and cart abandonment. Embed a store with our simple SDK to bring the complete shopping experience right into your existing app.


What we look for in you:


Proficiency within your current tech stack and desire to continue learning. We build with Python and JavaScript, but are open to candidates with other experiences.


Work in a highly collaborative environment. Our team is spread out across the country with people working in our Chicago and San Francisco offices, as well as remotely. You should be open to various channels of communication and enjoy the workflow of that team dynamic.


You’re excited about the work we’re doing. Contextual commerce is a new concept in the space, and we’re hoping you are passionate about helping build new consumer experiences.


Braintree Perks:


Open Dev Day — two days a month our engineers work on projects that interest them to improve their craft


Product conferences — attend two conferences … all on the Braintree dime


Daily catered lunches — salad bar and entree buffet. Yum!


Tuition reimbursement — we take education and skills development seriously


Tracking Free Vacation — employees self track their vacation to ensure you get the time off you need


Take a look at our GitHub and blog: Braintree GitHub | Braintrust

jobs.title: Mobile App Developer
jobs.content:
Mobile App Developer



Job Description:


Village Print & Media is Manhattan’s most innovative creative solutions agency specializing in print, design, and media. We are currently experiencing explosive growth and are seeking a talented and experienced Mobile App Developer to join our in-house team and work closely with our technology and marketing departments. This is a unique opportunity to help shape the creation of our mobile app division in an entrepreneurial leadership role. As we grow our development team, there is significant room for upward mobility and managerial experience. This is an opportunity to gain valuable knowledge and experience while working on a variety of both client facing and internal projects. Please note that this is a full time, in-house position based in Manhattan, NYC.



Qualifications:



  • BS in Computer Science, related field, or equivalent work experience

  • 5+ years of experience in Application, Database and Mobile Application development

  • Understanding of the software development life-cycle – scoping, planning, design, implementation, deployment and maintenance.

  • Server Side 


o    Cloud resource allocation and management (Web, Application, Database)


o    Database design and implementation (MySQL or PostgreSQL preferred)


o    Application development with MVC framework experience (Example, PHP+Laravel)


o    Web application development (HTML, CSS, Javascript)



  • Client Side 


o    iOS and Android experience front end and back end implementation


o    We are Open to Visual-Studio-xamarin / PhoneGap multi-platform development


o    Experience in Client-Server communication


o    Strong intuition for UX and customer behavior


o    Extensive hands-on experience creating custom UI controls, designing protocols, implementing delegate interfaces, and performance optimization


o    Work from UI/UX requirements to build fully functional applications



  • Experience with Git or a similar control system

  • Comfortable working in a collaborative environment

  • Able to handle multiple high priority projects and work under tight deadlines

  • Excellent planning and organizational skills

  • Self-motivated, quick learner, and detail-oriented

  • Up-to-date portfolio featuring exceptional examples of recent development work in Google Play and Apple iOS App store, preferably with server-side components (ideally with web front end as well)



 Responsibilities:



  • Contribute to conceptualization and execution plans

  • Write clean, readable, and reusable code that is well-documented/commented

  • Code mobile applications to achieve specific objectives

  • Effectively manage designated projects from conception through execution

  • Delegate coding responsibilities to team members and verify quality of work



This is a full time opportunity that offers full benefits, competitive salary, and a great opportunity to join a 45+ year company and be a major contributor to its growth. If interested, please email your resume, cover letter, and links to your published applications as well as GitHub repository if available to jobs1@villagegroup.com. Incomplete applications will not be considered. No phone calls, please. Salary is extremely competitive and commensurate with experience.

jobs.title: Senior Python Software Engineer
jobs.content:
What we're looking for


You'll work with the backend team to help develop the existing systems, build new features, products and experimental ideas. You'll be often shipping code that highly impact our performance as a company. You'll be part of a creative tight-knit team that powers the company.


You'll be deeply involved in designing, implementing and maintaining critical systems that solve challenging and exciting problems. Providing prices to customers, researching and analyzing price trends, geographic-aware database searches for truck-shipment matching and many other.


You'll attack and dissect existing industry processes and perhaps see something that no one ever seen before – and help us make it better. We do believe in divide and conquer and iteratively making it a little better one one step at a time. Creative problem-solving will be a daily thing on your agenda.


The backend team also supports three customer-facing clients: iOS, Android and a Web platform. We may also need to design and implement an external API in the near future for third-party integrations.


We're looking for those that know how to stitch up integrations with third-party systems and plug new data sources to our platform. This means sometimes you'll need to make architecture decisions but don't worry – we got your back. We hope we can use your strong understanding of the web stack (presentation, HTTP, caching, scaling)


We're hoping to find a generalist with multilingual experience but really strong in Python. We collaborate with GitHub and we currently deploy on Heroku. Hopefully you're also a Django pro.


Do you dream about elegant systems architecture and database designs? Do you find exciting to aggregate multiple data sources into a single powerful intelligence database that powers the entire business operation? Do you enjoy thinking about customer behavior and how to maximize customer happiness?


If some of this is new to you but you're looking to learn and contribute, feel free to still apply!


Benefits & Perks:



  • Competitive Salary

  • Generous Stock Option Plan

  • Medical, Vision & Dental Benefits

  • Offices at the heart of Soho (with rooftop)

  • Free Citi Bike!

  • Join an accomplished team building a rapidly-growing tech company from the ground up.

jobs.title: Web Development Instructor
jobs.company: The Turing School of Software and Design
jobs.content:
Turing is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization working to change the landscape of the technology industry by training a diverse, passionate, and highly skilled workforce ready to change the world.


Turing currently runs two 27-week full-time intensive instructional program for adults desiring to become professional software developers. We are hiring instructors for either program: Front-End Engineering and Web Application Development.


Instructor: Front-End Engineering Program


Our curriculum focuses on JavaScript, HTML/CSS, user experience, agile development, and project management. The 27 week program is broken up into four modules. The first module focuses on the fundamentals of web development and covers semantic markup, responsive design, and an introduction to JavaScript. In the second module, students will dive deeper into the language's mechanics and learn how to write object-oriented as well as functional JavaScript, build Node APIs in Express, and create a game with HTML5 canvas. In the third module, we'll explore how to leverage front-end frameworks to create rich experiences in the browser. Students will build applications with web technologies outside of the browser in the final module: They'll build desktop applications with Electron, mobile web applications with PhoneGap and Cordova, and native applications with React Native.


Instructor: Web Application Development Program

Our curriculum focuses on Ruby, Ruby on Rails, JavaScript, HTML/CSS, Git, relational databases, agile development, and project management. The 27 week program is broken up into four modules. The first module focuses on the fundamentals of object-oriented programming, algorithms, and data structures. In the second module, students learn how to build web applications with Sinatra and Ruby on Rails. In the third module, students build upon their Rails knowledge and learn how to build APIs, optimize database queries, and add multitenancy to their applications. In the fourth and final module, students write client-side code to enhance their web applications.


Responsibilities



  • Research, prepare, and deliver lesson topics in a way that is both engaging and effective

  • Facilitate evaluations and assessments of projects and individual student progress

  • Collect and analyze student achievement data in order to implement changes to existing curriculum

  • Contribute to the development of internal software tools

  • Create and publish open-source instructional materials

  • Work and teach in our office in downtown Denver during the hours 8:15-5:00 daily in addition to occasional special events outside of these hours

jobs.title: Front-End Developer
jobs.content:
PERTS is an applied research center at Stanford University that uses science and technology to advance educational equity on a large scale. To do this, we (1) translate research findings into actionable recommendations that can be widely implemented by organizations that serve historically underserved students; (2) develop cost-effective measurement systems that enable educators, researchers, and policy makers to learn what educational practices reliably improve equity; and (3) promote the use of research-based resources through partnerships with schools, colleges, and other organizations that can positively influence students learning experiences on a large scale.

PERTS is currently seeking a passionate web developer to help with our growing suite of software and web products. Youll have the opportunity to work on consumer-facing applications like the Mindset Kit as well as our more data-heavy survey platforms and services. As a small team, youll have plenty of room to experiment and take ownership of your work while getting exposure to all parts of our technology stack. Scaling is a crucial part of the PERTS mission, and quality code with testing and scaling in mind is a must. We move fast, but we try not to break things.

You will be working with a small research group with a startup mentality and large ambitions for increasing the academic success of students. We study how to apply research to affect student achievement on a large scale, and we develop and test tools and resources for educators. We are looking for a highly motivated individual to become the newest member of our team.

*Our office is located in San Francisco (not on the Stanford campus).


Responsibilities:

Design, implement, and manage web-based applications, databases, and interfaces from initial design and architecture through development, test, and deployment.

Implement and maintain content management systems, including installation, configuration, troubleshooting

Perform web platform analytics

Develop and deploy web applications and client-side web interface components that interact with relational database management systems

Evaluate and implement new programming languages and technologies

Design and document data structures, architecture, and process flows for websites, web-based applications, and databases.

Research, evaluate, and enforce web standards for usability and accessibility.


Benefits


  • Flexible schedule
  • Health/vision/dental/life insurance
  • Paid holidays, vacation, & sick time
  • 403(b) match after 1 year
  • $800/year to spend on professional development
  • Information about additional Stanford benefits can be found at https://cardinalatwork.stanford.edu/

jobs.title: DevOps developer - fast growing tech/consulting startup
jobs.content:
Simply put – we help clients build cool stuff.


At Levvel you'll work alongside other talented developers on tons of interesting projects. Our clients range from Fortune 500 companies to the earliest startups. At Levvel, we help companies deliver features into production at a faster pace by leveraging modern techniques and technologies. We are looking for people who want to build incredible technical skills while also being exposed to all aspects of business.


You'll have tons of opportunity to expand your skills and apply those skills to interesting new problems. We hire developers who are hungry to learn and keep up with the newest trends. For this role we're looking for a junior or mid level DevOps developer, ideally with experience with PUPPET. In addition to technical skills, we're looking for developers who can communicate clearly and express ideas in verbal discussion, client communication, technical documentation and architectural reviews.

jobs.title: Tech Ops Engineer - Fintech
jobs.content:
We’re looking for someone like you to join our Technology team. You’d be responsible for all aspects of front line infrastructure and application support: troubleshooting critical production issues across the platform (AWS, RHEL, Windows Server) and applications (Java Tomcat, Python, Perl); carrying out production deployments, identifying and patching bugs and inefficiencies, and building monitoring and reporting frameworks as well as tools used to streamline and automate tasks throughout the platform lifecycle.


This role will provide the opportunity to interact directly with end users to resolve technical issues as well as exposure to various technologies including (but not limited to) AWS, Ansible, ZooKeeper, Elastic Search, Kibana, Python and Java, as well as Linux, SQL Server and Windows Server.


You’re an exceptionally talented technologist with a passion for solving problems and learning systems inside out. You get a kick out of being at the center of a mission critical operation, extinguishing production fires and building the frameworks, automations and tools to prevent them in future.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer - Fintech
jobs.content:
We’re looking for someone like you to join our Technology team. You’d be responsible for building next generation software and architecting solutions to support new technical and business initiatives. Some days you will be a highly focused and productive individual contributor working on the most challenging and most critical projects in the company. Other days you will be a highly leveraged team lead responsible for delivering on big cross-functional technical initiatives.


You’re an exceptionally talented software engineer who thrives on tackling complex systems design and implementation challenges. You have a passion for technology and are looking for a place where you can have a direct and immediate impact.

jobs.title: Front End Software Engineering Lead - Fintech
jobs.content:
We’re looking for someone like you to join our Technology team. You’d be responsible for developing and delivering client-facing applications as well as shared frameworks, components, and infrastructure.


Some days you’ll be a highly focused individual contributor working on the most challenging and most critical projects. Other days you’ll be a highly leveraged team lead setting the technical direction for all front-end product development in the company.

jobs.title: Senior Linux Engineer - Fintech
jobs.content:
We're looking for someone like you to join our Infrastructure / Systems Engineering team. You'll be a critical member of this small and high-impact team with a lot of visibility.


This role will provide an opportunity to make substantial contributions into the design and implementation of our platform's infrastructure and improve its availability and scalability. The role requires a mix of systems engineering and software development.


• You possess a unique combination of software engineering and systems engineering know-how and experience. You know Linux and distributed systems inside and out. You’ve read RFCs and POSIX. You understand the Unix philosophy. You know the Linux ecosystem and haven’t found a problem you couldn’t solve with command line tools. You probably use either vim or emacs (or maybe both . . . ), and can also tell users of the other why they’re using the wrong one :).
• You’re a coder with a mindset around systems and automation. You could do application development if you wanted to, but you like systems engineering more because you get to touch more things.
• You have a passion for making systems better and an exceptional ability to execute. You don’t require daily supervision. You take ownership. You’re highly self-motivated and a quick learner.
• You’re able to design, engineer, and implement critical systems and provide “last line of defense” support when needed
• You’re a thinker and a doer, not just good communicator. You’d rather write code than give presentations, but you can do it and do it well when necessary.
• You probably have contributed to open source projects. You probably have
a GitHub account.

jobs.title: Senior Engineer / Full Stack to innovate for social good
jobs.content:
As a Senior Engineer with Give Lively, you’ll be an integral part of our mission of creating products with purpose. You'll have the opportunity to use a variety of tech to develop prototypes, APIs, consumer-facing products and tools for giving. You'll be a core part of an agile process in a small organization with a solid product foundation. Your expertise in elements of our client-side stack (JavaScript/React, Objective-C, HTML, CSS, Bootstrap) and server-side stack (Ruby on Rails, Node.js, Heroku/AWS) will be required to be successful in this role. 


You'd have an opportunity to join as a tech owner and mentor on the ground floor of our expanding organization.


As part of your job, you’ll be working with our team to come up with product and design ideas and deliver products in a rapid fashion. Your passion to create products that users love, that work extremely well, and that fully utilize your incredible engineering skills (and any other skills you bring to the table) will allow Give Lively to deliver quickly, iterate, and make a significant impact in the world.

jobs.title: Cloud Solutions/Java Engineer
jobs.content:
The CSC Agility Platform is a consolidated platform for hybrid cloud management, governance, and security across multiple heterogeneous public and private clouds. Powerful cloud management capabilities...and fast results. The CSC Agility Platform enables enterprises to adopt cloud-based IT operating models that increase business agility, speed application delivery, and lower costs.



Agility Platform's industry-leading policy-based cloud governance, security and lifecycle management capabilities accelerate the adoption of cloud services across the enterprise and deliver business critical applications safely into the cloud. Our Principal Java Developer will support this exciting work with a team of very talented colleagues.



Job Summary:



  • Designs, develops, and analyzes highly complex software programs for cloud based systems.

  • Develop multi-tiered cloud blueprint connectors for PaaS solutions such as RedHat OpenShift, CloudFoundry, Azure PaaS, and the orchestration components used to integrate developed solutions.

  • Integrate solutions into Linux and Microsoft operating systems providing automated system configuration and platform engineering adjustments as necessary.

  • Automate solution development and deployment with orchestration products such as Puppet, Ansible, Chef, or other DevOps tools

  • Configure and maintain cloud resources such as virtual load balancers and firewalls used in the production of enterprise blueprints.

  • Be able to work collaboratively with other team members with changing priorities and ad-hoc requests.

  • Adhere to best practices for code maintenance, package automation, automated build and quality assurance testing.

  • Coordinate with Product Managers, Development Leads and Engineering Directors to ensure accurate time estimates and on-time deliverables.


  Essential Job Functions:



  • Enthusiasm, dedication, and passion for exceptional solutions development

  • Enjoys critical thinking and problem solving

  • Expert at Shell scripting in one of more of the following: Bash, Perl

  • Deep experience level with one or more of the following: Java, C#, Python

  • Expertise with private and public cloud engineering (VMware, OpenStack)

  • Experience using Source Control (Subversion, GitHub) and Bug Tracking Systems (JIRA)

  • Demonstrable skills building virtual machine images on private and public clouds

  • Willingness and ability to handle requests outside of your core responsibilities

  • Excellent communication skills



Additional Pluses:



  • Build and Runtime automation experience using Puppet, Ansible, Chef, or similar orchestration products

  • Experience with Jenkins or similar continuous build and integration frameworks

  • Expertise for Agile development methodologies

  • Familiar with Software Defined Networking (SDN) and OpenStack API

  • Knowledgeable of systems security best practices and how to apply them

  • Performs highly complex systems modeling, simulation and analysis to provide appropriate solution.

  • Conducts investigations and tests of complex software systems to enhance performance or to investigate and resolve matters of significance.

  • Reviews completion and implementation of technical products to ensure success and timeliness.

  • Reviews literature, patents and current practices relevant to the solution of more complex projects.

  • Recommends corrections in complex technical applications and analysis to enhance performance.

  • Evaluates vendor capabilities on projects to provide required products or services.

  • Provides leadership and work guidance to less experienced personnel.

  • Provides technical consultation to other organizations; interacts with senior customer personnel and internal senior management.

  • Provides the customer base with first level support.

jobs.title: Creative Director Solution Consulting USA Eastern Central Time Zone
jobs.content: ServiceNow is hiring a Creative Director, Solution Consulting in Remote USA -Eastern or Central Time Zone

jobs.title: Lead Security Architect
jobs.content:
Do you want to be part of an engineering team that is building a world class cloud platform that scales at enterprise levels? Are you excited to push the limits of Cloud Computing Security Architecture while working in a strong collaborative culture?  If so, we want you!



CSC is currently searching for a Senior Security Software Engineer that understand the complexities and intricacies of securing Cloud Provisioning and management layers.  This position requires that the candidate be intimately familiar in Security and automation scan tools such as Veracode and Qualys as well as automated build and configuration management tools such as ANT, Jersey, and Puppet or Chef.  The Senior Security Software Engineer also should be a fluent Java and JUnit developer as well as securing UX technologies as well.



The Senior Security Architectr will be facing off with security architects from other groups and will be guiding security architecture and must be an excellent communicator and team player. We are looking for the best and brightest engineers to join our Cloud team. What we’re looking for in a candidate



Role and Responsibilities:



  • Assist in automating testing and performing active scans using security scanning technology

  • Work side-by-side with developers to develop test plans and test approaches

  • Manual test-plan execution

  • Detail replication of issues, test-harness, test-environment creation

  • Complete, detailed documentation of issue using bug tracking tools such as Jira

  • Promote Security best practices to the Engineering team

  • Work on Agile/Scrum teams

  • Gather code for analysis and operate static analysis tools; some analysis and triage of results.

  • Assist with operation of dynamic analysis tools, analysis of results, bug filing, and bug triage.

  • Helping to develop and define functional security test cases

  • Develop and implement automation for functional security tests in FLEX user interfaces

  • Help develop and implement automation of functional security tests in RESTful web services

  • Assist with execution, and oversight of test case execution, analysis of results, bug filing, and bug triage.

  • Participate in threat modeling and security architecture development; assist with analysis of results, bug filing, and bug triage.

  • Participate in design discussions and development of design and functional specs for security features and features with security requirements or implications.

  • Implementation and testing of DOD / DISA security hardening standards; and managing application issues that result

  • Help develop and implement automation of DOD / DISA security testing

  • Help set up and configure application instances for security testing, and with light support of third party testers (e.g. creating accounts; occasionally helping troubleshooting issues).

  • Help implement, promote awareness, and monitor for compliance with security policies governing protected security data

jobs.title: Data Analytics Specialist
jobs.content:
Who we are:

Rover.com connects pet parents with the nation's largest network of pet sitters and dog walkers. On Rover, pet parents can easily discover, book, and manage personalized care for their dogs including pet sitting, dog walking, and doggy day care. Founded in 2011 on the belief that everyone should have the opportunity to experience the unconditional love of a dog, Rover improves and simplifies life for pet parents and the dogs they love.



We're headquartered in downtown Seattle. We're an agile, fast-growing startup, and our leadership comes from some of the country's most respected tech companies. We've been named among Seattle's "Best Places to Work" in Seattle Met magazine, and Inc.com recognized us as "One of the Most Dog-Friendly Offices in the World." We're also a recipient of Seattle Business Magazine's 2015 Tech Impact Awards. Needless to say (but we're going to say it anyway)-we love dogs, and we wouldn't dream of going to work without them by our sides.    



Who we're looking for:

We're looking for a Business Intelligence Engineer to join our Data Operations team. You'll primarily be responsible helping our people in our organization understand, and leverage information in our data warehouse, especially helping people understand new data sources as they become available.  You'll be responsible for working to build standardized abstraction layers on the data (such as views), so that users can consume the data conveniently.  And, you will work with other engineers to bring new data sources into the environment.



Ideally, you'll also have experience with Python, data reporting tools, and helping people understand their business requirements. Rover has a strong culture of data self-service we wish to continue. This is not a "generate these business reports for me" position. 



You'll succeed in this role if you can further our culture of data self-service by providing guidance, tooling, and education around our infrastructure, business, and data.  The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, has excellent communication skills, and a knack for problem solving.



Your Responsibilities:




  • Understand our business domain as it relates to our data needs

  • Understand the varying data needs of our organization

  • Educate data consumers in our organization as to what data sources are available

  • Serve as the first-responder to people in the company     who have questions about the location or meaning of data.

  • Build standardized abstractions (such as, summary views) to expose simpler representations of complex data models in our data warehouse based on the consumption needs of others

  • Monitor, maintain, and improve the data pipeline

  • Maintain documentation as appropriate for data concepts and sources present in our system



Non-Technical Qualifications:




  • Aptitude and appreciation for teaching and mentoring

  • Experience working to understand business requirements

  • Ability to understand API documentation

  • Experience documenting technical details, especially for a non-technical audience



Technical Qualifications:




  • Strong SQL skills

  • Familiarity with query optimization in an RBDMS and/or Column-oriented DBMS

  • Experience with Python for data manipulation

  • Bonus experience

    • Redshift Experience

    • Docker

    • Python Workflow Tooling - Luigi/Airflow

    • Machine Learning

    • Hadoop or similar Map-Reduce technology





Benefits of Working at Rover.com:

  • 401k

  • Stock options

  • Competitive benefits package, including medical, dental, and vision insurance

  • Commuter benefits

  • Bring your dog to work (and unlimited puppy time)

jobs.title: Front End Developer with Angular
jobs.content:
WalletHub is a high-growth start-up based in Washington, D.C. .Our fast-paced environment and can do attitude have already earned us several prestigious awards including this year's Gold Stevie for best financial services website from the American Business Awards and a gold medal as one of the products of the year from the Consumer World Awards.  We're seeking hardworking, like-minded individuals to help us disrupt personal finance and make a tangible difference in people's everyday lives.


More specifically, we are harnessing the power of data analytics and artificial intelligence to build the brain of a smart financial advisor, whose services we’re offering to everyone for free. The WalletHub brain enables users to make better financial decisions in a fraction of the time with three unique features:



  1. Customized Credit-Improvement Tips: WalletHub identifies improvement opportunities and guides you through the necessary corrections.

  2. Personalized Money-Saving Advice: WalletHub’s savings brain constantly scours the market for load-lightening opportunities, bringing you only the best deals.

  3. Wallet Surveillance: Personal finance isn’t as scary with 24/7 credit monitoring providing backup, notifying you of important credit-report changes.


In addition to the valuable intelligence the brain provides, WalletHub is the first and only service to offer free credit scores and full credit reports that are updated on a daily basis absent of user interaction, rather than weekly or monthly and only when a user logs in. Some other services hang their hats on free credit scores and reports, yet they’re still inferior to what WalletHub considers minor pieces to a much larger puzzle.


Responsibilities include:



  • Communicate with backend person in order to integrate API's with UI.

  • SDK integration of FB, Twitter, and Google SDK's. Know how each one is used and interacted with.

  • Be able to slice PSD's to pixel perfection including margins, paddings, line heights, and font sizes.

  • Keep up-to-date with the latest standards and techniques concerning CSS, JS and the libraries we are using like jQuery, Knockout, Require, etc.


Note: This position does not have a location requirement and can be performed either remotely (including from outside the U.S.) or from WalletHub’s offices in downtown Washington, D.C.

jobs.title: Full Stack Software Engineer - iTunes U (San Francisco) - 40840858
jobs.content:
Changing the world is all in a day's work at Apple. If you love innovation, here's your chance to make a career of it. You'll work hard. But the job comes with more than a few perks.

The iTunes U team is looking for an experienced engineer to design and implement services that will reach millions of students and teachers. Help build products that inspire and educate the next generation on a team based in San Francisco and working closely with Cupertino.

Key Qualifications:
•Track record of shipping server-side web applications adhering to industry best practices.
•Experience with building and deploying RESTful APIs .
•Experience with Python, Javascript, or other functional languages.
•Experience with relational databases and key-value stores.
•Experience with Java, C#, or similar object-oriented languages preferred.
•Experience with Unix/Linux systems and cloud-based infrastructure and platform services.
•Experience deploying software in mixed language and mixed platform environments.
•Experience with informational retrieval, data extraction, and analytics preferred.
•Ability to express ideas clearly within the team and across other groups.
•Experience with Student Information Systems and/or data analytics is preferred.

Description:
In addition to using technical knowledge to drive features and improvements, you must be comfortable with rapidly evolving requirements, and have excellent interpersonal skills. Success depends on working with cross-functional teams, internal and external to Apple.

Responsibilities:

Creating and maintaining data integrations with third-party services.
Analyzing data and providing customer-facing insights.

Working with customers, third-party developers and cross-functional staff to define requirements and deliver features.

Addressing tangible, customer-facing issues on a tight schedule.
Maintaining an intense focus on secure and polished software.
Participate in the continual improvement of engineering tools and processes.

Education:
Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field, or equivalent work experience.

Apple is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities.

jobs.title: Machine Learning Engineer, Maps Real-Time Traffic - 47091002
jobs.content:
Changing the world is all in a day's work at Apple. If you love innovation, here's your chance to make a career of it. You'll work hard. But the job comes with more than a few perks.

When will rush hour start tomorrow? How long will it take for a traffic jam to clear up? How is a traffic jam affected by a nearby ball game?
We are the real-time traffic team at Apple and we are looking to hire a Machine Learning Engineer to help answer questions like these in a real-time system.

Key Qualifications:
•Excellent Java, Scala, and/or C++
•First-hand machine learning experience
•Bias for action
•Experience with GPS data and/or traffic models is a plus

Description:
The team's main responsibility is to measure and predict speeds for every road on the planet in real time. These speed values heavily influence routing and ETAs, as well as traffic display on the map. Your work will impact millions of people’s lives every day.

You will be a key member of the team designing, implementing, and evaluating the real-time system that efficiently processes a massive stream of GPS and sensor data. We expect you to make substantial contributions to our traffic model, leveraging all this data to most accurately predict the future.

This is a timely opportunity to work on exciting and challenging problems. You are self-motivated and data-driven, you test hypotheses and models by rapid prototyping, and you know how to identify and engineer the most promising models. You speak Java, Scala, and/or C++ (sometimes even on a whiteboard), you have first-hand experience with how different machine learning techniques scale, and you know how to greatly impact products.

Education:
MSc or PhD in Computer Science or a quantitative field

Additional Requirements:
Experience with GPS data and/or traffic models is a plus
Relevant publications (NIPS, ICML, etc.) are a plus

Apple is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities.

jobs.title: Machine Learning Engineer, Siri - 46423470
jobs.content:
Changing the world is all in a day's work at Apple. If you love innovation, here's your chance to make a career of it. You'll work hard. But the job comes with more than a few perks.

Play a part in the next revolution in human-computer interaction. Contribute to a product that is redefining mobile computing. Create groundbreaking technology for large scale systems, spoken language, big data, and artificial intelligence. And work with the people who created the intelligent assistant that helps millions of people get things done — just by asking. Join the Siri Machine Learning & Natural Language team at Apple.

Key Qualifications:
•Strong programming and software engineering skills (Java, C++, Scala, Python or equivalent)
•Expertise in various facets of machine learning and natural language processing, such as classification, feature engineering, information extraction, structured prediction, clustering, semi-supervised learning, topic modeling and ranking
•Prior experience with applying Big Data (MapReduce, Hadoop, Hive and/or Pig, Spark) tools to large quantities of textual data is a plus
•Hard working, self-starter, proven ability to manage multiple projects to strict deadlines. Excellent communication skills and ability to interact with all levels of engineers

Description:
The goal of the Siri Machine Learning & Natural Language team is to take Siri to the next level of intelligence and accuracy using advanced statistical techniques. Engineers in this team work on a wide spectrum of approaches to improving Siri. You would work on core machine learning algorithms and models that are part of Siri’s ability to understand and respond to requests. You would also work on building scalable distributed systems to deliver these models to Siri’s users. You should be passionate about creating phenomenal products. This position involves a wide variety of skills and innovation. This is a unique opportunity that sits at the cutting-edge of machine learning and software.

Education:
Bachelor’s, or Masters, degree in Computer Science

Additional Requirements:
Natural Language and Machine Learning experience is a plus
Bilingual or multilingual preferred

Apple is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities.

jobs.title: Siri Senior Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) - 46423103
jobs.content:
Changing the world is all in a day's work at Apple. If you love innovation, here's your chance to make a career of it. You'll work hard. But the job comes with more than a few perks.

As a member of the SRE team within the Siri organization, you will be faced with highly complex issues in a large scale, distributed system environment. In order to ensure a reliable and rewarding Siri experience, you will be empowered to develop and design new solutions heavily focused on system automation.

We look for talented engineers in both the Operations and Development space to bring these unique solutions to production at a rapid pace. From an Operations perspective, this makes us the most successful personal assistant in the industry.

Key Qualifications:
•Expert knowledge of the Linux operation system (OS, networking, process level)
•Understanding of one or more object-oriented programming languages (Java, C++)
•Fluent in at least one scripting language (Shell, Python, Ruby, etc.)
•Strong verbal and written communication skills
•Passionate about being a part of a tight-knit Operations team

Description:
The Siri Operations SRE team is unique in that we are deeply embedded into the development process early on to ensure newly created features are understood from a scale perspective before deployment to production. To accomplish this, we build automation tools and services to prevent failures and page out individuals when there really is a problem, not just noise. We are focused heavily on automation.

Our engineers not only work closely with Operations, but also with the development engineers within Siri, as well as outside organizations. We aid in architectural design and assist with the implementation of complex features. A successful candidate will have experience in being a Systems Administrator that has moved on to development and automation in their career.

- Operate Apple’s largest infrastructure supporting millions of Siri customers
- Troubleshoot complex issues across the entire stack
- Design and develop automation frameworks to handle production at scale
- Advise other teams (within and outside of Siri) on technical direction
- Make changes to our environment with the purpose of pushing Siri to the next level

Education:
B.S. degree in Computer Science or 3 + years of programming experience or equivalent.

Additional Requirements:
These would be Nice to Have, and is not Required:

- Mesos compute platforms and job schedulers
- Java JVM performance tuning/optimizations
- Hadoop ecosystem (ZooKeeper, HBase, HDFS, Flume)

Apple is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities.

Come help us create the future of Stack Overflow and Stack Overflow Careers. We're looking for passionate, creative developers who are excited about solving new problems. As a full-stack developer, you'll work with everything from front-end HTML, CSS and JS to server-side C# and several different data stores including MSSQL Server, Redis, and Elasticsearch. jobs.title: Experienced Software Development Engineer in Test
jobs.content:
Join the team that’s changing the future of health education:


What if your work in the latest web, mobile and test technologies helped a person make a decision that got him to the emergency room just in time? Or helped a doctor talk to a mom about her child’s illness? And what if the job you showed up for every day made even one person decide to take a walk instead of sitting on the couch eating potato chips?



The best health education in the world only helps people if they can get to it when they need it. As a Software Development Engineer in Test at Healthwise, you’ll be part of an innovative team that designs, develops, and maintains the cutting edge automation, infrastructure and test solutions that deliver health education to people during an office visit, in the hospital, or wherever they are—on any device.



Your experience and your passion for software engineering and making a profound difference in health care make you an ideal candidate. And Healthwise, a nonprofit organization makes an ideal workplace where you can thrive. Since 1975, the Healthwise mission has been to help people make better health decisions. This mission—combined with our innovative spirit—has led to health education and technological solutions that clinicians use to deliver education as part of care.



Our Boise campus boasts a fully equipped gym; walking, running, and biking trails; healthy snacks; company bicycles; and a host of exercise classes—all on-site. Our offices are on the road to the local ski area. And we work in beautiful buildings, filled with natural light and the best of regional art.



The caliber of our people, our understanding of client needs, and our commitment to our mission all give Healthwise a bright future innovating the next generation of consumer health content.



Here’s what you can do:



  • Lead and work alongside the team to develop automation infrastructure that validates systems that make it easier for health care professionals to deliver health education and make it easier for people to access it.

  • Be a proactive and inspirational test representative for your team and for others across our organization.

  • Bring your best thinking and advocacy for advancing technology and systems that validate our products.

  • Innovate, create, and produce automated test processes that give clients great confidence in the quality of our products to help people they serve make better health decisions.

  • Take on other duties as assigned. (Yeah, the day-to-day stuff happens here, too.)


You’ve got this:  



  • You’re driven, but not by your ego.

  • You’re agile in temperament and discipline.

  • You have a passion for testing and a knack for finding bugs.

  • You can easily work closely with your fellow engineers to produce solid test infrastructure used across the organization.

  • You have current experience in developing test automation and test related systems/tools.

  • You have the tester’s instinct to identify relevant test areas (i.e. security, accessibility, performance, mobile) and test a feature to completion.

  • You have solid development capabilities in .Net (C#) and OOP.

  • You have a bachelor’s degree in computer science or computer information systems, or you have equivalent work experience.



To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the


essential functions satisfactorily with or without reasonable accommodation.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
We’re hiring senior back-end engineers for our Seattle office, who are passionate about technology and education, to help build out our online video platform (Arc) for interactive learning. Our product team doesn't throw specs over some imaginary wall to engineering, and engineering doesn't throw code over some imaginary wall to QA. We all collaborate together. We highly value innovation, so much so that we have quarterly Hackweeks. A week each quarter to work on relevant pet projects and features. Woohoo! Most of our work is open source, even our primary product (Canvas). Check us out on Github: www.github.com/instructure.


This position is based in Seattle, and is not a remote opportunity. Our Seattle office is located downtown in the Westlake Center, 1601 5th Avenue.

jobs.title: DevOps Evangelist
jobs.content:
We're seeking someone talented, engaging, lively, fun, and highly technical to help us spread the word about our awesome product.


The main way this will happen is through writing - lots of great writing. Technical writing: Engineering blog posts, long­form articles, solution guides, FAQs, case studies, whitepapers, and more.


But there’s also a community engagement element – we’ll want you to become the “face” of Scalyr online (on forums, Twitter, Medium, LinkedIn, etc.) and, to a lesser extent, at conferences and meetups.


We should be clear right up front that you’ll need to have a strong technical background for this to work. Our product is a DevOps-focused tool to aggregate and instantly search logs, graph metrics, monitor server status, and alert when things go wrong. The previous sentence should make sense to you and perhaps even excite you. (Ideally, you should have an engineering background, have worked in DevOps, or otherwise have reasonably deep experience in these areas.)


Here are three examples of pieces we’ve written that very closely model the kind of writing we’ll want you to do:



  • Searching 20 GB/sec: Systems Engineering Before Algorithms

  • Zen and the Art of System Monitoring

  • How to Monitor Nginx: The Essential Guide


Of course we’ll give you lots of juicy source material to work with - straight from our engineering department - but we’ll expect you to craft it into something interesting and view-worthy. And you’ll be encouraged to source your own material & topics as well.


You’ll be working directly with our CEO and Head of Marketing, who can help edit and direct your writing projects if/as needed.


And your work will matter and have a huge impact on the business! Our blog posts get widely read and are a primary source of growth.

jobs.title: GRAPHIC DESIGNER-PACKAGING
jobs.content: New York, NY

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Frontend
jobs.content:
You Are Ready To Make An Impact

Zalando is transforming from Europe’s leading e-commerce company into a multi-service platform for fashion http://annual-report.zalando.com/2015/#en/platform. From logistics, to big brands, to manufactures - we’re building the platform that connects all people and parts of the fashion ecosystem.

We live Radical Agility
https://tech.zalando.com/blog/so-youve-heard-about-radical-agility...-video/. With the set of principles that we give to you and your team - Autonomy, Mastery, Purpose - we entrust youto shape the future of Zalando. You will be the one changing the world’s opinion of tech and fashion in Europe.

Your individual impact at Zalando is limitless. It is not only about growth and improvement - it is about inventing new things. We strongly believe that providing useful code to the world is a virtue. We strive to learn from and contribute to open source software http://zalando.github.io/#welcome for the betterment of Zalando and the tech community.

You Are Setting Standards

Variety. From Fashion Store to Brand Solutions to Business Assurance and Smart Logistics, you will join one of our 90+ teams to build, scale and continuously improve a variety of web applications that re-define the user experience of our 18 million active customers and partners.

Autonomy. Based on our microservices architecture, you and your team will own your code, and decide together on the technologies and tools to deliver as well operate large-scale web applications on PaaS/SaaS cloud (AWS).

Ownership. You and your team will work truly cross-functional with an entrepreneurial mindset and take ownership for the whole development cycle - from architecture design to testing to implementation and maintenance.

Excellence. You will join a team that is dedicated to delivering the highest standards when it comes to the scalability, performance and user centricity of our software. You will add value by leveraging current trends in software design, frameworks and RESTful web services.

You Are

Skilled. In working with JavaScript, HTML and CSS; modern frameworks (eg. Angular or Ember), testing tools (eg. Jasmine, Mocha or Karma) and libraries (eg. React or JQuery).

Courageous. In taking ownership and being accountable for the results of your decisions.

Motivated. In making a positive impact on our engineering culture and encouraging knowledge sharing (eg. in our internal Web Guild).

Ambitious. In delivering products that re-define the user experience and making bold decisions about the means and tools of delivery and operation.

You Benefit From

Culture. Culture of trust and empowerment, open source commitment, meetups, game nights, +70 internal technical and fun guilds, tech talks, product demos, Coderdojos, parties & events.

Perks. Competitive salary, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, public transport discounts, relocation assistance for internationals, free drinks & fruits, hardware of your choice.

Development. Tour of Mastery, extensive onboarding, personal branding support, opportunity to attend and speak at conferences.

Work Environment. Self-organized, autonomous teams and flexible working hours.

About Zalando

Zalando is Europe’s leading online fashion platform, doing business in 15 markets. Delivering first-class shopping experiences to our +18 million customers requires moving fast — with microservices, Agile processes and autonomous teams — and using cutting-edge, open source technologies. We are passionate about what we do and have fun while doing it. And we are willing to experiment and make mistakes: It’s how we grow.

Want to join us? Then go ahead and apply!!

If you need guidance or have any questions about our hiring processes, please contact recruiter Jorge Matos jorge.matos@zalando.de or/and Matthias Schmeißer matthias.schmeisser@zalando.de.

jobs.title: Software Developer -- Full Stack (US based remote)
jobs.content:
ABOUT US:

We have a program called Emotional ABCs (EmotionalABCs.com) and we're currently finishing up the fully interactive website for kids to do our program (video, interactive games, lessons, downloads, etc.). The website will be a subscription model for individuals and/or schools. Unfortunately, our original Software Engineer got promoted away from being able to do freelance.

The program is being created with the following:

Linux - operating system.

Python - the site backend.

Django: A tiny bit of work on this was previously done, and in Flask, but it will have to be moved to Django.

MySQL - the database.

uWSGI + NGINX - the web server combo.

AWS (Amazon Web Services) - website being built in AWS.

HTML + JavaScript + CSS + jQuery - The website itself--the part users directly interact with--is very basic modern HTML/CSS/JavaScript, using jQuery as the library.

WHAT’S BEEN PROGRAMMED/WHAT HASN'T BEEN:

  1. The front end is now 75% created by a previous programmer but it still need to have some of it finished out and add the payment options for the subscription payments which will be including regular credit cards with Authorize.net/Flagship, Amazon, and Paypal. (This should not be more than a week or two of the work.)

  2. Marketing Website. We have a version completed but also have a newer mockup (mostly pretty similar—that we'd prefer it be replaced with--it's not a complicated website) that is ready to be set up. We also have a mockup for a smaller/phone sized screen which is a little different than the full-sized web screen.

  3. Back office and core: (The bulk of what needs to be created. We have more details, of course.)

Admin management.

Customer management.

Direct subscription enhancement.

Customer email export.

Gift vouchers.

Gift voucher integration into account creation.

Gift voucher integration into billing.

jobs.title: PHP Developer
jobs.content:
The Royal Opera House continues to lead the way in opera, ballet, music and dance live on stage at our heritage theatre site here in Covent Garden, and reaching out to audiences across the UK and worldwide with our cinema screenings and content through other digital platforms. Central to our digital presence is our responsive website, which continues to grow and evolve, serving the digital needs of our audiences, customers and the ambitions of the organization. The website now accounts for over a third of the organization’s revenue and brings 450k monthly visitors.

We are now looking for an all-round PHP Developer to join our team of Developers, to design, develop, deploy, maintain and iterate the software and infrastructure that contribute to the development of our website and its associated services. Working to priorities set by the Head of Digital Development and the Lead Developer, you will have opportunity to work on a variety of projects and grow your knowledge of a wide range of tools, working collaboratively with colleagues within an agile environment.

The ideal candidate will be a strong team player with these qualities:

  • Sufficient skills and experience to design and develop software, primarily in PHP, for the Royal Opera House website and other digital platforms
  • A solid understanding of the web’s three main principles: HTTP, URI and HTML
  • Knowledge of relational database systems (including SQL, MySQL) and experience of web application frameworks
  • Well developed analytical skills and good documentation skills (including version control)
  • A related certification in the field of programming or development
  • A track record of working collaboratively in a team environment

We actively encourage applicants from diverse backgrounds and value the positive impact difference has on our teams.

Closing Date for applications: 8.00am, Tuesday 26th July 2016

Applicants must have work authorization for the UK.

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
We are currently seeking a highly motivated DevOps Engineer to join our team. 


We are looking for candidates with solid experience in cloud infrastructures and web stacks. This role will work closely with the engineering organization to deploy web stacks consisting of a mix of proprietary and open source technologies onto cloud infrastructures for the company and our customers.  


We are using the latest web stack technologies to deploy our advanced image and data analytics to virtually any enterprise infrastructure. Take a look at www.harrisgeospatial.com for information on our product offerings.


Note: We are in the process of relocating from Boulder to Broomfield.


Responsibilities include:



  • Configure and deploy to cloud infrastructures.

  • Customer and relationship-focused, process-driven, results-oriented, organized and self-directed.

  • Respond to application problems as they arise.

  • Ability to use a wide variety of open source technologies and cloud services. Be involved in selecting the technologies.

  • Ability to handle multiple deliverables, both scheduled and unscheduled, like planned releases, major/minor/emergency deployments, builds, etc.

  • Unafraid to roll up your sleeves. This role will evolve over time, and we'll want you to evolve with it!


This position could be located in Boulder, CO or Suffolk, VA

jobs.title: Senior Ruby on Rails Engineer
jobs.content:
We're a rapidly growing startup processing over 1 million events per day and are looking for an ambitious Senior Ruby on Rails Engineer to join our world-class team. We're building the largest community of collectors and disrupting the convention industry at the same time. You'll have the opportunity to work with incredible engineers, and be a major contributor in the architecture and development of both the Boxes and Tradeshow Platforms.  


If you're looking to be part of something incredibly special then this is your chance. Come join us!


Some Responsiblilites:



  • Implement and take charge of the software architecture and development of the Boxes and Tradeshow Platforms and APIs

  • Define and implement an agile development cycle 

  • Implement an efficient deployment cycle and ensure robust performance

  • Articulate clear goals to meet that strategy and track key metrics to measure success


Some other info:



  • To start, remote work considered

  • Offering relocation

  • Valuable Stock and Pay

jobs.title: Senior Software Design Engineer in Test
jobs.content:
Job Details





















Concur, a part of SAP, imagines the way the world should work, offering cloud-based services that make it simple to manage travel and expenses. By connecting data, applications and people, Concur delivers an effortless experience and total transparency into spend wherever and whenever it happens. Concur services adapt to individual employee preferences and scale to meet the needs of companies from small to large, so they can focus on what matters most. The company serves more than 30,000 clients representing more than 27 million users in over 150 countries.

Be a part of mobilizing the Perfect Trip!

Come be a part of the team that delivers innovative solutions enabling TripIt users organize and share their travel plans no matter where they book. We are looking for a Sr SDET to join the TripIt Team as we work to extend the functionality of our mobile applications to provide a high quality, intuitive workflow that increases adoption and customer satisfaction. This is a growing team and we’re looking for SDETs to join our agile development teams to contribute to all activities of the development process, but with a specialty in testing and quality. The team builds web services and user interfaces that are tested through continuous integration, resulting in monthly client and services releases across platforms (iOS, Android, etc…).

In the First 12 Months You Will:





  • Work with some of the smartest people in the business on test automation strategies, frameworks, and tests which will allow our delivery teams to innovate fast, with agility and high quality.

  • Work in a fast-paced Agile environment to deliver a smoother customer workflow for Expense management; managing project priorities and mitigating risks to deliver on release commitments

  • Provide expertise in driving quality-oriented design and development practices as it applies to both product code and test code

  • Participate in driving decisions in planning across teams

  • Work with other SDETs on Test Automation strategies across platforms and form factors. Identify new automation tools/approaches that will increase quality, development velocity, and decrease testing cost

  • Analyze bug trends/patterns and customer feedback to drive for better customer experiences

  • Work with other Agile team members (including PM and Dev) to drive feature planning to increase customer adoption

  • In the first 12 months, you will learn a ton, deliver great value to our customers, and have a lot of fun doing it.

jobs.title: Senior Front End Engineer
jobs.content:
Are you a senior UI engineer looking to make a big impact on a high profile project?


Ai is a leading interactive strategy, design, and development agency. We are looking for driven, self-motivated coders that are able to understand business problems and translate these into technical solutions. Ideal candidates should have concept-to-launch experience building scalable and secure transactional web applications. 


As a senior UI engineer you will be leading the design and construction of the interface interactivity of our clients’ sites through the masterful use of HTML, CSS, JavaScript and other related front-end technologies. You will own the technical front-end direction and collaborate with backend developers, information architects, business analysts and visual designers. 


Our typical engagement size and the size of our teams makes it possible for all team members to craft and shape the experiences we produce, with the full support of the leads and directors. The flexibility of our process makes for happy clients and the unusual ability to produce exactly the work you envision. If you want to make a real difference on a project, this is your dream role.


Off projects, you will be expected to teach your colleagues something they didn’t know in an area you are excited about. Is mobile app development your fantasy? How about responsive markup or rich, cross-browser compliant animations? Show us what you’ve got.

jobs.title: Director of Infrastructure
jobs.company: Boston Business Journal's Best Place to Work 2016
jobs.content:
The Motus Technology team is looking for an experienced, creative Director of Infrastructure to manage our application systems and tools. In this role, you will report directly to our VP of Technology, manage our DevOps engineers, and work closely with the Development and QA teams. You will be responsible for continuing to improve the reliability, security, and productivity of our production and staging, and development systems.


We run our systems on a cutting edge platform using AWS, Apache Mesos, Mesosphere Marathon and Chronos, and Docker.  We use Puppet, Terraform, and Ansible to manage our platform.  Experience with some or all of these technologies is extremely valuable in this position.


What You'll Do:



  • Build, develop, and manage a high-performing infrastructure and DevOps team to meet the needs of a rapidly growing and changing business in an even more rapidly changing technology landscape.

  • Architect and implement a security environment to manage sensitive information across the organization.

  • Enhance automation and processes to enable teams to deploy, manage, configure and scale their applications internally and at AWS, including SLA's, 24x7 monitoring, alerting and incident response.

  • Continuously improve our visibility into our systems and applications with advanced monitoring, metrics and log analytics.

  • Actively participate in high-level team activities such as suggesting architecture improvements, recommending process improvements and conducting tool evaluations.

  • Design, implement, and facilitate an annual infrastructure plan.

  • Manage infrastructure projects on and to budget.
