jobs.title: Cyber Software Engineer
jobs.content: We are looking for enthusiastic junior-to-mid level software developers with an interest in artificial intelligence and how to apply it to solve challenging real-world problems. You will use a variety of technologies, such as natural language processing, machine learning, probabilistic reasoning, data fusion, planning and optimization, and semantic processing. You will work in small project-oriented groups of scientists and software engineers to design and build working prototypes of intelligent decision-support tools.

jobs.title: Software Engineer/Prototype Developer II
jobs.content:
Charles River Analytics is an applied research and development (R&D) small business that thrives on developing new ideas to address user needs and advance the state-of-the-art of software support for the US Government.


As a Software Prototype Developer in Decision Management Systems, you will be instrumental in taking novel artificial intelligence concepts and proving they have potential through proof-of-concept web and desktop applications. You will have an opportunity to work on a variety of interesting and challenging problems, learn and apply emerging technologies as you see fit, experiment with new approaches, and grow within a small development team. The ideal candidate for this position has a voracious appetite to understand what needs to be done and then execute quickly. Since the majority of work we do is novel, you should thrive delivering in the face of changing or loosely-defined requirements. You will iterate quickly and closely with the development team, working across all levels of a technology stack you help shape.  


Initially, you will be working on developing a web application to help decision-makers compare and contrast various options to determine which is best across multiple criteria. On another project, you will focus on developing tools for analysts to create custom workflows that combine data in new and interesting ways using large-scale data processing frameworks. On these and future projects, you will incorporate artificial intelligence techniques (e.g., search and optimization algorithms, machine learning) into user-centered applications.

jobs.title: Software Developer to work on absolute cutting edge tech on VR program
jobs.content:
Why do you want to work in this role?



  • Cool opportunity to work on absolute cutting edge tech on VR program; to be in on the ground floor engaging the world with this new technology.

  • Working to take holographic video to other outlets, get really high end creators such as MTV, Disney, Nike to make holograms for video application.


  • Qualifications:



    • This is a relatively self-driven role

    • We need someone that is used to dealing with real time hardware systems and gathering and integrating data from that and controlling a system like that.

    • Computer Science Degree is preferred

    • Disqualifiers: Too much JAVA is not good; database applications would be a red flag because the coding there is high level and not close enough to working with the hardware.

    • This person needs to have experience optimizing programs that work with hardware/components and paying attention to performance, they will need to be aware of the bottlenecks in the system

    • Best vs. Average: Somebody that has worked in a production studio, worked for capture systems and have been exposed to content production a video stage or motion capture stage.

    • Performance Measures: A successful performer will provide robust solutions and minimal revisions would be a high performer; understanding or ability to work with production clients that may not be technical at all, like a director listen to them and what they need and be able to interpret that and help them meet their need. There will be a social component to this and to the right candidate it will be very appealing, it would be a bad fit for a lot of engineers.

jobs.title: Android Developer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Washington, D.C.
URL: http://savvyapps.com/

Note: We are only reviewing candidates from North America for this position.

Savvy Apps is a top app agency located just outside of Washington, D.C. We work on apps for national brands & high-profile startups and our work is regularly featured on app stores. We have a great culture, generous benefits, and a fun, results-oriented atmosphere (http://savvyapps.com/careers).

Results-oriented Development

Join a team where output is our primary concern. You'll spend almost of all of your time doing what you enjoy: writing code! If you find meetings, management buy-in, office politics, and documentation to justify decisions a drag, then you'll fit in perfectly at Savvy Apps.

We work with tools ranging from GitHub and Pivotal Tracker to having clear mockups and designs instead of long spec documents. To complement our own work, we use open source and commercial frameworks to speed development and create clean, maintainable and testable code. We also expect you to be ecstatic to have access to Google's design resources and always think about the end customer...fight for the users!

Perks...We Got 'Em

Healthcare…check. Vision…check. Dental…check. Plus we have a 401k profit sharing plan. At a minimum, you'll get 3% of your salary contributed by us, regardless if you contribute yourself. We also ensure that you get an ergonomic home office setup and supped up machine when joining the team. At least once a year we gather the entire team for a fun adventure. In the past we've done everything from high speed go kart racing to escape room competitions.

What's Next

Sound interesting? Click that apply link now or learn more about us. We look forward to seeing if you're savvy enough to join...well, Savvy.

To apply: http://savvyapps.com/developer-inquiry

jobs.title: Grass-Fed Interactive Front End Design/Developer
jobs.content:
Grass-Fed Front-End Designer/Developer


Full time: 45+ hours per week


Direct Report: Mike Danner, Director of Marketing


Location: Franklin, TN (Greater Nashville area)



Purpose of the Position


You'll be responsible for the digital execution inside our marketing platforms across our entire company. This includes turning wireframes and PSDs into full landing pages using all the cool new stuff, building email templates for our email team, creating and improving high quality store pages and beautiful experiences for our articles, videos and infographics.



Results


Key Areas you'll be influencing: Shopify, landing pages, webinar platforms, split test setup and configuration, our main site (WordPress) and our member's area video library.


Coordinate and execute responsive web design, mobile first design, configuration of a variety platforms and initiate split testing across multiple web properties


Manage your production workflow to ensure all projects are world-class and finished on time, every time


Make on-the-fly design decisions (Using your strong sense of typography and color)


Research and prototype tasteful and clean user experiences that push the bleeding edge of CSS (You are driven by an excitement and knowledge of emerging browser technologies and trends)


Cross browser, cross device, cross browser, cross device


Experience with Photoshop but open to other emerging graphics tools like Sketch

jobs.title: Senior Technical Consultant / Developer  Innovation
jobs.content:
Senior Technical Consultant / Developer on the Innovation Dev team are responsible for working with a global team of Product Owners and fellow developers to create world class solutions for incredibly difficult problems using cutting edge technologies, development processes, and conceptual frameworks.  Our solutions are scalable, reactive, elastic, concurrent, parallel, and deliver results to our clients in real-time with support from our DevOps team members. 


Responsibilities


· Research open source libraries for code that can accelerate development


· Constantly work to identify to speed up the development process


· Identify training or coaching opportunities that can accelerate team members


· Search for an experiment with new technologies that could accelerate development and deployment


· Work with a global, multi-cultural team to understand complex business requirements


· Write code that is beautiful, tested, and commented that you will want to tell your grandchildren about


· Help construct Reactive and constantly review existing code to ensure that it is Reactive


· Peer review the work from your fellow team members


· Identify and implement technologies that can improve the quality of our code.


· Write excellent documentation


Other Related Responsibilities


· Actively promotes and participates in brainstorming sessions


· Contribute to other open source projects


· Present at and attend conferences

jobs.title: Senior DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
You have already solid experience as a DevOps Engineer and would like to tackle a new challenge in an different environment? This is your chance!


Support our development and operations team in making our infrastructure even more robust and flexible. Help us to manage our mobile device cloud by enhancing the existing monitoring solution and automating as many administration tasks as possible.


Your responsibilities as Senior DevOps Engineer (m/f):



  • Design, setup and maintain our mobile device infrastructure

  • Drive the adoption of latest cloud hosting technologies

  • Consult us in making the TestObject cloud more scalable

  • Contribute to open source tools and frameworks we use on a daily base


Your Benefits:



  • An exciting and challenging job: You contribute to serious production grade software together with an experienced, friendly, agile team of developers and operations.

  • Benefits: You will be fully responsible for your projects and will receive a competitive salary alongside having the opportunity to directly impact our company’s success.

  • Team spirit: We are open-minded people and are happy to integrate new colleagues into our team. Team lunches, team events, after work … included.

  • Getting started: New in Germany or Berlin? We want you to feel at home here. We assist you with finding accommodation, obtaining a visa, learning German, and to establish your network in the Berlin Tech community.

jobs.title: Mid-Level Software Engineer - JavaScript, React / Redux
jobs.content:
At Eris Exchange, we are building the Future of Swaps, and we need your help! The financial crisis of 2008 revealed many of the problems of traditional over-the-counter swap contracts. We have developed a better alternative, and are challenging this multi-trillion dollar industry head-on.


As a modern futures exchange, software is at the core of everything we do. We have an opportunity for a software engineer, with a front-end focus, to join our development team and help us build the platform and tools that we depend on every day.


If you love programming in general, and particularly love developing interactive web-based user interfaces, you might be just who we’re looking for. Because we are a small team, you will have an opportunity to work on all aspects of our applications. You'll learn lots of new things, take on challenging problems, and make a huge impact.


One of our greatest strengths, and greatest challenges, is our ability to move very quickly and deploy new applications and features with a sense of urgency -- all without compromising the system stability and integrity that is required of us. To achieve this, we use a robust test-driven workflow, centered around GitHub pull requests, which allows us to deploy in confidence.


Our back-end systems are mostly written using JRuby, with MongoDB and RabbitMQ providing underlying support. You will also find some Java, C++, bash, and Python in our distributed Linux environment.


On the front end, we are building a brand new UI stack based on ES6, React, and Redux. This is a great opportunity to help shape our future! We have many exciting projects in the pipeline, including applications and tools for visualizing market data, and next-generation user interfaces for our market participants.

jobs.title: Front End Ruby on Rails Developer
jobs.content:
The iCentris team is dedicated to developing beautiful, usable, and practical web applications for our clients. We’re highly collaborative fast paced environment utilizing a combination of agile and waterfall project management methodologies. We believe in customer validation early in the process, verifying solutions with real data, and running with our industry expertise. The team includes UI/UX design, Ruby on Rails developers, DBA’s and project/product management where everyone on the team is responsible for the success of our products and ensures we’re leading the MLM industry in technology.


We're seeking a Ruby on Rails developer with strong analytical and problem solving skills who can identify solutions a task level as well as at a product level. Candidates must be highly skilled with developing in HTML/CSS/JavaScript technologies.  The ideal profile combines deep experience in web design and strong understanding of implementing markup. You must be able to demonstrate prior experience on web sites you’re proud to show off for their functionality and polished UI, appropriate use of JavaScript and standard CSS best practices.

jobs.title: Software Engineer  Data Integration
jobs.content:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, work with top-notch technologies and develop new tools to impress our 120 million users per month!

Our Leipzig Software Engineering team is looking for a Software Engineer to help develop our data integration processes and data pipelines from ideation to realization.


Your responsibilities:



  • Design, implement and support data models and ETL processes in a big data architecture stack.

  • Continuously develop our big data architecture stack to ensure we stay ahead of the pack.

  • Write and document tests on your own code changes.

  • Monitor and fix issues in multiple environments and communicate with your team to ensure they are informed of any issues that occur.


Essential requirements:



  • 2-3 years’ experience in software engineering or data engineering.

  • 1-2 years’ experience working with big data.

  • An excellent understanding of MySQL.

  • The ability to work well independently, comfortable in your technical understanding of the problems you will be dealing with.

  • You can find patterns in, and draw valuable findings from, large amounts of data.

  • Good communication skills: you will keep all relevant stakeholders well informed of current progress.

  • You speak English (our company language) fluently.


Preferred requirements:



  • Some working knowledge of Pentaho Data Integration Platform, Hadoop and Spark.

  • German language skills.


Life at trivago is...



  • The opportunity to develop personally and professionally with regular code workshops and Hackathons, as well as the chance to contribute to our tech blog.

  • Being an active member of our PHP, JavaScript, UI and data engineering guids.

  • The ability to push your ideas through to execution without being held back by bureaucracy.The freedom to embrace small-scale failures as a path to large-scale success.

  • The belief that factual proof, not seniority, determines which path to take.

  • Self-determined working hours based on measuring productivity through goals rather than number of hours spent in the office.


Additional information:



  • Please note that your CV and motivation letter must be written in English.

jobs.title: Software Engineer - .NET
jobs.content:
Ascend RMS is a complex, multi-tier application providing a retail management solution to independent bicycle dealers. This position reports to the Ascend RMS manager of Software Development and provides expertise in developing, designing, enhancing, and maintaining applications.   

The position is focused, but not limited to, developing software for Microsoft .NET Web Applications using ASP.NET MVC deployed to Windows Azure Services. 

 The successful Software Engineer will: 

Design, code, create test plans, test, debug and document applications  Communicate face-to-face with their peers and customers in a participatory environment  Ensure architectural, business, coding, design, and quality standards are adhered to  Be responsible for the quality and timeliness of their own work  Stay current with the latest technologies, methods and tools Be self-motivated and require minimal supervision   Position Requirements:

 Bachelor's degree in Information Systems or Computer Science or equivalent experience required  3-5 years of related experience required  Expertise with .NET in C#, OOP design patterns, Source Control and Unit Testing is required  Experience with Windows Azure, ASP.NET MVC, and ORM tooling required  Experience with SQL Server 2008 R2+ and/or Azure SQL Database, SQL queries, stored procedures, and basic administration required  Exceptional business and technical listening, oral, and written skills required -Depth understanding of Software Development/Engineering Methodology in Development, Production, and Testing Environments with Standards Documentation required  Experience with Point of Sale (POS) Systems and retail sales environment a plus  Experience with the Agile Development methodology is a plus

jobs.title: iOS Developer
jobs.content:
ForeFlight is looking for an iOS developer to join our team. This position is for a unique and technically well-rounded individual with experience building and shipping iOS apps. This person will help us create the next generation of ForeFlight Mobile on the iPad and iPhone.


Technically, this person is experienced in Objective-C and Cocoa development, with a track record of shipping exquisitely-designed apps. This person has a solid understanding of UIKit, database design with SQLite/Core Data, communicating with web services, and memory management with and without ARC. This person can hit the ground running on iOS 8 technologies, writing rock-solid code with blocks, GCD, Swift, and Auto Layout. This person is naturally curious, exploring new technologies in order to stay current, but balances the use of new and old to ensure that execution is priority.


Professionally, this person is driven to execute, deliver, and complete projects independently, seeking advice and direction from team members when needed, and plowing ahead to completion when the path forward is clear. This person will be able to point to specific examples that highlight the individuals ability to meet the objectives outlined above, and references will confirm this person’s unique abilities.


This position is based in our Houston, TX office. A pilot-coder, or individual looking to pursue his or her private pilot license, is a plus. Benefits include medical insurance, 401(k) with matching, and flight training reimbursement.

jobs.title: iOS Mapping Developer
jobs.content:
Job Description


ForeFlight is looking for an iOS developer to join our map team. This position is for a unique and technically well-rounded individual with experience building and shipping iOS apps. This person will help us create the next generation of mapping technologies for ForeFlight Mobile on the iPad and iPhone.


Technically, this person is experienced in Objective-C and Cocoa development, with a track record of shipping exquisitely-designed apps. This person has a solid understanding of UIKit, database design with SQLite/Core Data, communicating with web services, and memory management with and without ARC. This person can hit the ground running on iOS 8 and iOS 9 technologies, writing rock-solid code with blocks, GCD, and Auto Layout. This person is naturally curious, exploring new technologies in order to stay current, but balances the use of new and old to ensure that execution is priority.


Professionally, this person is driven to execute, deliver, and complete projects independently, seeking advice and direction from team members when needed, and plowing ahead to completion when the path forward is clear. This person will be able to point to specific examples that highlight the individual's ability to meet the objectives outlined above, and references will confirm this person’s unique abilities.


This position is based in Portland, ME.  A pilot-coder, or individual looking to pursue his or her private pilot license, is a plus. Benefits include medical insurance, 401K with matching, and flight training reimbursement. Relocation reimbursement will be provided if moving to Portland.

jobs.title: Web Developer
jobs.content:
Job Description


ForeFlight is looking for a motivated web engineer to join our development team. This individual will be responsible for developing and maintaining our web based map applications.  Various elements of the site will include authenticating sessions, presenting various types of aeronautical data, integrating with a browser based mapping engine and communicating with back-end web services.


Technically, this person must have proven experience with Javascript and HTML across multiple browsers. Professionally, this person has a track record of completing projects independently, is driven to execute, seeks advice and direction from team members when needed, and plows ahead to completion when the path forward is clear.


The successful applicant will be working closely with our Sr. Software Developers and Sr. Graphic Designers.


This position is based in Portland, ME.  A pilot-coder, or individual looking to pursue his or her private pilot license, is a plus. Benefits include medical insurance, 401K with matching, and flight training reimbursement. Relocation reimbursement will be provided if moving to Portland.

jobs.title: Javascript Web Developer / Ember Developer
jobs.content: We are looking for the next all-star cast member of our development team! We have adopted ember as our primary web framework, and this new position is crucial to helping us ship new products and improve existing products built from a legacy web framework.

jobs.title: ASP.Net Developer Wanted To Join Fun, Growing Company
jobs.content:
Looking for a mid-level developer familiar with ASP.Net 4+ with MVC and Webforms to begin work on projects using a proprietary e-commerce platform developed in-house. Developer would be trained and mentored until comfortable with tasks. Platform interfaces with MS SQL databases, so working with SQL is essential, as well as Entity Framework and Linq to SQL.


Programmers meet once a week to share ideas, gotchas, expectactions, etc.


Programmer can expect to work on one to three projects at any given time. HTML and JS will be provided to them along with a functional and technical spec, a dedicated Project Manager and a senior developer for guidance. The programmer will generally lead the project from beginning to end

jobs.title: Python Developer
jobs.content:
Kinnek is looking for experienced, talented, and hungry engineers who are looking to build something truly great. We are an engineering-focused startup: both of our founders are engineers and the majority of our team are developers. We've built a huge amount of infrastructure to get us to this point, but with the diverse and complex set of problems in our space, there will never be a shortage of exciting new products, features, and systems for us to build. We have a uniquely flat in hierarchy and you will likely have more autonomy over your own code than you are typically used to.

AMONG THE MANY HATS YOU'LL WEAR AND SHARE WITH YOUR FELLOW BACK-END ENGINEERS: -Collaborating closely with our business team and Front-End Engineers to build new products, features, and services for our platform, as well as iterating on existing ones. -Making sure Kinnek is fully-equipped to handle our rapidly growing marketplace and user base. This includes everything from improving the speed and reliability of parts of our site to helping us make huge technology decisions that will have long-lasting effects on where our platform can go. -Analyzing our massive amounts of data to develop ways of improving the Kinnek user experience as well as building admin-facing analytical tools that make other teams at Kinnek tick.

SPECIFICALLY, WE ARE LOOKING FOR SOMEONE WHO HAS EXPERIENCE IN THE FOLLOWING AREAS: Required: Python Required: Designing, building, testing, and maintaining large-scale software applications like it ain't no thang; Highly Preferred: Django or a similar server-side MVC web framework; SQL Optional Bonus: AWS, Google App Engine, or similar cloud platforms; background in quantitative research / data science;

We are a close-knit, highly-motivated bunch looking to solve some big problems while having a little of fun along the way. Share your resume if you want to come along for the ride!

jobs.title: Front End Engineer
jobs.content:
Kinnek is changing the way small businesses make large purchases.  We are launched, funded, and already helping thousands of businesses make millions of dollars of purchases. We are an engineering-focused company: both founders are engineers and the majority of our team are developers.  Our team is uniquely flat in hierarchy and you will likely have more autonomy over your code than what you are previously accustomed to.

We are looking for an experienced front-end developer to spearhead the implementation of all of our exciting new ideas.  You won't be just fixing bugs and maintaining the codebase - you will be building exciting new features, analyzing metrics, re-designing complex interfaces, and making important technical and product decisions.

SPECIFICALLY, WE NEED SOMEONE WHO HAS PRIOR WORK EXPERIENCE IN THE FOLLOWING AREAS:

Required: HTML, CSS, responsive design, Javascript and Angular or some Javascript MVC framework Preferred: Some experience with Python, Django or some MVC web framework, and some asset management such as Gulp.

We are a close-knit, highly-motivated bunch looking to solve some big problems while having a bit of fun along the way. Share your resume if you want to come along for the ride!

jobs.title: Sr Android Developer
jobs.content:
Atlassian is looking for a few passionate Android Engineers (mid and Sr level) to join our Mobile Team! This is a new team that will be housed in a brand new office in the heart of downtown Mountain View. The key responsibilities of the team are:



  • Research and prototyping with newest mobile technology

  • Development of both reusable software components and libraries as well as consumer facing mobile applications

  • Setting the standards and best practices

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer - Mobile Development
jobs.content:
Join the team that’s changing the future of healthcare: 


What if your work helped a person make a decision that got him to the emergency room just in time? Or helped a doctor talk to a mom about her child’s illness? And what if the job you showed up for every day made even one person decide to take a walk instead of sitting on the couch eating potato chips? 



The best health education in the world only helps people if they can get to it when they need it. As a senior software developer at Healthwise, you’ll be part of an innovative team that designs, develops, and deploys the technology that delivers health education to people during an office visit, in the hospital, or wherever they are—on any device. 



Your experience and your passion for software engineering and making a profound difference in health care make you an ideal candidate. And Healthwise, a nonprofit organization makes an ideal workplace where you can thrive. Since 1975, the Healthwise mission has been to help people make better health decisions. This mission—combined with our innovative spirit—has led to health education and technological solutions that clinicians use to deliver education as part of care.



Our Boise campus boasts a fully equipped gym; walking, running, and biking trails; healthy snacks; company bicycles; and a host of exercise classes—all on-site. Our offices are on the road to the local ski area. And we work in beautiful buildings, filled with natural light and the best of regional art. 



Here’s what you can do: 



  • Lead and work alongside the team to develop products and systems that make it easier for health care professionals to deliver health education and make it easier for people to access it. 

  • Be an inspiration, expert, and leader for your team and for others across our organization while bringing your best thinking and advocacy for advancing technology.  

  • Innovate, create, and produce technological solutions for our clients to help the people they serve make better health decisions. 

  • Take on other duties as assigned. (Yeah, the day-to-day stuff happens here, too.)



You’ve got this:



  • You’re driven, but not by your ego; you see potential in others and want to help them succeed.

  • You’re agile in temperament and discipline; you want to continuously deliver awesomeness.

  • You’re flexible and can switch tasks as priorities change.

  • You have in-depth experience in leveraging JavaScript, SPA frameworks like Ember, React.js, and Angular as well as related technologies and patterns.

  • You can explain the box model to a four-year-old.

  • You’ve wrestled with module bundlers and transpiling and came out on top.

  • You can intelligently speak to recent advancements in front-end technologies and shifts in the development landscape.

  • You have a favorite element, and it’s not DIV or TABLE.



To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the


essential functions satisfactorily with or without reasonable accommodation.

jobs.content:
Join the team that’s changing the future of healthcare: 


What if your work helped a person make a decision that got him to the emergency room just in time? Or helped a doctor talk to a mom about her child’s illness? Our Boise campus boasts a fully equipped gym; walking, running, and biking trails; healthy snacks; company bicycles; and a host of exercise classes—all on-site. jobs.title: Senior Windows Kernel Engineer
jobs.content:
About Barkly


We’re passionate about helping organizations feel and be more secure. Our mission is to bring enterprise-class security to all organizations by delivering a new type of protection for both laptop and desktop endpoint devices. We are implementing a SaaS-based, patents-pending solution that automatically recognizes and immediately disrupts new attacks not previously profiled.


We’re looking for individuals that bring deep technical expertise and a drive for making the world a safer place for commerce and community.


Your day to day:



  • Write high-quality, maintainable code with extensive test coverage designed to detect and stop malware at the Windows kernel level.  You’ll be participating in all stages of software creation from design and architecture through deployment and support.

  • Participate in standups and contribute to all aspects of the agile development process from design to implementation to testing.

  • Contribute to and learn from an incredible team on the ground floor of a game-changing startup.

jobs.title: MySQL Database Administrator
jobs.content:
What you'll do:





Billtrust is seeking a passionate Database Administrator (DBA) who will be part of a dynamic DBA team in charge of the database architecture, administration and management of our enterprise, large scale database systems. You will play a key role in managing and improving the health, availability and scalability of our enterprise MySQL database instances in a 24x7 hosted environment.



  • Provide DBA support across the dev, QA, staging and production environments

  • Install and configure MySQL instances, databases and replication for optimum performance

  • Implement high availability, scalability, disaster recovery and backup/recovery solutions

  • Automate routine DBA tasks through scripting (bash etc.) and/or open source tools

  • Setup monitoring solutions to pro-actively capture, analyze and resolve database related issues

  • Research and implement solutions to leverage features in the latest versions of MySQL and NoSQL technologies such as MongoDB, Elastic Search etc.

  • Collaborate with application dev/QA teams on implementing database best practices and reviewing/optimizing SQL code

  • Participate in 24x7 on-call rotation and provide off-hours support

jobs.title: Director Software Engineering
jobs.content:
The ESPN Mobile Engineering team develops some of the most downloaded and successful sports apps, including the ESPN app, WatchESPN, Tournament Challenge, and many others. This is an engineering position to lead our iOS engineering teams. The ideal candidate will be passionate about iOS, technology, apps, and sports.


Responsibilities



  • Manage multiple teams of engineers and contractors

  • Work with product management and design to define product roadmap

  • Manage competing priorities

  • Develop team members

  • Guide decisions on architecture and technical strategy

  • Keep abreast of industry trends and technologies and apply them quickly

  • Bring predictability to the team’s overall performance

jobs.title: Wanted: Data Scientists for our Data Driven Analytics Products, Nuremberg
jobs.content:
GfK is one of the biggest global insights providers, with an incredible data landscape: Sales data, purchase insights, global trends, consumer profiles, cross-media exposure, Social Media buzz – all these sources contributing to a holistic, integrated understanding of markets, preferences, and behaviors.


We are convinced that by bringing this data landscape together with the best Data Scientists and consultants, we can create data products and services of tremendous value. For this reason, we have founded our new global DDA (Data-Driven Analytics) unit that leverages our data landscape, our technical solutions, and our expertise in order to develop and launch a new premium analytics offering for our clients.


Are you interested in taking this journey with us? Join our team!


For our DDA unit, which will combine agile start-up atmosphere with the advantages of a Global Player, we are looking for exceptional (Senior) Data Scientists who want to become part of an interdisciplinary and international team and contribute to an important global initiative: Leave your footprint and make an impact on GfK’s position in the analytics market!


Concrete tasks will include



  • contributing to the refinement and ramp-up of the DDA technology and (Big) Data analytics stack (which includes e.g., testing new tools, defining processes and blueprints, developing recommendations on how to handle specific data challenges),

  • developing scalable, cloud-based analytics “as a service” software products that leverage GfK’s data landscape for answering important business questions of our clients,

  • driving successful, data-agnostic analytics projects, by

    • supporting our DDA “Analytics Services” teams in consulting our clients with regard to data-related business challenges,

    • translating the client challenges into analytic designs and data requirements,

    • carrying out the analyses using suitable Data Science tools and our Big Data integration platform

    • presenting the results convincingly, or developing interactive data products.





Requirements


We are looking for team players with a hands-on approach, who appreciate the opportunity to work in an international environment on product developments and projects of strategic importance. A close collaboration with both our consulting/business experts and our technology experts should be appreciated – we are all part of one new, integrated team and work towards the same objective!



Developing scalable data products will be at the core of our DDA unit. Therefore, experience in turning Data Science algorithms and approaches into products will be very beneficial. A thorough understanding of how to address marketing challenges (such as pricing, product launch forecasting, etc.) analytically will be helpful, too.



Individuals who want to have direct client contact will get the possibility through challenging ad hoc projects. While our aim for solutions and data products of extraordinary quality requires research-driven individuals, a strong commercial focus and a very good understanding of how to address real-world business challenges with analytics solutions are equally important.



We are convinced that Data Science works best in teams – nobody knows everything. Hence, we look for a variety of profiles with complementary skills, such as:




  • Expert statistical modeling skills (e.g, predictive models)

  • Expert knowledge of analytic programming languages (R is required, but knowledge of further languages, such as Python or Julia is a plus)

  • Experience with using cloud-based analytics platforms, such as Microsoft Azure or Amazon Web Services

  • (Expert) skills with regard to developing data products and transforming algorithms into scalable software

  • (Expert) skills with regard to performance optimized programming (e.g., parallelization, code optimization, C++ integration in R)

  • (Expert) data visualization/visual analytics skills, also using standard tools, such as Microsoft Power BI or Tableau

  • (Expert) knowledge of optimization, data integration, data mining, and machine learning algorithms

  • Experience with handling and integrating data from different sources – structured and unstructured, small or big.

  • (Expert) skills with regard to working in Big Data environments (e.g., Hadoop, Map/Reduce, Pig, Hive)

  • (Expert) skills with regard to sourcing of open data (e.g., from Web APIs)

  • Solid to good understanding of Big Data Architectures

  • (Expert) skills with regard to database handling, in particular SQL

  • Ability to think creatively in addressing real-world business problems analytically, while maintaining the balance between “art & science”

  • Ability to translate sophisticated analytical information into understandable recommendations

  • Strong business understanding – ideally with in-depth experience in a certain industry (e.g., Technology, Media, FMCG,…)

  • Proven project management skills

  • Proven communication, presentation and client facing skills

  • Ability to confidently and clearly communicate in an English business environment (required!)

jobs.title: Freelance Environmental Designer
jobs.content: San Francisco, CA

jobs.title: Developers for healthcare software platform
jobs.content:
Note: this job is open to US Residents only.  Foreign nationals can apply but only if you live within the US.


-


What we do actually matters. CareEvolution's HIEBus platform creates better patient outcomes.


Simply stated, we make web and mobile applications for healthcare. Under the covers, though, a lot more is going on - we have developed a robust software platform that ingresses data, programmatically links that data across institutions on a per-patient basis, and supplies APIs to consume, project, modify, and aggregate that data in all sorts of interesting and useful ways.  Please read our company page for a more detailed explanation of what we do and who we are.


We are looking for software people to help us build out the platform, write data adapters (drivers) to automatically ingress data from hundreds of data sources - in realtime, and to create the next generation of healthcare apps.


At CareEvolution, we don't tell you what to do. Part of the work at CareEvolution is determining what to do. We've designed our organization specifically to promote creativity, innovation, and focus on solving some of the most difficult problems in healthcare.


Visit http://letsfixhealthcare.com to learn more - or contact us (resume@careevolution.com) - and we'll explain what CareEvolution is all about.

jobs.title: Software Developer - Android
jobs.content:
Hulu is seeking a Software Developer on Android with a passion for mobile applications to join our team in Seattle, WA. Our small, high performance team is responsible for the apps that millions of Hulu users experience their premium TV content on every day. We strive to create and maintain the best Video on Demand (VOD) application on a broad set of Android devices, from phones to tablets, from older hardware to the bleeding edge of devices coming out.


In this role, you will work with other software developers to improve, rework, and reimagine our Android application. We also work closely with the backend services that our apps consume to provide a seamless cross-platform experience. Successful candidates will have solid experience developing and releasing mobile applications, a passion for building quality software, and critical eye for quality and attention to detail.


We would love to see samples of your work. If you’ve got something to show, please make sure your resume or application links to your Github account or an app in the Play store.

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
Technology at Avaaz is scaling fast, and we need a DevOps Engineer whose skills connect the worlds of Software Engineers, DBAs, and Systems Administrators. This role will support maintaining and expanding Avaaz’s infrastructure to improve the way our software is developed.

The ideal candidates will have experience in system administration, developing software using modern languages and frameworks and as well a good understanding of SQL and non-SQL data stores. They will be able to advise on decisions regarding hardware performance for a given software, and will also know when we should modify the underlying infrastructure or fix a particular piece of code. They are familiar with test automation and applications that work at scale.

The DevOps Engineer does not need to be an expert in all areas, but rather have a broad range of experiences in different areas with excellent team and communication skills.

Responsibilities: -Manage our deployment and testing infrastructure, supporting the implementation of Continuous Integration. -Refine development processes to make interactions between Software Engineers and Administrators constant, fluid, and productive. -Participate in architectural decision-making in support of scalability. -Automate repetitive tasks required to maintain a secure and up to date operational environment, eventually supporting the Engineering team with hands-on coding. -Develop, improve, maintain, and document infrastructure management systems. -Work with other teams to build, test and roll out systems.

Qualifications: 2-3 years of experience as a Software Engineer, and 2-3 years of experience as a Systems Administrator. 1-2 years of experience working at large-scale applications. 2-3 years working in Amazon AWS environments, particularly VPC’s with an understanding of the AWS API. Intimate knowledge of Linux (Redhat/CentOS) and at least 2 years experience managing Linux in enterprise-class environments (more than 10 servers). Experience with infrastructure as code (Puppet/Chef/others). Experience managing application build pipelines and continuous integration environments. Strong fundamentals in Python/Ruby and strong bash scripting skills. Comfortable working with a range of storage engines (MySQL, Elasticsearch, Redis) and knowing when each type is appropriate. Understanding of network and application security with deep understanding of all layers involved in web communications, including experience in network debugging. Must be a strong culture match including having a growth mindset and a deep commitment to world change and the Avaaz mission. Experience at large-scale web companies is a huge plus. Fluency in English is a requirement.

Location: Avaaz is a virtual organisation, with most of our work done over email, telephone and Skype. Our staff are based in cities all over the world and meet at team retreats twice per year. Avaaz covers office costs, either to establish a home office or to rent one, and we support staff to house themselves in local similar organisations when preferred.

Compensation and Benefits: Salary varies with location and experience, but is highly competitive with leading nongovernmental organisations. Benefits also range with location, but include 5 weeks paid vacation per year.

jobs.title: Senior Developer
jobs.content:
Avaaz is changing the world, and we’ll give you the means to change it, too. Our team is a place to exercise your creativity and your leadership, while building never-before-seen tools for one of the world’s top online activism organisations. You can let your imagination run wild figuring out how to grow the platform and tools, improve rapid-iterative processes and integrate new technologies.

We are a nimble team working on creating opportunities to bring about the world most people everywhere want -- one of justice, peace, and freedom. The work environment is quite unique: whether you’re in the office or working from home, our collaborative culture ensures everyone is heard and treated respectfully, with a strong focus on personal development.

Our tech build comprises the latest technologies (cloud computing, distributed systems, big data) using great languages (Python, PHP, JS) with proven and cutting-edge datastores (MySQL, Redshift, MongoDB, Redis, Memcache). At Avaaz, your work will have an impact on a huge scale: we have more than 40 million members, who have taken over 200 million actions, told over 500 million friends about Avaaz campaigns and donated more than $50 million online.

Our global and distributed tech team creates beautiful, efficient code that works across browsers, platforms and localisations. It’s backed by developers with a proven track record of designing, building and debugging large web applications.

We’re roaming the world in the search for challenge-driven hard-working developers and senior developers with excellent spoken and written communication in English who are able to adapt and learn, with talents for creativity and abstract thinking. The quest is for people who fit that profile; we know specific skills can always be trained and developed.

Let’s chat -- I’m pretty sure you’ll want to join us.

We are currently hiring senior developers in the Americas, EU and African timezones.

Salary is competitive in the non profit space with generous benefits but we can not match corporate tech salaries.

jobs.title: API Architect
jobs.content:
Job description

API Architect for a Leading Fintech company

When it fits, you feel it! Together with a team of fellow architects, 10+ PO’s and highly interactive scrum teams, you are a key player in defining Binckbank’s future products and services integration.

You are our subject matter expert when it comes to all things concerning APIs and as such can support a growing number of teams with your expertise during their participation in a variety of epics. You will take the lead in our migration from an enterprise service bus towards APIs. A technical vision is needed to ensure that best practices in the field of API design are adhered within our company. Nevertheless, your role extends far beyond being the internal reference point of API excellence: You will define the strategy for third-party consumption of Binckbank’s public APIs. In this you collaborate with product owners and marketing experts (to position our API solutions, e.g. through Hackathons). Engagement with external developer communities to encourage the use of your API landscape as a foundation for the development of new, unexpected products is also required.

If you're self-motivated and looking for a fast-paced, agile, and nimble environment to build highly visible, high traffic customer experiences, then find your fit at Binckbank!

Responsibilities:

  • Take charge of Binckbank’s strategy for both internal (private) and external (public) APIs
  • Provide leadership to further decomposition of Binckbank’s application landscape through an effective API approach
  • Provide expert support to a team of 5 developers (and counting) towards excellence in their development of Binckbank’s public APICollaborate with internal and external users of your team’s APIs to ensure that their needs are met
  • Develop our firm’s API excellence and boost constructive working relationships across both departments and borders
  • Design and build scalable, secure, and extensible APIs that power engaging customer experiences
  • Implement a robust API management platform for orchestration, developer sign-up, API docs, caching, security, and more ª Drive speed of high volume digital channels through performant API architecture and tuning
  • Own the code, spending 40%-50% of the time in hands-on activities
  • Champion the use of web standards, REST architectural style and conventions, and industry best practices
  • Guard the integrity of the company’s API as a public contract

Requirements

  • Extensive experience designing and developing RESTful APIs
  • Deep knowledge on REST API design concerns, with opinions about HATEAOS, PUT vs PATCH, API versioning, and more
  • Broad knowledge of web standards relating to APIs (OAuth, CORS, JWT, etc.)
  • Metrics-oriented and concerned about testing throughput, latency, security and other non-functional requirements
  • Extensive coding experience with either Java/Spring or Node.js
  • Experience with a leading API Management platform (e.g. Apigee, Mashery, Layer7)
  • Knowledge about cloud computing (IaaS / PaaS) on major providers (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform)
  • Strong command of object-oriented design principles and prevailing design patterns
  • Able to convince teams and management of embracing API principles

About Us

  • Binck is Fintech
  • International (Netherlands, Belgium, France, Spain, Italy)
  • Growing
  • Young of age and culture
  • Very mature agile change practice
  • Large internal software practice

If you have any further questions regarding the vacancy, please feel free to contact hiring manager Hedwig van Gastel.

Please apply online via the link.

Click here to apply

Agency calls not appreciated

Keywords: Vacancy, Full-time, Amsterdam, IT architect, API solutions.

jobs.title: Software Engineer Backend
jobs.content:
You Are Ready To Make An Impact


Zalando is transforming from Europe’s leading e-commerce company into a multi-service platform for fashion. From logistics, to big brands, to manufactures - we’re building the platform that connects all people and parts of the fashion ecosystem.


We live Radical Agility. With the set of principles that we give our teams - Autonomy, Mastery, Purpose - we entrust them to shape the future of Zalando.You will be the one changing the world’s opinion of tech and fashion in Europe.


What makes your individual impact at Zalando limitless is the possibility to tackle and create new opportunities. At Zalando, it is not only about growth and improvement - it is about inventing new things. We strongly believe that providing useful code to the world is a virtue. We strive to learn from and contribute to open source software for the betterment of Zalando and the tech community.


You Are Setting Standards


Variety. From Fashion Store to Brand Solutions to Business Assurance and Smart Logistics, you will join one of our 90+ teams to build, scale and continuously improve a variety of products that create value for our platform.


Autonomy. Based on our microservices architecture, you and your team will own your code, and decide on the technologies and tools to deliver as well operate large-scale applications on PaaS/SaaS cloud (AWS).


Ownership.You and your team will work like a startup and take ownership for the whole development cycle - from architecture design to testing to implementation and maintenance.


Excellence. You will join a team that is dedicated to delivering the highest standards when it comes to the quality of your code and implementation. You will add value by leveraging current trends in software design, architecture and web services.

jobs.title: Customer Operations Specialist
jobs.content:
DealDash is looking for talented and motivated individuals who are interested in joining a company with startup roots that has now grown into an e-commerce success.
This is an English language position within our Customer Support team.

You will need to demonstrate you're capable of independent work, fresh ideas and the drive to be part of a successful team. Successful applicants will begin with a two-week training period, following which the work becomes a remote based role.

This is a 5 day per week position with shifts that may be from Mon-Sun and may include evening work.

Values are important, this is what we believe in at DealDash

  • Talk with, listen to, and understand your customer. Treat them as you would want to be treated yourself.
  • You can truly learn anything. Get off the couch! Develop new skills and expand your perspective.
  • Take ownership. Take initiative. Take action. YOU are the Company.
  • Break assumptions. Pursue unconventional ideas.
  • Data is worth more than 1,000 smart opinions. Data is everywhere, use it!
 

Some Fun Facts About DealDash

  • Our team is spread out over 6 countries
  • 14 nationalities
  • We offer a $6,000 resignation bonus to anyone who resigns
  • We believe people who work at DealDash should only do so because they love it, not because it's their only option financially)
  • Every employee talks to Customers every week, no matter what your function! We love our Customers!
  •  92% of our revenue comes from repeat buyers! (And we are growing!)
 
We encourage applicants from the following locations:
  • Canada
  • USA (Minnesota & Illinois only)
  • Finland
  • UK
  • Spain
  • Germany
  • Estonia
  • Hungary 

Meet James, one of our team members â https://youtu.be/WRcYDQf81E0?rel=0

This position is available immediately, so please apply ASAP!

To apply: Please apply at: https://dealdash.workable.com/jobs/220403

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer (EU)
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Malta
URL: http://www.hotjar.com

We are looking for exceptional and ambitious developers who enjoy working both on front-end and back-end development. This role is ideal for somebody who is passionate about building great online apps and wants to use their skills to have a real impact on a product used by over 120,000 users from 184 different countries. We are looking for a developer who loves being part of a team but is also self-motivated and likes the idea of working remotely.

What skills are we looking for?

As a full-stack developer in the Hotjar tech team, you will be working on developing and improving features built primarily in JavaScript, AngularJS, Python and PostgreSQL. You will be creating production grade JavaScript and Python code and will have the opportunity to implement solutions designed to handle incredibly high levels of traffic. You will need to be highly process driven and eager to learn new technologies and programming languages. You will also be communicating directly with our users on a regular basis to investigate issues and truly understand how your work is being used.

Job Perks:
  • Work remotely from the comfort of your own home
  • A free Kindle and Fitbit when you join Hotjar
  • €3,000 home office budget
  • Yearly personal development budget
  • Access to thousands of online courses
  • Attend conferences around the world
  • Regular company meetups

Note: Although this is a remote position, we are currently only seeking candidates in timezones between UTC-2 and UTC+4.

To apply: Apply on http://careers.hotjar.com/o/full-stack-developer.

jobs.title: Senior IT Administrator
jobs.content:
The European Molecular Biology Laboratory (EMBL) is one of the highest ranked scientific research organisations in the world. The Headquarters Laboratory is located in Heidelberg (Germany), with additional sites in Grenoble (France), Hamburg (Germany), Hinxton (UK) and Monterotondo (Italy).

The Hamburg Unit of the European Molecular Biology Laboratory (EMBL) carries out research in structural biology and operates leading research infrastructures for applications in life sciences, which are made available to an international research community. These facilities require state-of-the art IT infrastructures, with high demands for data storage, transfer and computational power.

Reporting to the Head of Unit, key responsibilities are:


  • Installation and maintenance of desktop systems and servers


  • Management and Helpdesk support on Linux, Windows and Macintosh platforms


  • Maintenance of the local area network, backup and data storage systems


  • Management of IT upgrade projects


  • Supervision of the IT team members

jobs.title: Social Media/ Community Marketer
jobs.content:
At Recruitee, we believe great teams are built together. Recruitee is a cloud-based hiring solution. Founded two years ago, our cloud-recruitment platform has grown from 30 beta users to over 1000 users worldwide â from startups like Usabilla and Hotjar, to corporate clients like Vlisco and TransIP. Our team works remotely in both Poznan (development team, design, growth hacking) and Amsterdam (marketing, sales, support). We're proud to be mentioned as one of the fastest growing startups in the Netherlands. 

Do you know what it takes to grow an online community? We're looking for a community marketer to manage the communication with leads and followers in our online communities and social media accounts, as well as the distribution of our content. We are a fast-growing start-up and this will be a new created position in the team. Your input for creative inbound marketing strategies will be important.

Responsibilities:

  • Build and manage the companyâs social media profiles and presence, including Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn and additional channels that may be deemed relevant.
  • Write content based on our content strategy and research.
  • Distribute shareable content appropriate for specific networks to spread both our brand and our content.
  • Monitor and engage in relevant social discussions about our company, competitors, and/or industry, both from existing leads and customers as well as from brand new audiences.
  • Work alongside the content marketer to help distribute content that educates and entertains our audience and supports marketing goals.
  • Drive consistent, relevant traffic and leads from our social network presence.
  • Explore new ways to engage and identify new social networks to reach our target buyers.
  • Track, measure, and analyze all initiatives to report on social media ROI.

We offer:

  • Test, learn and grow fast
  • International remote team 
  • Market conform salary
  • Yearly team holiday trip

Requirements
  • BA/BS degree or equivalent work experience.
  • Extensive writing skills (with proven examples)
  • Active and well-rounded personal presence in social media, with a command of each network and their best practices.
  • Excellent communicator and creative thinker, with an ability to use both data and intuition to inform decisions.
  • Proficiency in using social media software to monitor social media conversations. You will be our ear to the ground to route the appropriate marketer, sales rep, and/or support rep to social conversations.
  • Working remotely for this position is fine. It would be a plus if you are available to meet in Amsterdam a few times a year (travel cost will be reimbursed).

To apply: Apply here: https://jobs.recruitee.com/o/social-media-community-marketer

jobs.title: Mobile App Developer
jobs.content:
Abbott is a global healthcare company devoted to improving life through the development of products and technologies that span the breadth of healthcare. With a portfolio of leading, science-based offerings in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals and branded generic pharmaceuticals, Abbott serves people in more than 150 countries and employs approximately 73,000 people. Please note that candidates need to be eligible to work in the U.S. without Abbott sponsorship.

JOB DESCRIPTION:

PRIMARY FUNCTION:

Contribute to the design and development of software applications, firmware and device drivers for embedded microprocessors under a disciplined product development process that meets FDA requirements. Works on software design, coding, and validating embedded software, supporting verification and validation testing, and ensuring that all product development conforms to design specifications and coding standards for medical devices Exercises judgment in coding following the software designs and conducting investigation activities following defined methods. Develops productive internal/external working relationships.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:

1.Design and implement programs in current application and firmware programming languages (e.g., C-Sharp, Java, C, C, Assembly, etc). 2.Development of the test protocols for the purpose of design verification and validation of the system software. 3.Assist in the preparation of software design requirements and detailed design specifications for implementation of software designs per Abbott design development process. 4.Assist in the evaluation of selected designs through testing and full documentation of the results. Work on problems of moderate scope where analysis of situations or data requires evaluation of identifiable factors. Exercising judgment within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriate action.

Responsible for compliance with applicable Corporate and Divisional Policies and performing other duties as assigned by management

Note: This job description describes the principal and main elements of the job. It is a guide to the nature and main duties of the job as they currently exist, but is not intended as a wholly comprehensive or permanent representation.

MINIMUM EDUCATION REQUIRED:

BS in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science.MS degree ideal.

MINIMUM TRAINING & EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:

2 yrs experience in software engineering. Solid knowledge of software engineering principals. Knowledge of design controls and regulations for medical device development. Knowledge of the principles of quality software engineering as described by software lifecycle development processes that are consistent with ISO, IEEE, or other FDA recognized standards. Experience in design, engineering, and testing of software contained in medical devices developed under the FDAs regulations for 510(k) or PMA products is preferred. Technical experience in software engineering with excellent written and verbal communication skills is essential. Minimum of 2 years of structured software development and/or Object Modeling Design experience. Minimum of 2 years of solid programming experience using current programming languages (e.g., CSharp, Java, C, C, Assembly, etc). Experience with software development life cycle processes is highly preferable. Good troubleshooting skills is highly preferable Testing experience of software based systems is highly desirable Experience on multitasking in RTOS and/or Windows OS software design and development is highly preferable. Experience on Internet technologies (web development, application servers) and database design is a strong plus. Experience on device driver and low level device interface design and development is a plus. Knowledge and experience on RF software design, device driver configuration, and test is a plus. Experience in Com...

jobs.title: Senior System Administrator  Microsoft Exchange / Skype for Business
jobs.content:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, work with top-notch technologies and develop new tools to impress our 120 million users per month!

Do you get a real kick from good server practices? Do you know Microsoft Exchange and Skype for Business as well as you know your own family? We’re looking for an expert System Administrator who can take responsibility for our internal communication tools to make sure that our 1,000 plus employees stay connected.





What you'll do:



  • Plan, design, implement and maintain Microsoft Exchange and Skype for Business solutions in our head office in Düsseldorf and our other branches all over the world to ensure that they’re working well 24/7.

  • Plan, design, implement and maintain our Asterisk servers which provide the connection between our internal Skype for Business systems and SIP providers.

  • Troubleshoot problems related to our Exchange and Skype for Business servers in our complex technical environment.

  • Stay up-to-date on industry updates to ensure that we stay ahead of the curve and suggest new projects we can develop to push our infrastructure forward.

  • Act as the in-house technical expert on all Exchange and Skype for Business issues, providing assistance to others in your team should they need it.



What you'll definitely need:



  • Around 5 years’ experience installing, monitoring and troubleshooting servers for Windows Server and Client System 2008R2/2012/7/8/10, Skype for Business/Lync and Microsoft Exchange 2013-2016.

  • Considerable experience working with Active Directory, scripting and networking.

  • A good understanding of best practices for private cloud security.

  • Good knowledge of SIP, RTP, etc.

  • Flexibility and adaptability: in the rare chance of a serious issue occurring outside of office hours, it may be necessary for you come into the office to resolve it.

  • A bachelor’s degree in an IT-related field (only necessary for non-EU applicants).



What we'd love you to have:



  • MCSE certifications in Communication and Messaging.

  • German language skills or the enthusiasm to learn the language.




Start date:



  • As soon as possible.




Life at trivago is...



  • The opportunity to develop personally and professionally with regular code workshops and Hackathons, as well as the chance to contribute to our tech blog.

  • The belief that factual proof, not seniority, determines which path to take.

  • Self-determined working hours based on measuring productivity through goals rather than number of hours spent in the office.

  • Being supported in all your needs, including relocation assistance and language classes for international arrivals.

  • Working at our head office in Düsseldorf, a city boasting the 6th highest quality of life in the world for expats.



Additional information:



  • Applicants from outside the EU must hold a bachelor’s degree in order to be considered for this position.

  • Please note that only online applications will be considered. Any paper applications that we receive will not be processed or returned.

  • Please note that your CV and motivation letter must be written in English.

jobs.title: Senior Web Developer  C#/.Net
jobs.content:
Crate and Barrel is one of America’s most exciting housewares specialty retailer with 100+ locations and over 6,500 associates nationwide. We are seeking a Senior Web Developer – C#/.Net to join our team in developing the next generation of our eCommerce architecture.  This position is located at our Northbrook, Illinois corporate offices.


As a Crate and Barrel Senior Web Developer – C#/.Net, you will join an innovative eCommerce team responsible for delivering solutions built for sustainability and performance.  You will collaborate closely with product managers, testers and other software engineers to design, test, code, deliver and maintain software modules within an Agile Scrum environment via website architecture built on a cloud infrastructure. 


Come be a part of our exciting fast paced team, proud of building the solutions that drive our websites seen by millions of Crate and Barrel customers.


Job Description:



  • Design, develop, and implement solutions using C#, ASP.NET (MVC and WebForms), and Javascript Frameworks as your tools and Visual Studio 2015 as your environment.

  • Conceive and build unit testable solutions for our website applications.

  • Participate in technical design meetings with other developers and assist in defining the system architecture and choosing technologies.

  • Work on a cross-disciplinary Agile team to develop, estimate, test, and maintain our websites, while collaborating with team members on product backlog grooming, sprint planning, execution, review, and retrospective.

  • Work directly with business stakeholders to understand requirements and communicate progress.

  • Be an active contributor to back-end development practices and code reviews.

  • Update and maintain site documentation.

  • Communicate effectively and efficiently with all associates and business contacts and promote a strong sense of teamwork.


Requirements:



  • You have been building websites for 5+ years with C#, ASP.NET, MVC with a preferred focus on e-commerce solutions.

  • Possess 5+ years experience with relational databases like SQLServer, NoSQL experience a plus.

  • You have strong communication skills and experience working with business stakeholders and web designers.

  • You can work with jQuery right away. You have some experience and knowledge of another script framework (e.g. AngularJS, node.js).

  • Real world problem solving and technology excites you.

  • Experience working in a web environment such as IIS administration.

  • You have worked in an Agile environment.

  • You can write unit tests and testable code.

  • Ability to work efficiently and meet project deadlines with minimal supervision.

  • Ability to analyze business problems and provide accurate development estimates

  • Experience in domain-driven development and cloud technologies is a plus.

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or comparable work experience.

  • You have good reading, written and verbal language skills (English).      


For immediate consideration please apply on-line at http://crateandbarrelcareers.silkroad.com/.

As a Crate and Barrel Front End Developer, you will join an innovative eCommerce team responsible for delivering solutions built for sustainability and performance. You will collaborate closely with product managers, testers and other software engineers to design, test, code, deliver and maintain software modules within an Agile Scrum environment.

  • Work with product team and stakeholders to understand and communicate progress.

jobs.title: Lead Web Developer - C#/.Net
jobs.content:
Crate and Barrel is one of America’s most exciting housewares specialty retailer with 100+ locations and over 6,500 associates nationwide. We are seeking a Lead Web Developer - C#/.Net to join our team in developing the next generation of our eCommerce architecture.  This position is located at our Northbrook, Illinois corporate offices.


As a Crate and Barrel Lead Web Developer - C#/.Net, you will join an innovative eCommerce team as a technical leader responsible for delivering innovative eCommerce solutions built for sustainability and performance. Your passion for architecture optimization will enable you to become a key contributor in the development and enhancement of our core eCommerce architecture. You will be a go-to-person in designing and guiding teams in the delivery of high quality software that scales and performs at a best-in-class level. Collaborating closely with product managers, testers and other software engineers, you will design, test, code, deliver and maintain software modules within an Agile Scrum environment.


Our teams are composed of talented software engineers working in a very dynamic, challenging, fast-paced, sustainable and fun Agile (Scrum) environment.


Job Description:



  • Translate business requirements into architecture designs:

    • Understand the existing software core architecture, interactions and dependencies between its main components.

    • Support product managers to gather and filter key information from stakeholders.

    • Evaluate risk by identifying development complexity, limitations and impacts.

    • Determine development feasibility within identified constraints.



  • Support product managers with drafting functional specifications.

  • Write minimum technical specifications and documents.

  • Participate in detailed development reviews and demos.

  • Write unit tests.

  • Troubleshoot and guide the team to resolve complex problems.

  • Suggest core infrastructure enhancements based on current and future technology trends.

  • Brainstorm and solve very interesting problems that will considerably increase product user experience.

  • Coach and mentor junior team members:

    • Contribute and promote software best practices and processes across the team.

    • Participate actively in code reviews.

    • Provide teammates continuous technical support.

    • Provide guidance for new feature integration and key architectural decisions.



  • Share knowledge through collaboration, training, peer review, presentations, and articles.


Requirements:



  • 7 + years of C# and ASP.NET experience.

  • 4+ years of hands-on technical leadership experience around system engineering.

  • 2 + years of MVC experience.

  • 2 + years experience working under Agile scrum framework.

  • Strong knowledge of SQL Server.

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field; Master’s degree preferred.

  • Strong experience with web development (HTML, JavaScript, AJAX, CSS, relational databases and SQL).

  • Experience with MongoDB or NoSQL preferred.

  • Experience implementing REST architecture preferred.

  • Good reading, written and verbal language skills (English).

jobs.title: Software/Productivity Engineer
jobs.content:
We need super smart engineers from all levels to help us build one of the best engineered e-commerce platform in the world (big talk we know, but that is our goal!). Our engineers combine creativity, curiosity, and drive to continuously perfect and revolutionize Jet from the inside out. We are looking to bring more intellectually curious engineers who are passionate about technology in general (Jet is a technology first company and prides itself on its culture of learning and knowledge sharing and we want all our engineers to be as passionate as we are!) 


The Environment


Our platform is largely an event driven platform implemented via a microservice architecture. The platform runs on Microsoft Azure and uses a large number of technologies and middle ware. The bulk of backend code is written in a functional style (F#) and our system of record is an event sourced system (essentially a log of all actions on the platform). We use a mix of Kafka, Redis, Elastic Search, Azure SQL, Event Store and Azure Storage for our data stores. About 50% of the platform runs on Linux and the rest Windows (although we move into more containerization we will see a shift towards Linux).


The Job


We are looking for talented Software Engineers who are passionate about improving the state of Software Engineering. This role impacts all of our engineering team and will help improve speed of development and quality of product. Responsibilities will include: Identify and develop technologies/tools which can drive improvements in efficiency of our system; recognize potential risk factors on our website; Performance, integration and chaos engineering; provide best practices to the engineering teams. Our software is quickly evolving and used by millions, this role will be dynamic, challenging, and critical to our success.



  • Identify and develop technologies/tools to improve the efficiency of our system.

  • Risk assessment: help determine functionality that have the biggest productivity impact on the site.

  • Performance/Integration/Chaos Engineering.

  • Provide best practices to the engineering teams.


The Person



  • Must have good programming skills with OO (preferred experience with functional programming)

  • Knowledge of distributed systems

  • Working knowledge chaos/performance engineering;

  • Working knowledge of continuous integration/continuous deployment process

  • BS or higher in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related field is preferred

  • Experience with building code static analysis tools


Compensation Philosophy


Our compensation philosophy is simple but powerful. Give everyone a meaningful stake in the company—the purest form of ownership. That’s why on top of base salary, Jet’s comp structure is heavily weighted in equity. Our collective hard work, high performance, and tenure are rewarded as our equity builds in value.


Benefits & Perks


Competitive Salaries.  Real Ownership in the form of Stock Options.  Unlimited Vacation.  Full Healthcare Benefits.  Exceptional Work Environment.  Learning & Development Opportunities.  Just for fun Networking & Events.
