We expect that you share our enthusiasm for embedded software in automotive industry, that you bring fresh ideas and the ability to think outside the box. Join us in developing quality software solutions and shape with us the future of individual mobility.


Are you looking for an exciting challenge? Then join our team. We look forward to receiving your application. You can find detailed information and apply online at www.bmwgroup.jobs.

THESE DAYS, AUTOMOTIVE HISTORY IS WRITTEN IN C++.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Our engineering team dedicates itself to continuous learning and improvement. We built a process that is optimized for rapid, agile development; deploying to production many times a day. To discover the correct solution; we start with a minimum viable product and iterate using team and stakeholder feedback; so that the people, product, and process improve together.

As a senior developer you’ll help us architect, build and maintain our main codebase as well as ancillary services. You’ll recommend and implement system-wide improvements, new technologies, and contribute to our technological direction.

NationBuilder creates software for leaders of all kinds - political candidates, nonprofit organizations, anyone building a community of people to make something happen in the world. To learn more about NationBuilder, read about our mission and beliefs.

You:

  • are always interested in learning new things.
  • get excited when you have the chance to pair.
  • practice test-driven development and judicious refactoring.
  • enjoy being responsive to customer feedback.
  • are a pragmatic problem solver, knowing how to find the middle ground between “perfect, but takes forever to code” and “fixes it now, but nobody will ever be able to understand what I did”
  • work well in small teams with a clear mission.
  • have the insight to know whats important and the dedication to get it done.

We are looking for:

  • While existing experience with the technologies we use is welcome, an open and disciplined approach to your work is more important to us than whether you already know Ruby, Rails or anything else in our stack. We value the willingness to learn our technologies and environment over domain-specific skills.
  • Have at least 3-5 years of professional development experience

Our Stack:

Our application is primarily Ruby on Rails with some additional Ruby and Go services. Configuration management is via Puppet. The majority of our data is in PostgreSQL with additional supporting data in MongoDB and Redis. We're hosted in our own datacenter with a little AWS mixed in.

NationBuilder is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We are committed to finding talent that is not determined on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

jobs.title: Quant Developer
jobs.content:
The role of Quant Developer is open to a capable and motivated mathematical software developer.  We're looking at a broad range of experience levels here, from new graduates to gurus, and we want anyone coming on board to be prepared to learn and improve their skills.  Although we are part of a larger organisation, we're a young group with an open, relaxed atmosphere, and we're looking for people that are in turn open to new ideas and ways of doing things.


The role involves a broad range of activities:



  • Development of the Tyche software product.  All development proceeds according to modern software development practices such as continuous integration testing, and code produced needs to be mathematically correct and highly efficient.



  • Determining mathematical solutions to problems, and determining how best to express those solutions in terms of computer code.  The problems to be solved may be concrete practical problems such as how to find an optimal investment strategy, or how best to calibrate a mathematical model to data, or more abstract problems such as how best to efficiently execute a sequence of mathematical operations.



  • Testing and quality control.  This is hugely important to us.  Any work needs to be thoroughly tested, and a comprehensive set of tests should be submitted for the work alongside the code, to add to our regression testing suite.



  • Maintenance and support of Tyche.  For this, read bugfixing ;)!  We have a low bug-rate at present, and have very rigorous systems for bug recording and monitoring, but fixing bugs generally takes priority over new project work.


The term "Quant Developer" can be used to mean a broad spectrum of things in the industry.  At one end, there are essentially pure quants who hack programs together, and at the other end there are dedicated software developers with little mathematics.  We don't really fit in to that.  At RPC Consulting we take the software development equally as seriously as the mathematics.  The team here are professional software developers at the same time as being serious mathematicians; we don't compromise on either area.


Please submit a CV and covering letter to Mark Sinclair-McGarvie at RPC Consulting.

jobs.title: Quality Assurance
jobs.content:
We are seeking an exceptional candidate to strategically manage and execute software and mobile testing for our team as a QA lead.


This role will require an experienced QA tester ready to play a key part in our software development efforts, interfacing directly with the engineering and project management teams to ensure superb-quality deployments of software enhancements.  As the key lead on our software testing, you will learn our innovative mHealth software suite from the inside out and maintain a high standard of quality in diligently investigating and tracking bugs to closure. At a small and growing company, you will see the impact of your work daily as part of our rapid release schedule.


We pride ourselves on the quality of our systems and our ability to evolve products to anticipate client needs.  As a Quality Assurance Tester, you’ll combine organizational skills, familiarity with software development, and a keen detail orientation to help ensure we settle for nothing less than the highest standards.


As a QA lead, you will have a percentage of leadership & management responsibilities in addition to contributing to software testing needs:



  • Design testing strategies and write test cases for new products and new features,

  • Work with operations and engineering teams to convert achieved product roadmap milestones into solid regression testing plans, which includes managing version controlled regression testing templates according to our SOPs,

  • Oversee task execution of QA staff and help prioritize testing as needed,

  • Develop and execute manual test cases based on software requirements,

  • Find, report, and track software bugs through to resolution,

  • Prioritize and manage a large volume of testing projects simultaneously with different priorities and deadlines,

  • Validate production features and functionality against requirement documents.

  • Actively communicate testing status including schedule, risks, issues, defects, and potential impacts.

  • Participate in further developing our testing process, including automated software and mobile testing, and strategy for ongoing and new projects.

jobs.title: Dev Ops Engineer
jobs.content:
XING is the social network for business professionals with millions of members all over the world.
Help us shape the future – for a better working life!



The Data Science Team at XING in Hamburg or Barcelona has an open position for a
 


Dev Ops Engineer (m/f) for Data Science

jobs.title: Director

jobs.title: Sr. Engineer, Product Engineering
jobs.content:
Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the world's best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast.






Job Summary:



Responsible for providing system architectures and solutions to bring to market new innovative products which span web service offerings. Leads engineering functions as they relate to the planning, design,integration, test, deployment and support of products. Assists with testing and operational activities. Integrates knowledge of business and

functional priorities. Acts as a key contributor in a complex and crucial environment. May lead teams or projects and shares expertise.





Core Responsibilities:



- Partners with engineering project manager to provide consultative direction and develops long term objectives and plans to determine resources, technology and course of action to achieve results.

- Works with other members of cross-functional teams, joint ventures,third party vendors and Company's Product Managers and Marketing teams to deliver quality products, in a timely fashion, that meet defined requirements. Establishes and maintains working relationships within NE&TO, Product Development teams, joint ventures, vendors and contractors.

- Participates in Company product lifecycle process. Contributes to and/or creates product and technical requirements, detailed design documents including transaction, capacity and bandwidth models, systems definitions, and operational procedures as part of this process.

- Understands key business drivers and applies the knowledge of internal/external business issues to improve products and services.

- Anticipates and interprets customer needs, assesses requirements and identifies solutions.

- Ensures that projects are properly accepted into the engineering team,worked on in a timely and efficient manner and smoothly transitioned into Quality Assurance and Operations teams.

- Interprets internal/external business issues and recommends complete solutions based on best practices and proven technologies.

- Solves complex problems. Takes a broad perspective to identify innovative solutions.

- Provides guidance for the performance and reliability of various cross-platform applications and services. Ensures that system failures are restored in a timely manner.

- Participates in the review of failures and provides feedback to prevent future occurrences.

- Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.

- Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) as necessary.

- Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.



Job Specification:

- Bachelors Degree or Equivalent

- Engineering, Computer Science

- Generally requires 7-11 years related experience






Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer

jobs.title: UI Software Engineer - Voice Control Platform
jobs.content:
Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the world's best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast.








The Voice Control Platform (VREX) is part of Comcast Cable's Technology & Product (T&P) organization and serves the larger company with advanced NLP technologies for searching and discovering any type of content in the entertainment catalog available.



The Voice control Platform needs an UX software engineer to develop tools to help monitor, configure and maintain the infrastructure.

You will work with other engineers and researchers with backgrounds in advanced fields such as natural language processing, information retrieval, and knowledge representation. As a key member of the team, you will help design, implement and test various components of the system.



Comcast T&P encourages career development with regular opportunities for training and programs for innovative cross-team projects such as week-long Hackathon and job rotation programs over the summer.





Core Responsibilities:



Writing production-quality, tested code.

Understanding the code base for your components in depth.

Collaborating with our quality assurance and technical operations teams to provide outstanding customer service.

Participating in code reviews and helping the team to be effective and agile.





Qualifications:



BS in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related technical field.

2+ years of relevant work experience and Java development

Experience with HTML 5, Javascript and Angular is a must.

Experience with distributed web service development (hands-on experience with RESTful web services).

Experience with Java Web Container (Tomcat, Jetty, Netty)

Experience creating custom web tools or UI's is a plus.

Experience using CMS is a plus.

Experience using WebSockets is a plus.

Experience with various data interchange and representation formats such as JSON, XML.

Experience with versioning tools. Hands-on experience with GIT a plus.

Experience with Agile development methodologies and practices.

Experience as part of a team doing state-of-the art, object-oriented software development including continuous integration, test-driven-development, automated unit and integration testing.

Strong initiative: must be able to take high-level requirements, ask questions and get clarifications, decompose into deliverable software components, design and implement solution to meet functional, performance, and quality acceptance criteria.

Excellent communication: must be a good listener, willing to ask questions, and able to clearly communicate ideas with team members and external groups.

Generally requires 7-11 years related experience








Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer

jobs.title: Manager, Product Development Engineering
jobs.content:
Comcast's Technology & Product organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards.





Job Summary:

Responsible for recruiting, developing, and managing a team of productdevelopment engineers. Designs, implements, and sustains engineering ofCompany's applications and services. Manages team which may includeexempt and non-exempt employees. Provides subject matter guidance toemployees as required. Develops processes and procedures to drivedepartment efficiencies, assist in development, and meeting of,departmental budget.





Core Responsibilities:

- Manages the full life cycle product development to include analysisand planning related to product development, launch and deployment.

- Creates documents for architecture, design, technical requirements andservice specifications. Presents architecture, design, and technicalchoices to internal audiences.

- Demonstrates technical leadership and mentoring on the application ofnew technologies and system development methodologies.

- Monitors technical and engineering progress to ensure strategies,goals and objectives are met. Aligns operational plans with businessobjectives. Communicates changes to all affected personnel.

- Develops requirements to be used by the vendor community to developsolutions to meet Company application needs.

- Evaluates various architectural solutions and implementations.

- Establishes and maintains productive relationships with peerorganizations and equipment and software vendors.

- Identifies trends, services and/or capabilities that may be beneficialto product offerings. Manages and forecasts resource needs to meetdepartmental objectives. Recommends action plans or solutions.

- Participates consultatively in the testing and certification processas needed.

- Ensures effective implementation of the department budget. Preparesfinancial statements and monthly forecasts and reports. Prepares andanalyzes monthly financial performance and makes budget and newtechnology recommendations. Prepares direct reports.

- Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in mattersof significance.

- Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to worknights and weekends, variable schedule(s) as necessary.

- Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.





Job Specification:

- Bachelors Degree or Equivalent

- Engineering, Computer Science

- Generally requires 6-9 years related experience

Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards.





Job Summary:



We are looking for a mobile application leader to join our Xfinity Connect Mobile Development team. This team is responsible for ensuring the timely development, testing and release of the Xfinity Connect iOS and Android applications with a degree of quality that exceeds our customers’ expectations. We are passionate about our product, our engineering, and our people.



In this role, you will directly manage a team of software developers and test engineers.  You will collaborate with cross-functional teams (management, web, mobile and API developers, UX designers, test engineers, operations engineers, product and business managers) to develop features for Xfinity Connect products and applications.  You must be a strong technical leader, an independent, critical and analytic thinker, have excellent communication skills and rapidly adapt to changing business and customer demands.

- This individual will manage a team which may include exempt and non-exempt employees. Employees will be a mix of local and remote workers which includes offshore outsourced resources. They will provide subject matter guidance to employees as required and serve as a point of escalation.



- Passionate and driven to improve the customer experience through solving problems and delivering a superior application.



- Develops processes and procedures to drive departmental and process efficiencies, as well as meeting of departmental budget. 



Requirements:



- Experience managing software engineers



- Professional experience developing native iOS or Android applications



- Demonstrated knowledge of Software Development Life Cycle and Agile methodologies



- Demonstrated knowledge of Continuous Integration and Deployment tools (Jenkins, AntHillPro)



- Knowledge of source control and code review systems (Github, Gerrit)



- Experience with DevOps, Automated Testing and Continuous Delivery



- Excellent interpersonal and relationship-building skills



- Experience setting individual and team goals



- Experience developing individual career plans for engineers



- Establishes and maintains productive relationships with peer organizations contracting vendors.



- Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.

jobs.title: Junior Software Developer
jobs.content:
About the Job
As a level one software developer, you will work on fixing customer issues and improving current features. You’ll also have the opportunity to work with experienced senior software engineers and learn about distributed systems and scalable software architectures.
About You
You’re a junior developer with one or two years of experience. We are looking for full-stack engineers - you’ll be working in the front-end and back-end of a modern ASP.NET MVC application using C#, HTML, CSS, and Javascript.


You will be successful if you:
Have a strong sense of ownership
Care about code quality and readability
Work well under direction from senior software engineers

jobs.title: UNIX/Linux Systems Administrator
jobs.content:
Job Description


WalletHub is a high-growth start-up based in Washington, D.C. .Our fast-paced environment and can do attitude have already earned us several prestigious awards including this year's Gold Stevie for best financial services website from the American Business Awards and a gold medal as one of the products of the year from the Consumer World Awards.  We're seeking hardworking, like-minded individuals to help us disrupt personal finance and make a tangible difference in people's everyday lives.


More specifically, we are harnessing the power of data analytics and artificial intelligence to build the brain of a smart financial advisor, whose services we’re offering to everyone for free. The WalletHub brain enables users to make better financial decisions in a fraction of the time with three unique features:



  1. Customized Credit-Improvement Tips: WalletHub identifies improvement opportunities and guides you through the necessary corrections.

  2. Personalized Money-Saving Advice: WalletHub’s savings brain constantly scours the market for load-lightening opportunities, bringing you only the best deals.

  3. Wallet Surveillance: Personal finance isn’t as scary with 24/7 credit monitoring providing backup, notifying you of important credit-report changes.


In addition to the valuable intelligence the brain provides, WalletHub is the first and only service to offer free credit scores and full credit reports that are updated on a daily basis absent of user interaction, rather than weekly or monthly and only when a user logs in. Some other services hang their hats on free credit scores and reports, yet they’re still inferior to what WalletHub considers minor pieces to a much larger puzzle.


Responsibilities include:



  • Ensure proper security, monitoring, alerting and reporting for the infrastructure and be the on-call for production servers

  • Develop security monitoring and other tools to ensure the integrity and availability of our applications, server resources, reviewing system and application logs

  • Work with the incident team to diagnose and recover from hardware or software failures working with or as the Incident Commander to coordinate and communicate with our internal customers

  • Assist project teams with technical issues during development efforts

  • Gather system requirements and support several project teams in evolving, testing and rolling-out new products and services, then transitioning the site or product to post launch operations activities throughout life of the product or service

  • Work with the application development team and other systems engineers to make improvements to current isfrastructure

  • Document processes and procedures and follow a formal change management procedure


Note: This position can be performed remotely, in which case we will consider candidates from the U.S. or from India.

jobs.title: Oracle DBA
jobs.content: This Database Specialist provides the highest level of expertise in the architectural design, installation, performance, integrity, and support of the database structures and technologies utilized by the organization. Conducts product research, manages database administration projects, manages vendor relations and establishes and follows standards and procedures related to database management. Plays an integral role in backup and recovery, performance tuning, capacity planning, security, and disaster recovery strategies within database management. Supports application development in the design, deployment, implementation, and problem resolution of the solutions utilized by the organization. It is expected that specialists stay current on trends in the industry and make recommendations for changes and improvements.

jobs.title: Software Development Manager - Metadata and Configuration Platform
jobs.content:
The Metadata and Configuration Platform (MCP) team is responsible for developing technologies that enable Amazon software application teams to:

  • Rapidly evolve data definitions and business rules to adapt to changing business needs;

  • Minimize operational disruptions by enabling dynamic evolution of metadata and configuration data;

  • Discover and leverage metadata across the enterprise to maximize reuse and decrease maintenance costs.


We are part of the Amazon.com e-commerce foundational technology team, which means our software powers one of the largest e-commerce engines in the world. If you want to be part of a team that makes a difference on a large scale, this is it.



We are looking for a passionate, results-oriented, inventive, and experienced Software Development Manager (SDM) to refine and drive the direction for the metadata and configuration management services, libraries, and tooling. The candidate thrives in a fast-paced environment, understands the metadata modeling space, and will help us help the business innovate quickly and safely.



As the manager for the team you will be responsible for understanding the needs of our existing customer base (currently hundreds of internal customers) and what new features we need to build to attract new customers (up to thousands). You will be responsible for defining the strategy and roadmap for our technologies as required to deliver on our mission both in the short and long term. To do this, you will lead a team of engineers to perform cost-benefit analyses to determine the approaches that yield the maximum value for the minimal investment, evaluate the alternatives, and plan and drive the delivery of improvements. You will be responsible for hiring and providing career development for your team.



Successful candidates will have a proven track record of leading teams to develop highly distributed systems using Agile and incremental delivery methods. You will also be responsible for ensuring the ongoing operations of the services that your team builds.


  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field

  • Equivalent experience to a Bachelor's degree based on 3 years of work experience for every 1 year of education

  • 7+ years of relevant engineering experience

  • 2+ years people management experience

  • Experience with OOD and object oriented languages

  • Experience managing teams through the entire development, deployment, and operations lifecycle

  • Agile project management experience

  • Experience providing career development to a team of engineers

  • Ability to build high-performance teams




  • Experience building complex software systems that have been successfully delivered incrementally to customers

  • Deep hands-on technical expertise: knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills

  • Strong business and technical vision

  • Ability to handle multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment

  • Exceptional customer relationship skills including the ability to discover the true requirements underlying feature requests, recommend alternative technical and business approaches, and lead engineering efforts to meet aggressive timelines with optimal solutions

jobs.title: Front-end Developer
jobs.content: We're wrapping up a major new release of our flagship web application and we have an opening for some front-end talent. We would like to meet someone who is creative and has a passion for daring front-end work rather than someone who's looking for a mindless 9-5. We love people who never stop learning and desire an environment accommodating their personal growth. We like to openly discuss project complexities and would value you voicing your opinion -- bonus points if you'll join us in diagramming problems on our glass walls with markers.

jobs.title: Senior/Lead Front-End Engineer
jobs.content:
Help us reach 1M connected devices.


Come help us build the next generation of technology for the transportation industry!


Syncromatics is a leading provider of Intelligent Transportation Systems (ITS) serving transit agencies, universities and private operators across the country.  We collect GPS and other sensor data from buses, shuttles, trolleys and other moving vehicles and then transport it via cellular networks to our back-end systems for real-time aggregation, analytics, alerting and reporting.  All of this information is used by dispatchers, transit planners and the riding public to make transit systems more accessible to riders, and run more efficiently for operators.


Location: Downtown Los Angeles, CA (DTLA)


Syncromatics is headquartered in the PacMutual building, located adjacent to Pershing Square and easily accessible via the 7th St/Metro Center and Pershing Square Metro stations.  Many of our employees take advantage of public transportation.  Employees who choose to drive are made fun of for excessively loving their cars and paying for parking.  The Pershing Square/Bunker Hill area is a thriving, revitalized area of downtown Los Angeles with limitless restaurants, coffee shops, gyms, shopping and other amenities.  Our building alone houses Water Grill, Tender Greens, Starbucks, Earthbar, two amazing French cafes (Le Pain Quotidien and Pitchoun), a sandwich shop, a crepe place, Verizon, FedEx and a high-end boutique fashion store that never has any customers. Pershing Square hosts a farmer's market and food trucks on a weekly basic.


The Role:


In addition to being able to consume vast quantities of food, we're looking for a strong Front-End Engineer eager to work in an environment with a diverse ecosystem of applications:  web apps and services, native mobile apps, high-level embedded apps, network programming, the Actor Model (Akka.net), messaging systems, relational databases, etc.  We don't expect incoming engineers to have experience/expertise in all of these areas but we seek those who are looking to learn new things and have confidence in their own ability to get up to speed quickly.


Problems you will tackle:



  • Building real-time, web-socket based user interfaces. Think air-traffic control for city bus fleets.

  • Delivering intuitive user interfaces used by millions of bus riders annually.

  • Reporting on large amounts of event, log and time-series data.

  • Building out scalable RESTful APIs for both internal and external consumption.


Our Engineering Culture



  • We pride ourselves on being connected with the growing open-source community in the .NET world.

  • TDD, continuous integration, frequent deployments.

  • ChatOps - in addition to being the control center for deploying apps, our chat rooms give us insight into our system health, Agile process and where people are eating lunch.


Benefits:



  • Generous Health and Dental Benefits, 401k plan w/ match, bonus plan. Parking stipend, or if you take public transportation, we'll cover the entire pass (including Metrolink)!

  • kegerator, ping pong, caffeinated beverages, snacks, you know, standard issue stuff…

jobs.title: Angular 2 Javascript Developer
jobs.content:
Did you know wine isn't just a hack people use to run Windows on Linux?  Turns out it's also a beverage.  Turns out it's a whole industry with its own special snowflake technical needs. 


You my friend, will help meet those needs by building a next generation platform for winery and tasting room management.  You'll focus on the front end and use the new fangled Angular 2 framework to build modular component libraries and finished applications.  


And you won't go it alone.  You'll work with smart and thrill seeking people who've already shipped production Angular 2 applications.  You'll have the support you need to do it right, at least until Google changes their mind again about what right is.  (Angular CLI, anyone?)


You can work from anywhere, but you'll meet your peers in person occasionally at technical conferences or at our offices in the heart of Napa.  If you like wine, you'll probably get enough free wine to make some really bad decisions*.  Let's see the insurance company you just sent your resume to top that.


* Granbury Solutions does not officially endorse bad decisions...or insurance companies.

jobs.title: CTO's Right Hand - Software Developer
jobs.content: Software developer to assist the CTO in expanding the software capabilities and functionality of our system, and becoming a key team player as backup to the CTO.  Will work with the company's founders and CTO to respond to growing market demands for increased functions and interfaces with partner software.  Ideal candidate will be located in southern California, but remote locations acceptable for the proper candidate.

jobs.title: Software Quality Assurance Analyst
jobs.content:
Position Description


As a member of the Development team, the Software Quality Assurance Analyst is an active member of one or more Agile Scrum development teams. The Software Quality Assurance Analyst will participate in the planning of payment software development cycles to ensure that each planned item is sufficiently defined and testable. During each cycle, the analyst will test items as they are completed to meet Shift4’s quality standards.


A successful candidate for this position will be able to understand software requirements, create test plans and test cases, execute test cases, articulate test results, and objectively assess production readiness from a quality perspective. Additionally, the candidate must be able to effectively juggle multiple projects and priorities simultaneously.


Essential Functions



  • Identify and test software defects

  • Create effective test plans and test cases

  • Document and execute test cases and articulate test results

  • Validate whether software requirements have been met

  • Objectively assess production readiness from a quality perspective

  • Track quality assurance metrics such as defect densities and defect counts

  • Review user feedback to determine how to test items

  • Suggest process improvements

  • Other duties as assigned by management

jobs.title: DevOps/Automation Lead or Manager
jobs.content:
What We Need


We are looking for a strong leader to join our Automation & Dev Tools Team. You will be working with cutting-edge technologies, highly-adept engineers, and have the opportunity to create a first-class Automation & Dev Tools team. Our next DevOps guru should have strong management skills, solid understanding of various software delivery methodologies, and Computer Science fundamentals including databases, algorithms and problem solving techniques.


What You Will Do



  • Manage and lead a team of badass engineers

  • As we grow, mentor and grow new engineers

  • Coach and align your team members to build a highly-efficient and reliable automation infrastructure

  • Develop automation frameworks for Kareo’s new platform that will be used by the product development teams

  • Build out and enhance Kareo’s continuous delivery pipeline to deliver Microservices to production

  • Be a thought leader for principles and technology that will help our engineers continue to do amazing work with ever improving efficiency

  • Collaborate with Network Operations to bridge engineering and operational concepts to help bring our software to life in production with the least amount of human effort

  • Help us ship high quality software as fast as possible all the time!

jobs.title: PHP Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
We are seeking mid to senior level PHP developers to work full-time contributing to the success of our SaaS platform. With more than 5,000 customers in both the enterprise and SMB space, our developers get to make a big impact on the applications and markets they serve.


We are looking for developers who have experience in some sort of object-oriented PHP  framework (we use Symfony), and have made contributions to production applications. As a PHP developer at PrintSites, you will be responsible for crafting features from idea to production, including collaborating with stakeholders, prototyping solutions, building the actual thing, debugging and testing, and working with QA.


Looking to expand your skills beyond PHP? We also use Python (Django) and JavaScript (Ember, Backbone, Node.js). You’ll get a wide berth to select the right tool for the right job and have plenty of opportunity to grow.


Tools we use


Git, Jenkins, Aegir, Ansible, Xdebug


JIRA, Confluence


PhpStorm


Linux, Vagrant, Memcached, Varnish


and lots more...

jobs.title: Android Engineer
jobs.content:
Job Description:


Our mobile team consists of developers who are passionate about bringing their skills and expertise to create mobile experiences that engage the user.  We seek candidates who can create clean, scalable code quickly in iterative cycles.  


- Do you look at other apps in the play store and say to yourself “I can do a better job at creating that app”?


- Do you toss and turn at night thinking about ways to improve what you’re working on?


 - Do you eagerly await the next Google I/O and keep an eye out for the next innovative additions to the SDK?


If this sounds like you, we have a spot for you on a team that is making a huge impact for a company that is truly going places and one who is committed to mobile.


Responsibilities




  • Design and develop native mobile applications for Android

  • Integrate mobile apps with RESTful web services

  • Work with UX Designers, Mobile Architects and other Developers to build enterprise mobile solutions

  • Work as part of an agile team on leading edge technologies


___


Raise Engineering:


Our software engineers are solving problems at scale for our online, gift card marketplace. Our user base and e-commerce transactions are growing exponentially. The challenges of keeping our services running 24x7, and adding new features to accelerate our business, all while moving incrementally to a continuous-deployment, microservice architecture are all awesome problems to solve. An understanding and commitment to our team approach to software development is of primary importance. Teams build software here. Besides obvious technical strengths, we look for passion for well-crafted software, professionalism, drive to learn new technologies, the joy of building solutions for our business and users, and the desire to cultivate a challenging, innovative, and supportive engineering culture.


Engineering teams at Raise have a great deal of autonomy and independence, with real ownership of the products and features they build. This role requires a unique balance of software-development skill and product sense — so the ideal candidate will have experience building substantial customer-facing products or services.


Impact- Raise is an engineering culture at its core. Our goal is to create an optimal environment where engineers regularly see and feel the difference they make.


Elegance - We care about code. Every engineer, from leadership to individual contributor, code on a daily basis.


Tackling Challenges - We don’t believe in being fast followers. Instead we’re focused on creating amazing experiences for customers while solving problems they knew existed.


Professional Growth - Each engineer has an individual career plan carved out for them upon joining Raise. Whether you want to be an individual contributor or have aspirations for leadership, we’ll work to help you realize your career goals.


Smart Team - Great people want to work around great people. We understand that, so we’ve created a thorough and systematic hiring process to ensure we only hire top quality engineers.


Disruptive Goals - Raise engineers think BIG. We never settle for mediocrity and are excited about our future.

jobs.title: Senior Software Developer - Concur R&D
jobs.content:
As a core member of Concur’ s Minnesota R&D Center, you will be designing and building the next generation of our end-to-end solutions spanning Concur’ s  product line.  We run small teams with a purpose, so that our engineers have full visibility and ownership of the project, including architecture, design, development, and operations.  You believe in being a team player, collaborating and communicating with technical and non-technical audiences.    You bring a result-driven focus, high enthusiasm, energy, confidence, curiosity, and a sense of fun.
Concur has a customer base of over 30 million end users and year-over-year growth exceeding 50%.  As a Software Engineer with Concur you will be working on solutions that are key to Concur’ s product delivery and aggressive growth.


In the first 12 months you will be:




    • Developing features at all levels of Concur’s technical stack:  You will be building solutions from end-to-end— for example; standing up new services, coding business logic, improving the UI, as well as taking ownership for product quality and delivery

    • Delivering features in the cloud: You will be creating and scaling features and services that utilize Concur’s cloud as well as other commercial platforms such as AWS.

    • Agile Development:  You’ll use Agile Development (Scrum, XP, etc.), Continuous Integration and DevOps concepts (automated deployments, monitoring/alerting, etc.)  You will be collaborating and working with you team members to constantly improve our development process so we can quickly respond to opportunities across our business.
      Owning the software lifecycle from design to delivery: As part of Concur R&D you will be contributing to architecture, design, development, and operations

jobs.title: Full Stack Engineer - UI/UX
jobs.content: DataFox is looking for a design-oriented, risk-taking software engineer who can take initiative and think creatively to solve complex data problems. This role will complement our engineering- and finance-heavy backgrounds to round out a product team revolutionizing the way business analysts find and track high-growth companies.

jobs.title: Senior Frontend Developer
jobs.content:
AdParlor provides an industry leading software as a service platform that enables the world's largest advertisers to efficiently manage and optimize their social advertising spend on Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, Yahoo, Pinterest, and other social marketplaces. Our team is currently building the next generation of our platform and looking for experienced individuals to contribute to the desktop and mobile initiatives at AdParlor.


The AdParlor business is currently reinventing today’s approach to social ad management with web applications that:



  • Consume and interface with multiple backend APIs for an ever growing list of top social networks and asynchronous services

  • Provide an easy-to-use client-facing interface with flexible reporting and permissions

  • Leverage the latest and greatest web and mobile technologies to deliver a world-class enterprise ad management platform

  • Include a robust tracking system designed to track return on investment and lifetime value of users for our advertisers


The Software Engineering team is located in Kansas City and is comprised of backend engineers, frontend engineers, product designers, and product managers. The Software Engineer position will work closely with the frontend and backend development teams and reports directly to the Manager of Product & Engineering.


POSITION OVERVIEW
This Senior Software Engineer is responsible for collaborating with product management and other developers to bring new features to our platform. This position requires a strong attention to detail and the ability to develop simple and elegant solutions to unique frontend challenges. The ideal candidate for this position is a self-starter that thrives in a fast-paced environment that often allows you to take your own initiatives. Primary duties include:



  1. Partnership: Collaborating with peers in the technical and business teams on architectural design and implementation.

  2. App Development and Maintenance: Building and maintaining high-performance web apps that leverage new technologies.

  3. Leadership: Mentoring junior developers on best practices in programming and testing, structure, implementation, and performance.

  4. Communication: Interacting with stakeholders to explain new features or diagnose issues.

jobs.title: Sr. Web Developer
jobs.content:
Who We're Looking For


We're looking for a passionate and experienced Web Developer who is self-motivated and can work in a collaborative team environment. You should take pride in what you build and you're always striving to improve both yourself and your work. While you won't be designing product experiences per se, you will be directly responsible for the quality of the experience that is ultimately delivered to our users so you should have a strong sense of good interactive design principles. You should understand the balance between pixel-perfect execution and releasing quickly and consistently. You should be able to work in a full-time capacity in our office located in Santa Monica, California.


What You Will Be Doing


You will be building and maintaining web applications and crafting user experiences that are optimized to be both easy and delightful to use. Your output will be code that is performant, cleanly written, and humanly readable. Your contribution will be helping our team solve real problems for real people and building products that help those people live better lives. You will work with us to identify issues and opportunities within our products and expand our capabilities and competencies to address them effectively.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Thorn invites software engineers in the San Francisco Bay Area to join the Thorn Innovation Lab to contribute their talent to create new technology interventions to fight child sexual exploitation. The lab's areas of focus will include human trafficking, darkweb child abuse/exploitation content and social platform cyber safety. Technically, projects in these areas will span a wide variety of engineering and analysis topics relevant to cybersecurity and intelligence including adaptive crawling/scraping, statistical analysis, search, machine learning (NLP, computer vision, sentiment analysis), entity resolution, data pipeline development, UI/API design, and more.


Engineers will participate in both product development as well as broad exploration in the space – working to identify new possible interventions. Engineers must be big thinkers, but also executors,  interested in solving hard problems that require more than just technical skills – including partnership development and learning new subject matter areas.

jobs.title: Full Stack Engineer
jobs.content:
Who We Are


YogaGlo, Inc. is a health and wellness company. Our products offer online yoga classes from world class teachers straight to your personal device or home television. Our culture has a strong focus on craftsmanship and continuous learning, where you will be expected to contribute.


What You Will Be Doing


Build & maintain backend tooling, services and APIs while working alongside a varied group of designers and developers. Create new product features, along with our other team members, with a strong emphasis on user experience and performance.


Who We Are Looking For


We’re looking for a passionate engineer who is a self-starter but can also work in a collaborative team environment. If you enjoy designing APIs and like working on challenging problems, then we want to hear from you.

jobs.title: Senior Ruby Engineer
jobs.content:
CyberU is a part of the Cornerstone Startup Accelerator, and we are looking for someone who can create the vision for and execute on the infrastructure for a scalable online video and e-commerce learning platform. If you are smart, passionate, resourceful, and want to be a visionary, founding team member who will help craft the technical architecture and direction of our product, then this is opportunity for you. The ability and passion to design and implement something from nothing is a must, along with long term vision for architecting quality code. Come join our team, and get in on the ground floor of a startup that will revolutionize the consumer learning space.


In this role you will...



  • Work with team to define, document, and communicate the core system platform

  • Ensure the platform meets the needs of front-end application teams as well as internal and end users

  • Ensure platform scalability and performance

  • Ensure the platform is easy to deploy and sustain

  • Ensure platform resiliency and plan for evolutionary paths and pivots

  • Ensure that internal users understand the platform

  • Work as needed on tool and environment selection

  • Produce scalable, robust, high-quality code

  • Manage risk identification and risk mitigation strategies

  • Actively contribute to architectural whiteboard/design session

  • Promote the platform

  • ... and being the rockstar you are, be willing to take on additional responsibilities as needed

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Position Summary:


Reporting to the VP of Technology, the Software Engineer will help develop our proprietary platform -- combining vehicle telematics, a carsharing reservation system, predictive analytics, a customer portal and mobile app.  This is your chance to create something awesome from scratch, with a clean slate and no legacy systems!


Duties & Responsibilities:



  • Deliver complete, high performance web applications for desktop and mobile devices

  • Automate and support the data value chain (vehicle to backend, to front-end), including migration of prototype algorithms into production intent server-based scripts

  • Integrate and develop REST APIs

  • Build client-side user authentication and authorization between multiple applications

  • Implement user security and data protection

  • Write end-to-end (unit/integration) automated test suites for all components

  • Create configuration, build, and test scripts for Continuous Integration environments

jobs.title: Software Test Automation Engineer
jobs.content:
Schweitzer Engineering Laboratories, Inc. Job Postings


The Opportunity


Schweitzer Engineering Laboratories (SEL) seeks a professional, innovative and meticulous individual for our Software Engineer position in PC Software. If you are looking for an opportunity to work for a great company, with excellent benefits and an outstanding reputation for quality, then we invite you to join our technical team!


Software Test Automation Engineer


Responsibilities:



  • Implement and manage software quality policies, systems, and processes.

  • Perform the role of test lead on software projects to ensure that all testing deliverables meet quality, cost, schedule and performance objectives.

  • Develop and maintain in-depth Test Plans and drive Test Strategies.

  • Design and implement automated test infrastructure and automated test procedures.

  • Create test plans, write and execute automated tests, and document test results.

  • Participate in project planning and estimation.

  • As an integral team member on development projects, participate in software requirements specifications and design document creation with a focus on testability.

  • Participate in project change control board meetings to review and evaluate product change requests.

  • Evaluate, select, and implement new technologies for existing and future product.

  • Supervise and mentor Associate Software Engineers and Test Technicians in state-of-the-art testing practices.

  • Work with the Software Process Group to identify and support standard methods, and common tools and scripts.

  • To grow the expertise of software personnel, determine the type of skills and knowledge required for them to meet or exceed the needs of development projects.

  • Develop and conduct internal training programs. Define training standards for personnel.

  • Continuously identify, measure, follow, and improve R&D processes.

  • Other duties as assigned.

jobs.title: Software Engineer III
jobs.content:
Software Engineer III | Current Openings













Essential Duties:



  • Gathers and writes technical requirements for complex stories and features. Designs smaller stories within a feature. May author technical designs and takes responsibility for features.

  • Codes web applications following specifications and using the appropriate tools. Follows best practices.

  • Maintains and modifies existing applications.

  • Identifies internal/external issues of limited scope and drives to resolution. Proactively seeks and fixes defects.

  • Contributes to project document reviews, and design/code reviews.

  • Adheres to IT Control Policies throughout design, development, and testing.

  • Works with cross-functional teams and interacts with internal business partners to verify/clarify business requirements and design decisions.

  • Engages team to review ideas, solutions, issues, and/or concerns.

  • Applies AGILE concepts and works collaboratively and closely with QA in an Agile/Kanban environment.

  • Generates supporting unit test as well as system test specifications and implementations; can build automated tests.

  • May train and mentor new team members as needed.













Software Engineer III | Current Openings













Competencies:



  • Proficient with multiple technologies and may have some understanding of design principles.

  • Ability to handle multiple projects and possesses a proven track record of high quality deliverables.

  • Ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to technical staff and is able to work effectively with cross-functional departments with varying degrees of technical experience.

  • Understands and is able to explain up and downstream impacts across products and teams.

  • Constructively challenges the status quo; develops, proposes, and supports the implementation of innovative and creative solutions. Iterates and improves upon domain technology.

  • Displays flexibility in adapting to changing conditions.

  • Strong team player, makes a valuable contribution to team objectives, displays trust and mutual understanding, accepts constructive feedback, and handles confrontation constructively.

  • Proficient understanding of and ability to apply the AGILE methodology; competent AGILE team member.

jobs.title: JavaScript Software Engineer in the Solar Industry
jobs.content:
Become an integral part of the solar industry, and increase residential solar adoption across the U.S. by lowering soft costs associated with system design and permitting. Based in downtown Detroit, our growing business offers a creative, fast-paced, high-energy atmosphere. 


GreenLancer is looking for self-motivated software engineers with exceptional skills to join us in developing innovative solutions for the solar industry. Our technology team works in an agile fashion to deliver business value consistently and as often as possible. We're building microservices on AWS with the latest JavaScript frameworks, which allows us to deploy new functionality quickly and effortlessly.


As a Software Engineer you will architect and develop new functionality end­-to­-end, working closely with peers and collaborating with other teams to implement technical solutions. Being a Software Engineer means keeping up-to-date with new technology, and always learning, improving, and advancing your skills.


As a member of our small technology team, your work will have a huge impact.


Essential Functions and responsibilities:



  • Write clean, maintainable code using modern technology

  • Execute on the technical vision

  • Collect and analyze research from end users and other teams to present

  • Develop scalable and high-performance web applications

  • Execute on deliverables in a timely manner

  • Work closely with designers, other software engineers, leadership, and management

  • Provide feedback and solutions that would improve department processes and or task deliverables

jobs.title: User Experience Strategist
jobs.content:
Alley Interactive is a team of experienced web developers, designers, and UX professionals who tackle the most complex challenges facing top publishers. We design and build big websites using open source technologies for leaders in media, entertainment, and nonprofit publishing. We are seeking an experienced IA/UX professional who loves the process of project discovery, requirements documentation, and information architecture creation.

At Alley, we conduct our work within an agile framework; design, development, and UX work lockstep through sprints ensuring our projects succeed, and that we work as an efficient, tightly integrated team. We aim to change the fundamental way sites are builtârather than working with static designs in Photoshop, we execute the visual design process in the browser using front-end technology.

To ensure front-end and back-end development unfold smoothly, we begin our projects with an agile discovery phase where we convert project requirements, business goals, and audience needs into user personas, stories and information architecture. From there, we work in sprints and actively collaborate across disciplines to create sketches and prototypes that guide development. The UX Strategistâs primary role will be executing this initial work, collaborating with UX Designers and developers as they craft our clientsâ websites.

Responsibilities
  • Identify client business goals, audiences, and success metrics that collectively inform UX design and development solutions.
  • Author user personas.
  • Develop new information architecture (sitemaps, content types, and taxonomies).
  • Participate in user story writing workshops and design studios.
  • Participate in Quality Assurance (QA) on prototypes and websites prior to launch.
  • Work with clients to make iterative improvements to their sites after launch.
  • Work closely with Alleyâs Director of User Experience, Creative Director, UX Designers and UX Developers.

Qualifications
  • Demonstrable experience as an IA/UX professional.
  • Ability to manage and keep track of project requirements.
  • Experience developing information architecture, user flows, user personas and stories, and wireframes, both sketches and high fidelity.
  • Familiarity with the website design and development processes, ideally with experience in Agile environments.
  • Ability to work in a team-based, remote, agency environment.

About Alley Interactive
We offer competitive salaries and company subsidized medical, dental and vision benefits. We also offer a 401(k) with company matching, a profit sharing plan, and transportation and lunch benefits programs.

We have no set hours and do not limit vacation or sick time (but we require everyone to take a minimum of two weeks off). We trust our team members to get their work done and take the time off they need to recharge.

Alley was born in New York City, and we have an office in the Flatiron District of Manhattan. We also have an office in downtown Burlington, Vermont. Our team members are free to work at either of these locations, or out of their homes or a local coworking space. About a third of our team lives in the New York area, and the rest are spread around 19 other states (and counting).

Alley Interactive is an equal opportunity employer and we seek to increase diversity in the tech industry. We encourage applications from women, people of color, people with disabilities, members of the LGBTQ community, and other communities traditionally underrepresented in this field.

To apply: Follow this link (https://alleyinteractive.applytojob.com/apply/q7gtS2/User-Experience-Strategist?source=wwr) and please complete the application, being sure to send your resume and your portfolio. Recruiters: Please do NOT contact us about this job. All hiring duties at Alley are carried out by our staff.

jobs.title: Work From Home Salary+Commission Part-Time Spanish, French, German, or Portuguese Speaking Inside Sales Representative for BrickFTP
jobs.content:
Do you absolutely love sales and get excited about the idea of scoring your next commission? 

Enjoy learning about and working with software-as-a-service?

Want to boost your income without changing your lifestyle?

Do you speak at least one of the following languages:  Spanish, French, German, or Portuguese?

Does making $1,000 a month + 5% commissions for just 10 hours a week sound good? 

 

If so, we have an awesome, part-time career opportunity at a fun, laid-back tech company.

We're Action Verb, and we're looking to hire a part-time inside sales professional to join our team.  You'll be the front line inside sales representative for BrickFTP (http://brickftp.com/) for your language (Spanish, French, German, or Portuguese).

This is a part-time, salary + commission, work-from-home position.  

BrickFTP is expanding into foreign markets with a focus on Brazil,  Spanish-speaking South America,  France, and Germany.  We are looking for bilingual speakers who speak their market's language as well as full fluency in English.  

For French and Germany, we prefer folks physically located in Europe, or at least willing to work European timezone hours.  For Spanish or Portuguese, we are open to staff in the United States or anywhere in the Americas.

If you can cover more than one language (besides English), we especially want to talk to you.

Pay is on a contract basis, unless you are from the United States, in which case, you could instead be a W2 employee.

This could be a great add-on to anyone who is currently working from home and wants another opportunity to round out their portfolio of work.

Recruiters, please stop reading now.  We only want to talk directly to interested candidates.


Action Verb's Story

Action Verb is a bootstrapped, profitable company founded in 2007.  Action Verb offers two main products:  BrickFTP,  a hosted file sharing service for business, and Vae Platform, a unique web hosting platform with an integrated SaaS CMS system.  Our SaaS services have over 1,600 paying customers and a total userbase of about 50,000 users.

We're a small company (you'll be the 6th, 7th, or 8th person on the team when you join). We all work from home and communicate via Slack.

You can check out our website at https://brickftp.com/.

 

Here's where you come in.

Although this is a sales position, it is not one of those hard-selling, cold-calling types of stressful sales jobs.

You'll be calling and emailing warm leads who have responded to online advertising and would like to be walked through our software products before deciding to buy. Your job is simply to help them understand our software, how it can benefit them, and why they should use our software instead of our competitors.

Basically, you'll be the "face" of our business to all our prospects in your market.

You'll patiently deal with users who don't fully understand our products.  However, most of our customers are highly technical CTOs or IT director-types, so we hope that your time will be spent mostly with high-level customers who understand our products.

You'll have the support of our 4 staff engineers in case the sales calls get too technical.

BrickFTP is an easy product to sell.  Our customers are businesses and the price point is just $49 per month, so this is not a high-pressure sales situation.  Also remember that these are warm leads who opted-in asking for a phone call.

You will also be responsible for front-line customer support in your language/market.  Any issue you can resolve yourself, you'll resolve, and anything else you'll work with our English-speaking support engineers to resolve.  You may have to get on conference calls to translate for our customers if necessary.

 

Here are the details of the Pay.

Pay is $25 per hour for 10 hours per week plus 5% of the annual value of any package that you sell.  We expect the average commission to be about $50.

Each market receives an average of 200 leads per month, and we expect that a good sales person will be able to convert them at 10-20%.

What skills are we looking for?

We are looking for you to have:

  • Perfect phone demeanor and ability to communicate effectively via the phone.
  • Perfect grammar and professional tone via email.
  • Basic understanding of the technical aspects of hosting.
  • Fluency in English plus the language of at least one foreign market:  Brazil, Spanish-speaking South America, France, or Germany.  If you can speak more than one language, please say so!
  • Previous experience doing telephone-based inside sales, ideally in a software or technology related business.
 

What makes this opportunity unique?

A really awesome team.  The team includes a strong technical founder and four other top technical engineers and operations folks.  We'll have your back and do everything in our power to make your job as easy as possible.

Work from home.  Thereâs nothing we hate more than commuting.  So, we donât have an office and would definitely like to avoid having one for as long as possible.  If you have a family at home, move between locations, or even live abroad, this is a great opportunity to do all your work from home and stop wasting all that time on commuting.   Itâs like getting 2 free hours added back to your day.

Choose your own hours. As long as youâre available to take calls and return calls during the business hours of your market, we're flexible with exactly when you work during the day.  Work 2 hours, then run and take the kids to lunch, come back and work another 3 hours.  We work highly variable hours so weâll be able to sync up no matter when you work.  We do have full team meetings on Tuesdays and Wednesdays at 4pm Eastern, so those are required as well.

Free travel.  Because weâre a distributed team that all work from home, we go out of our way bring the team together in person a couple times a year.  We speak at a number of industry conferences (think PubCon, AdTech, Affiliate Summit, etc.) and at various Internet Marketing meetups, summits, and training sessions.  When it makes sense, and when we can, weâd like to bring you along.

We use these as an opportunity to get the team together to relax, work, brainstorm, and party with our customers and each other.

Some of these trips will be in conjunction with the programming and marketing teams from our other companies, so youâll get to meet the âextended familyâ as well.

Stability.  Action Verb is bootstrapped, profitable, adequately capitalized, and debt-free.  We are committed to continuously improving our customer experience and believe that our products will never be âfinished.â

To apply: Submit Your Resume Here: http://actionverb.jazz.co/apply/jYnAuF/Work-From-Home-SalaryCommission-PartTime-Spanish-French-German-Or-Portuguese-Speaking-Inside-Sales-Representative-For-BrickFTPWe can't wait to read it and we're looking to hire immediately. Thanks for reading!

jobs.title: Java Development Lead
jobs.content:
Loblaw Digital is the team responsible for building and operating e-commerce businesses for Canada’s largest and most successful retailer. So far we’ve created leading responsive e-commerce experiences for Loblaws Click & Collect (shop.loblaws.ca), Shoppers Drug Mart beautyBOUTIQUE (beautyboutique.ca), and Joe Fresh (joefresh.com), with much more to come.

We are based in downtown Toronto and operate like a start-up with extensive resources. We are an entrepreneurial, fast-paced, collaborate, and fun team working to transform the way Canadians shop.

To achieve this goal, we are looking for talented and passionate individuals who want to solve challenging problems and make a significant and lasting impact on Canadians.
Role Mandate:

Working from our downtown office, you will report to the Director, Software Development and will assist in building, improving, and maintaining a world-class, multi-channel eCommerce platform. This is a hands-on technical role, leading and mentoring a team of both senior and junior developers within the eCommerce Team. You will also lead by example, developing software across the full-stack of a multi-channel platform from HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to server-side Java.

Responsibilities:

• Manage the day-to-day activities of the Development Team
• Ensure long-term direction of the project from a technical perspective
• Motivate, coach, and train team members in a manner that will exceed business’ expectations
• Provide clear directions and guidance on technical issues to all team members
• Write high-quality code for web-based applications, to create and improve robust high-volume production applications
• Develop and evaluate prototypes and ideas quickly
• Take the lead in code and architecture reviews
• Lead the effort to create and refine a modern, efficient front-end using JavaScript, CSS, and HTML using the Spring framework
• Translate wireframes, creative design, and functional requirements into final products
• Develop JavaScript solutions using standard frameworks including JQuery
• Construct design documents and documentation to aid in maintenance and code reuse
• Assist in acceptance testing for business and technical requirements
• Improve program logic and performance tuning while guaranteeing quality assurance
• Work closely with the Quality Control and Technical Communication team members to ensure high quality deliverables
• Provides input to status reports on the “health” of the application.
• Provides support by ensuring stability of the application and addressing and resolving business issues in a timely manner.


Accommodation is available upon request for applicants and colleagues with disabilities.

jobs.title: Test Lead
jobs.content:
Are you looking for a great opportunity to showcase your IT knowledge and skills? Consider this opportunity with the Central Agencies I&IT Cluster, in the role of Test Lead.

What can I expect to do in this role? In this role you will:

  • lead the testing practice of agile project teams using test-driven development
  • establish and implement common testing practices for all types of software and environment tests, including functional tests, unit and component tests, performance and load tests, usability and user acceptance tests and exploratory tests
  • coordinate and lead the delivery of quality assurance and continuous improvement (QA, CI) services for the Cluster, and its partners

Please note: The current location for this position is in Toronto, however, Oshawa may be considered as an alternate location for part of the work week based on operational requirements and upon the successful applicant's request as per the Central Agencies Cluster's flex program.

Location: Toronto

How do I qualify? Quality Assurance and Testing Knowledge and Skills

  • you have knowledge and understanding of quality assurance methodologies, object-oriented analysis/design techniques, proven facility in structured methodologies for the design, development/implementation of n-tier web-based applications, extensive experience in the use of test and development tools
  • you have excellent working knowledge of industry best practice testing automation tools including tools for use in LAMP/open source environments
  • you have knowledge of current development and testing tools/languages within the different frameworks and platforms (especially Java, LAMP) and the development/testing of collaborative workspaces and portals using industry standard technologies

Knowledge

  • you have proven experience in the development/testing/implementation of applications, including considerable knowledge of different platforms, operating systems, environments, database technologies, languages and telecommunications protocols
  • you have knowledge of and experience with testing best practices in the context of agile development methodologies
  • you can estimate significant development/implementation costs as they relate to quality control components and develop and interpret technical standards and guidelines Leadership and Analytical Skills
  • you can lead test planning activities and projects
  • you have proven experience in monitoring/enforcing application development and quality control standards

Communication Skills

  • you have demonstrated customer service and consensus building skills to determine client expectations for the development/ implementation of information systems and technology that meet corporate efficiency, effectiveness, access and security goals
  • you can provide credible/timely advice to the Senior Manager and project managers, lead quality control activities, undertake quality control reviews, report on findings, and recommend solutions to improve software quality

Salary Range: $1,357.77 - $1,753.98 per week

Additional information:

  • 1 Permanent, 222 Jarvis St, Toronto, Toronto Region

jobs.title: Senior Java Developer
jobs.content:
Loblaw Digital is the team responsible for building and operating e-commerce businesses for Canada’s largest and most successful retailer. So far we’ve created leading responsive e-commerce experiences for Loblaws Click & Collect (shop.loblaws.ca), Shoppers Drug Mart beautyBOUTIQUE (beautyboutique.ca), and Joe Fresh (joefresh.com), with much more to come.

We are based in downtown Toronto and operate like a start-up with extensive resources. We are an entrepreneurial, fast-paced, collaborate, and fun team working to transform the way Canadians shop.

To achieve this goal, we are looking for talented and passionate individuals who want to solve challenging problems and make a significant and lasting impact on Canadians.

We are an agile shop, constantly tinkering with our process to make all our lives better. That process includes JIRA Agile for end-to-end agile project management and defects, Bamboo for CI, Git (Stash) for source control, Selenium for automated testing, JRebel and 15" Retina MacBookPro's for all our developers.

The Role:

Working from our downtown office, you will report to the E-Commerce Technology Lead and will assist in building, improving and maintaining a world-class, multi-channel e-commerce platform. This is a hands-on role in the E-Commerce Development Team where you will develop software across the full-stack of a multi-channel platform from HTML, CSS & Javascript to server-side Java and application specific database tuning on Oracle.

As a senior software developer at Loblaw Digital, you will be presented with opportunities to:

• Develop complex consumer facing software using Java, Spring Framework and Hybris.
• Mentor, coach less experienced developers, through design sessions, code reviews and pair programming.
• Work through hard problems with your team and deliver consistent results.
• Think long term. Create technical roadmap for products or services your team owns.
• With your experience and judgment, influence the business on how software can enhance end user experience.
• Follow agile development principles when the situation calls for it. Use tools such as continuous integration, automated tests and automated deployments to improve product time-to-market.
• Work together with front-end developers and external development agencies.
• Organize and participate in our twice a year hackathons, where technology and business work together to create cool things.

jobs.title: Director of Service Delivery REMOTE
jobs.content:
About XWP


Companies with complex, large-scale WordPress platforms partner with XWP for technical consulting and engineering. We have a passion and enthusiasm for what we do and a sincere care for each other and our clients. XWP is a place where people find challenging work, collaborative teammates, and opportunities to grow and serve. We work remotely and are distributed globally.


This is an invitation for the right person to join our team and craft a new vision for what exceptional service delivery can be at XWP and lead our team in achieving that vision.


Your invitation awaits if you…



  • Are seasoned in the strategy, planning, execution and delivery of large-scale software development projects with distributed teams using agile methodologies

  • Have proven skills guiding and mentoring project managers and technical leads

  • Want to play a key part in helping our company and team explore and expand its potential

  • Believe in building positive, trusting relationships and in serving others before yourself

  • Want to be surrounded by a team who champions your work, supports your decisions, celebrates your successes and challenges you to expand your thinking

  • Desire to serve in a purpose-filled role where you will make a meaningful difference


You should apply if you get excited about the opportunity to....



  • Consistently push the bar for how we serve our clients during delivery

  • Develop people, processes, and tools that serve in delivery of services and products to our clients

  • Champion the design and implementation of our delivery methodologies and tools for teams

  • Support our Team Leads in delivering what we’ve promised and in creating exceptional experiences for our clients


The impact you will have...



  • With your guidance our Team Leads will learn and grow in their roles

  • In your care our client’s satisfaction will consistently be high and improve across the board, helping boost the view of XWP as trusted and peerless advisor
