jobs.title: Director of Design
jobs.content:
Job Description




You are a passionate advocate of the brand and its users. You have an innate ability to articulate stakeholder visions into intuitive and compelling user experiences. You have a strong track record of designing successful new products. You are collaborative and tireless in the pursuit of excellence throughout the entire product lifecycle.



Your Task:


• Support rapid iteration and experimentation of user experience within existing apps and new products to increase user engagement and attract new customers


• Produce intuitive and innovative user experience designs that address complex user needs within the constraints of distribution and monetization objectives


• Develop storyboards, user flows, mockups, and prototypes, with the goal to communicate detailed interaction behaviors that will drive requirements and specifications


• Partner closely with the product manager and engineering team in an Agile environment to successfully build and deploy intuitive, habit forming, and viral native apps with high quality standards


• Prioritize and implement the best practices and latest features provided in iOS, Android, and wearable platforms, while increasing value of and for the customer. 


• Direct the design and user experience function to align the talent, tools and processes, with the business goals and brand strategy


• Inspire, mentor, grow and attract top design talent


• Oversee all design and user experience initiatives across all platforms in support of ambitious brand strategy and user engagement goals


• Modernize the visual representation of the brand and develop a strategy to ensure consistent brand identity across a portfolio of services and applications and across all user touch points


• Develop, maintain and enforce brand guidelines and assets (logos, color palettes, UI/UX etc)


• Research the needs and habits of the target audience to inform design and user experience strategy


• Present designs, research data and design principals to a diverse set of stakeholders, including C-level executives

jobs.title: QA Engineer/DevOps
jobs.content:
Job Description




You have a passion for quality products and skills for developing tools, implementing processes and methods to achieve high quality and a high degree of automation in our delivery process. We value innovation, ownership, smart risk taking while learning to improve ourselves every day. 



What you get to do:



  • Own many of the end-to-end processes that allow us to efficiently develop and release high quality software into production. This spans dev, QA and Operations, i.e. DevOps.

  • Champion best quality practices in an agile environment

  • Work with developers, Product and Project managers, Release Engineers, Ops and other teams to come up with the best test strategies and ensure the highest quality new feature/product.

  • Design and build automation frameworks for back end and front end applications, including API testing, using Selenium or other test frameworks for Java and node.js applications.

  • Build continuous integration and delivery pipelines; become proficient with containers (e.g. Docker) and be the subject matter expert in this field for our development teams

  • Maintain applications in production by monitoring performance and making changes to app configurations

  • Track and report quality metrics to determine the effect of changes made to various systems.

jobs.title: Engineer 2, Network Ops
jobs.content:
Engineering and Platform Services helps drive the new generation of products that are transforming Comcast into a media and technology company. Engineering manages the operations for Comcast's industry-leading video, high-speed Internet and voice services for consumers and businesses, and runs a network that supports numerous multi-billion dollar businesses.



Platform Services includes three companies owned by Comcast, namely FreeWheel, STRATA and thePlatform, plus the Comcast Wholesale, Advanced Advertising, and Advertising Technology organizations. These companies are creating next-generation technology for the fast-growing advanced advertising market. They enable and innovate solutions to support both traditional and emerging programmatic and premium advertising markets through our platforms, data, marketplace and sales channels.




Job Summary:



Responsible for operating, deploying, managing, and continuouslyimproving Comcast's Voice, Video, Commercial, Data, Home Security,Systems, and Network services as well as associated infrastructure in a7/24 environment. Examples of infrastructure include, but are notlimited to: routers, CMTS, switches, optical and TDM transport,applications, servers, IP scopes, databases, etc. Position focuses ondeploying and stabilizing code, technologies, services, networks,systems, tools and driving standardization, automation, and service

focused instrumentation. Provides subject matter expertise, resolvescomplex break/fix scenarios, engaging broader teams as necessary;partners with/leads engineering, vendors, and regions to achievecontinuous improvement. Serves as high-tier operations support for various field, CARE, vendors, and customer-focused organizations.Contributes to command and control-related activities focused onrestoration of complex outages, communication across Comcast, and rapidrestoration. Works and directly leads external vendors, third parties,and associated agencies, when necessary, to address issues across thePSTN, peering arrangements, inter-operability issues, etc. Works withlimited supervision and direction while executing associated functionsand responsibilities. Follows operational practices and independentlydetermines/develops approaches for non-routine solutions. Receivesgeneral direction in areas of focus. Serves as team lead on projects.



Core Responsibilities:

- Overnight shift 11:00pm 7:30am



- Performs a variety of complex analytical duties in the planning,deployment, testing and evaluation of Comcast's network, products, andservices including CRAN, CMTS, and the IP platform, Voice, Data,Commercial, Systems, and Video platform. Works closely with engineering,vendors, and field to identify and drive improvements across thetopology.

- Directs third party agencies (i.e. AT&T, Verizon) and internalresources while troubleshooting and resolving complex peer-to-peertroubles focusing on rapid restoration. Devises and implementsstrategies for solving technical issues directly impacting internal and external customers or increasing performance across broad eco-systems.

- Develops, produces, and reviews of documentation, instructional, andprocedural manuals for other employees to utilize to resolve problems ormake network improvements. Examples include: complex processes foracceptance of new products (i.e. cable modems, systems,) testing such asoperational readiness, tools focused on automation (i.e. IP scopetool,) etc.

- Supports all of the XNOC tools and alarms; analyzes systems needs anddetermines prioritization of break/fix scenarios; implements codechanges and suggests improvements. Ensures the availability ofnetworking services; studies, evaluates, analyzes, and monitors the network and services to determine problem areas and/or areas of concern. Monitors, isolates, triages, and resolves outages and impairments.Identifies and implements opportunities for improvement.

- Ensures databases, applications, hardware, and other related resourcesare properly maintained. Provides subject matter expertise on equipmentand services to other operational groups. Updates code and software toensure proper system performance.

- Provides clear, crisp, and concise technical communication andcoordination during medium outage scenarios.

- Directly executes changes, in the network and across systems, focusedon deploying new services, implementing changes, and stabilizingproducts following established change management processes. Accountablefor configuration management techniques, ensuring infrastructure iscorrectly aligned and fully compliant with standards.

- Accountable for understanding and managing services across complexecosystems, cutting across multiple technologies, organizations, andsolutions. Requires detailed understanding ofinterdependencies/intradependences. Accountable for providing technical assessment of changes across ecosystems to ensure resolving potentialconflicts before impacting intra-/inter- related vertical systems.Develops and reports on metrics which show system uptime and overallservice desk compliance to ITIL standards.

- Provides training andcoaching to NSAR, CARE, sub-set of field organizations, peers, and morejunior engineering operations staff.

- Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in mattersof significance.

- Regular, consistent and punctual attendance.



- Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.



Job Specification:

- Bachelors Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or Equivalent

- Generally requires 2-5 years related experience



- NETWORK- Load balancer, firewalls, routers, CMTS, associated protocols,advanced troubleshooting, protocols, multicast and unicast, MPLS, IPmanagement, DNS, traffic management, and sparing. VOICE- PSTN, SIP,routing, Cedar Point, Cisco, IMS, SS7, carrier to carriertroubleshooting, etc. COMMERCIAL- Axerra, Ciena, Alcatel Lucent, Juniper, Layers 1, 2,3, ENS, and associated services. VIDEO- DSG and 2way conduitapplications, channel migration from the headend to the CRAN, set-tops,IP video deliver-i.e. RPD's, OM-1000's, and NC-1500's, MPEGtroubleshooting, through a variety of highly complex analytical dutiesin the testing and evaluation of Comcast's network.



- In-depth knowledge and breadth across two to three majorecosystems/technologies requiring technical competency, advancedtraining, and outstanding verbal and written communication skills.



- Leverages engineering methodologies is specific areas of focus.Possesses in-depth working knowledge and application of process design,client server technology, and internal processes




Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer

jobs.title: Digital Marketing Architect
jobs.content:
Comcast's Technology & Product organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards.





Position Summary

This highly visible and critical role will provide guidance and direction for the entire spectrum of customer-facing digital capabilities, including customer acquisition, on-boarding, account management, and ongoing customer help & support functions. As the world continues to evolve towards a digital-centric paradigm, the necessity for the creation of simple, intuitive, fast, reliable, and constantly improving digital interaction experiences is paramount. This role will be central to shaping both technical and functional aspects of these experiences, with specific focus on identifying the appropriate aggregation of technologies to satisfy numerous functional imperatives, and effectively evangelize technology choices to both business and technical constituents. To be successful, the target candidate will have broad experience and expertise in everything from cloud-based digital marketing strategies/tools to content management platforms to digital analytic engines to social media platforms.





Core Responsibilities:



-Define the eBusiness architecture, technology strategy, and implementation standards to support numerous business imperatives

-Define the technology vision and Architecture roadmap for digital marketing capabilities

-Manage the digital marketing technology prototyping, selection, implementation, adoption and maturation within the organization

-Apply and integrate emerging technological trends to new and existing systems architecture

-Monitor current and future trends in the e-commerce, web, mobile, and digital marketing space that will influence internal software direction in the future

-Collaborate with architects, developers and business partners to design enterprise applications, including design of User Interface (UI) components, internal/external web services, content management (CMS) and database interactions, and 3rd party cloud solutions

-Lead, facilitate, and grow a community of eBusiness architects to build world class solutions

-Create high-level and detailed design artifacts using appropriate tools and technologies

-Interface with peers throughout the enterprise to ensure good communication and alignment with the larger technology organization.

-Ensure projects are envisioned, designed, and implemented using best in class tools & practices

-Ensure digital solutions are well engineered, operable, maintainable

-Mentor team members in relevant technologies and implementation architecture

-Perform business analysis / requirements analysis with the help of business stakeholders

-Evaluate and manage potential commercial and technical partners

-Operate as a subject matter expert on digital marketing, web analytics and experience management





Qualifications:

-Minimum of 10 years of large scale technology development & delivery experience

-Minimum of 7 years of experience working with management and senior leadership

-5+ years experience architecting and implementing customer-facing digital technologies, with specific focus on digital marketing and customer self-service

-Expert knowledge of the design and implementation patterns supporting custom integrations between Marketing Automation Solutions, CRM Platforms, Content Management Solutions, Analytics, 1st & 3rd Party data, A/B Testing/Optimization, Segmentation, Personalization and technology solutions supporting these capabilities

-Demonstrated understanding of current and emerging web technologies, responding to search algorithm changes, browsers, analytics, data and customer intelligence, and content management systems and processes

-Experience designing/developing mobile web sites & mobile applications (Android, iOS)

-Exposure to Advanced Web Traffic Management technologies (Akamai/DNS/F5/A10)

-Exposure to modern development languages/technologies (ASP.NET, c#, Ruby, Grails, Java, Polymer, Knockout, AngularJS, MVC, JQuery, Node.js, etc.) and associated delivery/deployment technologies

-Experience with high traffic e-commerce and self-service websites

-Ability to understand business and technical context, objectives and constraints

-Must have worked in cross functional and blended teams employees, contractors, customer, onsite/offshore, vendor

-Familiarity with current software design methodologies including agile (scrum) development process

-Experience with continuous delivery and integration tools and processes (TeamCity, TFS, Octopus Deploy)

-Experience in designing & executing content management systems, web content management a plus

-Experience applying multivariant testing, analytics and real-time optimization to develop personalized web experiences

-Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering or related disciplines; extensive, directly-related experience may be considered in-lieu of degree(s)





Personal Characteristics:

-Ability to communicate technical details to wide variety of technical and non-technical audiences

-Excellent skills in emotional intelligence, influencing, and persuasion with individual and group stakeholders. Must be a highly effective collaborator

-Passion for continuous process and technology improvement

-Strong speaking, writing, collaboration and follow-up skills

-Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail in an environment that requires regular evaluation and negotiation of priorities

-Ability to work independently and as a team member

-Able to prioritize and execute tasks in a dynamic, fast-paced environment

-Strong customer service, interpersonal and communication skills the ability to interact with many different people, internally and externally






Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer

jobs.title: Business Analyst - Media Advertising Software
jobs.content:
STRATA is an advertising technology leader headquartered in Chicago. A wholly owned subsidiary of a Fortune 100 company, with over 30 years of experience building innovative software products that have set the standard in the media industry. As we continue to develop new systems and technologies that benefit our clients, we are actively seeking talented professionals in the following area(s): traditional and emerging programmatic and premium advertising markets through our platforms, data, marketplace and sales channels.






BUSINESS ANALYST



Summary



The Business Analyst (BA) will serve in a variety of roles, as business circumstances dictate.



The primary role will be to help guide the development of software products that will help the division reach its business goals and improve client satisfaction. Working closely with STRATA product managers and/or product owners, the BA will contribute directionally to product input, analysis, and/or testing. He/she will help set goals for production, testing and implementation to ensure acceptance and customer satisfaction. The BA should have a thorough understanding of the competitive products in the marketplace and their associated capabilities and use that knowledge to further improve and enhance STRATA’s product offerings.



As a client-facing representative, he/she will work closely with the STRATA TAM (Technical Account Manager) to ensure effective system implementation and ongoing use of all products. The BA should be seen as a client partner in maximizing the return of the client’s investment and finding the best possible STRATA solutions. This requires continual and effective communication with the client (including management and end users) – as well as a variety of STRATA internal groups (product managers, trainers, developers, technical support, client service representatives, etc.)



On a day-to-day basis the BA will be responsible for understanding client needs and demonstrate (help design ways) how those needs can be met through STRATA product development teams.



Essential Functions



Engage, analyze and coordinate effective solutions for key clients.



Develop and foster positive relationships both internal and external

jobs.title: Software Dev & Engineering - NLP
jobs.content:
Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the world’s best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast.





Summary:



The Voice Control Platform is part of Comcast Cable's Technology & Product (T&P) organization and serves the larger company with advanced NLP technologies for searching and discovering any type of content in the entertainment catalog available.

The Voice control Platform needs an NLP engineer to continue to expand and grow the capabilities of our products.

You will work with other engineers and researchers with backgrounds in advanced fields such as natural language processing, information retrieval, and knowledge representation. As a key member of the team, you will help define, refine, and test state of the art algorithms, and scale the associated systems for high performance, stability, and availability.

Comcast T&P encourages career development with regular opportunities for training and programs for innovative cross-team projects such as week-long Hackathon and job rotation programs over the summer.





Job Summary:



Responsible for planning and designing new software and web applications. Analyzes, tests, and assists with the integration of new applications. Oversees the documentation of all development activity.

Trains non-technical personnel. Assists with tracking performance metrics. Integrates knowledge of business and functional priorities. Acts as a key contributor in a complex and crucial environment. May lead teams or projects and shares expertise.





Core Responsibilities:



To develop new technology and adapt/apply existing technologies to NLP problems for the Comcast Voice Control Platform. This position is part of a team that uses Speech Recognition, Natural Language Understanding/Processing, Machine Learning along with search technologies such as SOLR/Lucene, tf/idf and relevance ranking, to extract contextually correct entity and verb semantics from speech and apply them to real world solutions across millions of connected homes.

This is a hands on development position and you will be expected to code in a typical linux environment using technologies such as Hibernate and MySql, as well as work with devops technologies such as Splunk and Zookeeper. You will be an integral component of a team that building a scalable system that will be deployed in the largest Cable MSO in the US. We implement an Agile process and you will be expected to be familiar with and use scrum and bi-weekly sprints to deploy features very quickly and document problems using tools such as Jira or Rally.

An ideal candidate would have exposure to NLP and general statistical/modeling techniques such as word embeddings, CRF, HMM, SVM, KNN, and deep learning, and would have published in the area. He or she might have worked on Topic Classification, Parsing, Narrative Thread analysis, parts of speech tagging, or recommendations engines, Sphinx, metadata extraction and machine learning.



The candidate also:



- Collaborates with project stakeholders to identify product and technical requirements.Conducts analysis to determine integration needs.

jobs.title: Principal Product Engineer - Commercial Voice Product Engineering
jobs.content:
Comcast's Technology & Product organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards






Profile: Principal Engineer Commercial Voice Product Engineering



The Principal Engineer performs architecture and design for new services and product solutions for the commercial voice product. The role involves review of product/business requirements and creation of technical requirements, detailed designs and element configurations for the solution. Partnering with other engineering and systems organizations to define and drive architecture roadmaps, detailed designs and vendor/internal deliverables and plans to meet solution delivery.



Key areas of expertise include IMS, SIP, Unified Communications, Virtualization, Voice over IP, RTP, Voice Applications and feature implementations, Cloud technologies, mobile voice and Over-the-top Applications, Service Development Platforms, Media Gateways and control protocols, Voice CPEs and embedded Device Adapters (eDVAs), speech codecs, DIAMETER, SS7, CALEA, e911, SIP peering and infrastructure routing, Session Border Controllers (SBCs), etc.



Also assists in certification planning, deployment planning and operational support, including end-to-end troubleshooting for root cause analysis identifications and defect fix support.





PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:




  • Serve as a technical leader for all aspects of the solution including architecture, detailed design, configuration, monitoring, testing, feature operation, and redundancy and reliability models.

  • Interface with Product Development, Business Unit, Operations, review new product/service requests and applications to define technical requirements, use cases, scenario models, and implementation designs. Translate business and operational requirements to technical requirements.

  • Work with other Comcast organizations to define operational model and tools to be use to monitor and maintain the new service/product offerings.

  • Work with the vendor/element/systems/operations engineers to ensure service solution can be implemented efficiently.

  • Assist design, development, QA and operational teams in end-to-end hands-on troubleshooting in testing and production for root cause analysis identification and defect fix support.

  • Maintain professionalism while performing all job duties. Accept and act on all escalations within area of responsibility.

  • Maintain an understanding of market and product developments and external standards to understand their use and applicability to new service concepts.

  • Produce prototyped solutions in the lab and field as proof of concept to verify and validate new solutions early in the product lifecycle.

  • Participate, contribute and drive industry standards in relevant technology areas.

  • Additional assignments and responsibilities may be assigned from time to time.





COMMUNICATION AND MANUAL SKILLS:




  • Excellent written, oral, and presentation skills.

  • Must be a quick learner on technologies and quick to adapt to new processes.

  • Must be familiar with voice, data, and equipment engineering technologies and have an advanced knowledge of telecommunications equipment, terminology, and standard practices and procedures.

  • Must possess a high degree of self-motivation and have a demonstrated history of independent decision-making.

  • Must possess effective and proven organizational, analytical, and problem-solving skills.

  • Must possess exemplary customer interfacing skills and must exhibit these skills during all interactions with internal and external customers.

  • Must be able to hold frequent and efficient cross team design reviews and needs to meet with key members of each team frequently to make sure that consistent technical information is shared across the program.









PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:






  • Strong experience and knowledge of IMS, Unified Communications, IP, SIP, DIAMETER, and VoIP technologies

  • Strong systems engineering experience with provisioning, billing and operations support systems.

  • Must be familiar and have hands-on experience with voice, data, and equipment engineering technologies and have an advanced knowledge of telecommunications equipment, terminology, and standard practices and procedures.

  • Possess and maintain a working knowledge of all facets of network elements, design and switching.

  • Must be able to review relevant standards and adapt them to Comcast.



REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS




  • Minimum of 15 years experience in telecommunications in large-scale carrier networks.

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Software Engineering, Telecommunications or Networking.

jobs.title: Senior Developer
jobs.content:
We’re a growing company that creates local marketing automation software and we’re looking for a senior level developer to help work with our biggest customer.



We build enterprise level solutions for Fortune 500 customers and need an engineer who is a developer at heart but gets the big picture. Our web-based systems produce all forms of advertising from ads, flyers, emails, flash banners, restaurant menus and any other advertising collateral you can think of.



What is local marketing automation?
We build web applications for large companies that have many local locations. Those local locations want to build brand marketing materials that include their contact information and allows them to customize the material to their needs, without violating brand standards. Our tool allows the brand to lock down the aspects they don’t want to be editable and the local user to customize the parts that make the material unique to them.


Who we Seek


We have developed and maintain many integral parts of our biggest customer’s internal systems ranging from digital asset management to offer management. We need a developer that can help see a project from beginning to end. An ideal candidate would be able to understand our customer’s needs for a feature, help the project manager come up with a specification, implement, and deploy it.

jobs.title: Software Developer - iOS
jobs.content:
The iOS mobile development team at Hulu is looking for a software developer with strong experience building iOS applications. While all members of the team contribute across technologies and products, and from front-end to back-end, this role is focused on reimagining, reworking, enhancing, and improving our iPhone and iPad applications.


In general, we’re looking for some track record of app development doing more than just displaying data from a web-service. We work a lot with media player technologies and web services that power our applications, and expect that a successful candidate would hit the ground running. As a member of a small team, you would be expected to contribute not only to feature development, but also to our development culture – from improving our engineering practices to using new frameworks and languages – in order to ensure that we can build the best application for watching premium video content on mobile devices and tablets. 


WHAT YOU’LL DO



  • Architect, design, and implement the next generation of our native iOS applications using Objective-C and Swift

  • Work with design and product teams to deliver custom user interfaces using the latest iOS UIKit APIs

  • Build across UI, service layers, and backend technologies to create data-driven native client solutions

  • Develop concise and clean code adhering to Apples recommended coding standards

  • Write effective unit tests and documentation

  • Follow an agile development methodology

  • Write entirely new code using proper MVC methodologies and maintain and update existing code

  • Find and correct issues in a complex and rich environment using the latest Xcode instruments and performance tools

  • Coordinate with QA with the implementation, testing and support of iOS applications.

jobs.title: DevOps Automation Engineer
jobs.content:
About Us:

Doctor On Demand is one of the fastest growing startups in the digital health space. Our service allows patients to connect to a real, US-licensed MD or psychologist for immediate consultation from the comfort of their home via video, 24x7x365. The service helps prevent unnecessary in-person doctor visits and helps doctors make extra money. We also have some strategic relationships that give us massive advantages in reaching millions of US consumers.

See how we're making an impact: Read about us in the news or browse through our amazing user reviews.

Our investors include Andreessen / Horowitz, Google Ventures, Venrock, Shasta, Sir Richard Branson and other fantastic angels. The founders have an excellent track record of building great companies.

 

 

 

Responsibilities:

 

  • Improve deployment / CI pipeline to safely deploy our Django based application as quickly as possible

  • Work with engineering and QA team to build infrastructure for testing that ensures high quality code is delivered to production

  • Deploy tools for collecting, aggregating and alerting on server/application metrics; use data collected to inform decision-making on performance and scalability

  • Be part of an on-call rotation

 

Requirements:

 

  • Familiarity with a configuration management tool such as Ansible, Saltstack, Chef

  • Ability to build containers or machine images from scratch

  • Experience building automated testing infrastructure with a CI platform (Jenkins, Travis, CircleCI, TeamCity)

  • Higher level scripting language (Python strongly preferred)

  • Experience with a web application framework such as Django, Rails or Flask

  • Comfortable with AWS, specifically EC2

  • Strong Linux/Unix administration skills

 

Bonus points:

 

  • Optimizing Postgres

  • Container orchestration frameworks like Kubernetes or Docker Swarm

  • Hashicorp tools like Packer/Consul/Vault

  • Familiarity with using AMQP (or similar) for asynchronous tasks

  • Redis experience

 

Perks:

  • Be a core leading member of a small, elite product/engineering team

  • Be part of a start up that is gaining national recognition and actually making a difference

  • Fluid work hours, fun, fast-paced environment

  • Full benefits + salary + stock options

jobs.title: Lead Software Developer
jobs.content:
ThoughtWorks is hunting for a passionate Lead Software Developer who cares about software excellence. We work in a dynamic, collaborative, non-hierarchical environment where talent is valued over job title or years of experience.  We want you to develop your career outside the confines of a traditional career path. Being a consultancy, our teams work on a huge variety of projects. You could be helping shape the digital strategy of a retail giant, building a new mobile platform for a bank, creating an app to support an awareness campaign for Indigenous Australians or helping the science community locate meteorites that have fallen to earth.  All of this whilst building quadcopters or robotic arms in your spare time. As a Lead Developer at ThoughtWorks, here's what you can do:



  • Lead teams of software engineers

  • Be a mentor and role model to less experienced developers

  • Employ Agile development including task estimation, test automation, deployment automation and Continuous Integration to improve overall execution speed and product quality

  • Learn new technologies and help shape new offerings for our business

  • Think through hard problems, and work with a team to make them reality.

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, transparent, non-hierarchal, and ego-free culture where your talent is valued over a role title

  • Develop your career outside of the confinements of a traditional career path by focusing on what you're passionate about rather than a predetermined one-size-fits-all plan


Here's what you'll bring:



  • Development and delivery experience with Java, .NET, Ruby, Scala, Clojure or Mobile 

  • Passion for software engineering and craftsman-like coding prowess

  • Have helped lead development on large, custom-built object-oriented applications

  • Great OO skills, including strong design patterns knowledge

  • Experience working with Agile, Lean and/or Continuous Delivery approaches and best practices, such as Extreme Programming (XP)

  • Ability to work in a variety of client settings and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment

  • Knowledge of software best practices, like TDD, BDD and continuous integration


We're a big believer in diversity.  We build software for a wide variety of people so we think that a wide variety of people should build our software.  We abhor and reject discrimination and inequality, and promote diversity in all its forms. We proudly, passionately and actively strive to make both ThoughtWorks and our industry more reflective and inclusive of the society that we serve.  As long as you're an opinionated, disruptive thinker, we'd like to hear from you. To hear what our developers think about working at ThoughtWorks, take a look here. In addition to all this, we have some great extra benefits including a generous training budget and one of the best parental leave packages in Australia. If you want to get more information or apply, use the links and we will be in touch soon.

jobs.title: Senior Full Stack Developer required for Corporate Startup
jobs.content:
PwC’s Next is an interactive, real-time platform which delivers a personalised, integrated view of our client’s business in one place. It builds on the rapidly growing cloud ecosystem to deliver insight to our clients and our people. With access to information anywhere, anytime – and in combination with PwC expert insight – our Private Clients will be enabled to achieve their goals.

Our vision is to deliver innovative solutions to our clients, and we are looking for a Senior/Team Lead Developer to join our growing team on a permanent basis.

About the role

This is a discipline lead role, and you will be responsible for leading the back end development discipline, and growing the team in terms of both hard and soft capabilities.

The technical spec below is purposely broad, and not all of the listed experience is essential. We are looking for someone with very strong commercial experience as a full stack developer, who can mentor a team that works across many technologies and frameworks.

This role sits in PwC’s Next platform. We are one team with a flat structure, developing people with mentoring and coaching rather than a traditional management approach.

About you

We want energetic people who are willing to break through the corporate mold. We are looking for:

  1. 6-10 years’ relevant experience in back end or full stack development
  2. Minimum 4 years in a management or mentoring capacity developing teams in both hard and soft capabilities.
  3. Minimum 4 years’ experience working in agile project teams.
  4. Experience in the design and build of full stack applications, from presentation to persistence, using open-source frameworks.
  5. Strong experience in most if not all of the following technologies:
  • Ruby on Rails or Python with Django
  • Javascript
  • REST services with JSON
  • Securing REST services with OAuth or SAML.
  • Design and implementation of distributed applications using a Microservices design paradigm.
  • Effective use of data structures and algorithms
  • Knowledge of web protocols and the DOM
  • Front end and presentation technologies and frameworks such as AngularJS, React, JQuery, Bootstrap, HTML5.
  • API Management tools such as Apigee, Mashery and AWS API Gateway
  • SQL and NoSQL database technologies such as SQL Server, MySQL, Postgres, MongoDB.
  • Cloud technologies including AWS,Google Cloud Platform and Heroku
  • Extensive experience with Test-Driven Development, Continuous Integration and Agile Clean Code.
  • Working with requirements defined as User Stories and Acceptance criteria using tools such as JIRA or Trello.
  • The following (or equivalent) leading development and testing tools such as Rspec, Cucumber and Selenium
  • Version control with Git
  • Development in a unix/linux environment

The offer at PwC

As an organisation with an increasingly agile workforce, we're open to a variety of flexible working styles. These are unique opportunities offering a fun and supportive work environment and the chance to build a successful career. The significant breadth of our client base ensures that interesting and varied work is always available.

In return we offer you the opportunity to join a diverse and progressive team that will allow you to learn from inspirational people who are committed to ensuring that each and every interaction is an opportunity to learn, challenge, reframe and innovate.

Next step

We encourage you to contact us to discuss the opportunity. Ready for the opportunity of a lifetime? Apply now - I'm interested

jobs.title: PHP Engineer
jobs.content:
We're looking to hire a PHP developer with a good grip on OOP and MVC. That's about all you probably need to know if you want to apply, so we'll spend the rest of the text limit here telling you about the job.


Who we are: Sourcetoad is a dev studio in Tampa, FL. We work with some pretty huge clients, on really interesting projects. You will not be bored here, guaranteed.


We don't have any non-technical staff. Our project managers are programmers, our business developers are made to learn to code, so this is a nerdy place to work. 


What we do:


We build mobile apps, middleware, and web applications, and we do it well. On the backends, we like working with frameworks (mainly Laravel and Yii2), and would want you to have experience with one of those or something similar. We understand that as long as you have a fair grip on MVC, you'll be ok.


What you get: Competitive pay, health, dental, and vision insurance. We give our people top of the line equipment, cool toys, and a casual, supportive work environment... oh, and free beer. You will get time to work on a passion project, and have support of the company behind you, and a developer-centric management philosophy. We try and make it a fun place to work, and to give developers a place where they can learn, grown, and build awesome stuff.

40 hrs/week

jobs.title: Software Architect
jobs.content:

At Crossover, and youll earn the most competitive wages on the market, collaborate with the most skilled teams in your field, and work for the most elite companies in the world.

On a bigger scale, you will work together with other developers, engineers, and production groups to design and implement new applications, systems, and tools that are unparalleled in the market.

40 hours per week

Crossover is redefining the way people work. Brick and mortar offices are history. The future of our global workforce will be built from teams collaborating from every corner of the world. We have embarked on an expedition to find and engage with that talent.


Crossover has developed a unique method of finding, curating, and managing remote contractors. Our platform connects customers to the worlds best talent for both technical and non-technical jobs. But we dont just find the best, we also provide the tools, training, and relationship building support to ensure success for long term growth.

jobs.title: Frontend Lead Developer
jobs.content:

We’re looking for someone with deep JS experience as well as a strong CSC background who can help the team develop more structure around the HTML/CSS/JS code.  This person will also have ownership for custom Sales development, video display and distribution and our mobile web user experience. Any PHP experience would be quite helpful as well since we currently run an nginx/PHP/mySQL stack on AWS, S3 and Akamai. The expectation is that this person would focus on front-end development, but all of our leads are competent full-stack developers and ops savvy.   Furthermore everyone is empowered to explore and implement new ideas and improvements.

  •  Design and implement features that wow and excite our users

  •  Help Architect and improve our CSS/HTML/JS framework

  •  Learn about new technologies and share your findings with the team

  •  Take ownership of custom sales solutions, mobile user experience and video playback


Requirement:

  • JavaScript or a JavaScript framework

  • Deep understand of mobile web technologies and user interface

  • Some operations and full stack (SQL) experience

  • Have excellent written and verbal communication skills

  • Experience with Angular or another single page JS framework

  • Can create simple and clean solutions to complex problems

  • CSC Degree or equivalent


Nice to have:

  • MySQL database

  • AWS operations and deployment

jobs.title: Front End Developer
jobs.content:
Our home is our largest purchase and most valuable asset, but it is also the most difficult to buy and sell. Knock is a radical new way to buy or sell a home quickly without risk, stress and uncertainty. We guarantee homeowners that we can sell their home in 6 weeks or less or we buy it for market price. We guarantee buyers that our homes are rock solid with our 200-point home-inspection, certification and extended warranty. Started by founding team members of Trulia.com (acquired by Zillow for $2.5B), Knock is an online home selling platform that uses data science to price homes accurately, technology to sell them quickly and a dedicated team of professionals to guide you every step of the way.

Weâre looking for a Front End Web Developer to develop and own the consumer facing website and mobile web presence for Knock. We have launched our first version of the site (www.knock.re) and now need a front end expert to take over and ensure we are using the latest frameworks and practices to ensure Knock has a compelling experience. Weâre looking for someone with strong views who is passionate about creating great products and can drive themselves without lots of supervision.

This is a minimum one month full-time contract experience, but can turn into a continued project for the right person. We are a distributed company with employees in 4 different states, so location is not an issue as long as you have good experience with Slack and Trello.

Responsibilities

  • Building compelling experiences and features for the web client
  • Collaborating with design & product on new interfaces and interactions
  • Implementing product features, releases, and fixes
  • Maintaining build tools, tests, and overall healthy architecture
Requirements

  • Expert in HTML, CSS, JavaScript
  • Expert in Gulp & Webpack built tools. We use a combination of single page app, and static html rendered by the server for SEO purposes
  • Expert plain JS & React.js (we avoid jQuery whenever possible).
  • In depth knowledge of browser workings - history, pop/push-state, localStorage, etc
  • Immutable data structures
  • Experience with various app architectures - flux, redux, om like singleton, etc
  • Knowledge of Express.js (Node.js)
  • Knowledge of Basic HTTP and best web practices
  • Ability to move fluidly between client and Node.js server-side code (server app is minimal)
  • Knowledge of Git version control
Plusses, not required

  • Previous work building universal/isomorphic JavaScript applications
  • Experience with building backend systems - APIs and backend services. Specifically in Node.js or Go
  • Experience with databases & stores - couchDb, MariaDb, dynamoDb & redis
  • Experience with Service Oriented Architecture (SOA)

Knock is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

To apply: Apply online here http://knockaway.breezy.hr/p/301205a62288-front-end-web-developer

jobs.content:
This is an exceptional opportunity for an exceptional candidate.  We are seeking a passionate technologist to join us at an inflection point for both our firm and industry as technology is reshaping the investment world.  No experience in finance or investing is required, just a sense of intrigue by all the ways in which technology is disrupting finance, investing, and trading.  You will have a front row seat and take an active part in this transformation.


Technology has always been a central component of our business philosophy.  Technology initiatives are managed by the firm’s Risk and Quantitative Research group, the 3 members of which have deep technical expertise.  The collaborative dynamic of this group is designed to stimulate creativity and provide an environment for each member to maximize personal potential.  There will also be interaction with team members across all groups within the organization – investments, operations, investor relations, and marketing.  We are seeking candidates who have a strong desire and aptitude for learning about all aspects of our business in order to best understand how and where to apply technology most effectively.


Ideal candidates will have demonstrated proficiency in a variety of languages/platforms (preferably C# and/or Python) and have interest in learning new ones.  We believe in utilizing the right tool for the job, so a key part of this role will be ongoing evaluation of new technologies to incorporate into our stack and owning the implementation thereof.  Most of all, the right candidate will have an entrepreneurial attitude, long-term focus, and be excited to grow with the firm.

jobs.title: Developer Evangelist
jobs.content:
LOCATION:      Palo Alto, CA
TITLE:                Developer Evangelist
REPORTS TO:  Sr. Manager, Business Development

 

TigerText is seeking a passionate technologist to join and thrive on our new platform team as a Developer Evangelist.  The Developer Evangelist will service developer communities, making them aware of our exciting new platform - TigerConnect - which enables developers to integrate our secure messaging capabilities into their current applications and platforms via our SDK.  The Developer Evangelist will support developers from first conversation to technology evaluation, providing technical support and advice to ensure the success in launching new messaging capabilities. Some of the qualities necessary for this role include a deep empathy for developers earned from personal experience, passion for helping developers solve their most pressing problems, a rolodex full of software developers, proven technical expertise, and the ability to network at Meetups and other events.  

 

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Write technical and innovative content for blog posts and other social media channels to draw developer attention and awareness.
  • Attend developer conferences and meetups, representing the TigerConnect brand while networking like a pro.
  • Create and respond to open source discussions on communities including Twitter, Reddit, StackOverflow, etc.
  • Keep in contact and support developers via in-person meetings, contributing and responding to forums, social media, phone calls, emails, etc.
  • Work with our Marketing team to promote content through social and demand generation channels.
  • Develop technical guides, documents, and other materials for easy developer access.

 

REQUIREMENTS:

  • Minimum 2 years of direct Developer Evangelist experience with proficiency in at least one of the following: JS, .Net, Java, or Python.
  • Technical background as a Software Developer, including undergraduate CS or related field.
  • Understanding of REST APIs, basic cURLs, the role of SDKs and web/mobile technologies
  • Proven leadership and service in developer communities.
  • Strong technical writing skills demonstrated via blog posts and other written work.
  • Enjoys networking, with strong ability to build relationships and engage just about anyone in a crowd of developers.

 

THE COMPANY:

TigerText provides secure, real-time mobile messaging for the enterprise, empowering organizations to work more securely. More than 5,000 locations and four of the top five largest for-profit health systems in the nation, including Universal Health Services, rely on TigerText to meet compliance regulations and replace unsecured SMS text messaging that leaves protected or confidential information at risk. With over 4.5 million app downloads, TigerText has been featured in Forbes, The Wall Street Journal, Fast Company, Inc., Business Insider and many other leading business and tech publications. It is recognized as one of the 50 LA Tech Startups to Watch in 2015, a top Must-See LA Tech Office, and one of the 5 Sizzling Silicon Beach Startups to Watch by Entrepreneur. TigerText currently has over 125 employees with offices in Santa Monica, Palo Alto, and Tel Aviv, Israel.

 

WHY TIGERTEXT?

  • TigerText is the largest enterprise messenger in the US
  • Join our team in making major and much-needed changes in the way billion- dollar, life changing industries work
  • Prime office space in the three major tech ecosystems of the world - Santa Monica, Silicon Valley, and Tel Aviv - each complete with a loaded fridge and tons of other perks
  • An opportunity to work closely with proven executive team, board, and serial entrepreneurs (www.tigertext.com/about)
  • An environment that embraces a “work hard-play hard” culture and has fun
  • Team members love what they do and are willing to go the extra mile to help our clients and support the company’s rapid growth
  • This is a full time opportunity with competitive salary and medical benefits



 

TigerText is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

*Recruiting firms that submit resumes to TigerText without first entering into a written contract with TigerText will not be entitled to any compensation on candidates referred by that firm.

jobs.title: Platform Engineer - Remote Opportunity within the US

jobs.title: Director of Software Engineering, Global Network
jobs.content:
Twilio’s Platform Engineering group enables Twilio engineers to rapidly build, deliver, and run global products and services by providing them with compelling, continuously improving platform solutions.  We enable innovation and delight our fellow engineers and customers by providing a low friction, high quality, globally distributed platform at scale.  IaaS, PaaS, build/test/deployment automation, abstraction, access management, and operational insights are some of the solutions we provide across a secure, globally distributed cloud infrastructure.  In short, we are Twilio for Twilio engineers.


About the job:


The Director of Software Engineering, Global Network leads a highly specialized team responsible for designing and operating Twilio’s global network, both physical and software-defined. This leader must possess extensive knowledge of networking hardware, software, and services marketplaces including region-specific solutions.  This role requires comfort and accountability within a fast paced, flexible environment. This leader is a key player in the strategic planning processes for Twilio’s Platform Engineering organization, acting as one of the lead advisors to the Vice President of Engineering.


Areas of emphasis include software-defined networking, network configuration management/automation, team leadership and the execution of engineering activities associated with development, staging, and production environments while ensuring our networks are fully operational, scalable, supportable and sustainable.


The Director of Software Engineering, Global Network is responsible for developing and cultivating relationships with Twilio architects, tech leads, product and engineering managers to determine current and future enterprise network needs and service offerings, ensuring that the organization's needs are met on time and within budget.


Responsibilities:



  • Lead and guide a highly technical team of network and software engineers.

  • Develop and deploy network infrastructure plans, both public cloud and O&O.

  • Work with engineering leaders to assure investments in networks are appropriate, compatible with large-scale distributed systems best practices, and can scale and adapt as the business needs evolve.

  • Work with Platform Engineering leadership to develop short and long-term strategic departmental plans that support overall business and technology strategies.

  • Manage a staff of engineers and serve as the team liaison for the hiring process, work allocation, scheduling, training, professional development and performance evaluation.

  • Support projects end-to-end initiated by various clients (internal/external) and business units including new project and client launches, internal technology efforts, and across public cloud and O&O infrastructure.

  • Establish and meet service level agreements for performance, uptime and issue response.

jobs.title: Hiring Automated Test Engineers

jobs.title: Principal Security Product Engineer
jobs.content:
Principal Product Engineer


Position Overview


The Principal Product Engineer is responsible for continuously protecting our critical information assets, assuring compliance with corporate and regulatory policies & industry best practices, while simplifying, enhancing and enabling business initiatives. This role is responsible for providing technical guidance focused on information security architecture, including all security R&D, analysis and design for all corporate computing systems to prevent unauthorized access from both internal and external perspectives. This role is considered to be a SME in one or more of the information security disciplines supporting the design, implementation and management of the organizations information security architecture.


Key Responsibilities



  • Responsible for the selection, implementation and maintenance of all security tools across the enterprise

  • Partner with Technology teams to implement security solutions and work closely with these teams as alerts and issues are identified and escalated by the MSSP

  • Collaborate with Enterprise Security Architect to design and complete comprehensive security architecture by evaluating existing tools, looking for opportunities to consolidate and/or replace for better coverage and cost efficiencies

  • Serve as the subject matter expert in the tools: (ex. Trend Micro, Beyondtrust, Arcsight, Red Seal, Qualys, Carbon Black, Splunk, Tripwire) and work with the MSSP to ensure optimal efficiencies for their security monitoring

  • Serve as an escalation path for potential alerts from the MSSP

  • Execute and/or coordinate security/vulnerability testing of web-baed applications and associated infrastructure on a regular basis

  • Plan, coordinate and execute incident response activities related to detection, investigation, containment, eradication, recovery, and remediation/mitigation

  • Advise the engineering team about information security threats, technologies and related regulatory requirements

  • Track information security issues to closure by partnering with CISO, communicating solutions, and verifying remediation

jobs.title: Hiring Senior Software Engineers
jobs.content: SURGE is looking for smart, self-motivated, experienced, senior-level software engineers who enjoy the freedom of telecommuting and flexible schedules, to work as long-term, consistent (40 hrs/week) independent contractors (no W2) on a variety of software development projects.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer, Mobile Applications
jobs.content:
Driven by technology, Ally Financial Inc. is a leading automotive financial services company powered by a top direct banking franchise. We hire people who want their work make a difference. As a Senior Software Engineer you'll get to work on products that help millions of our customers, and collaborate with other passionate mobile developers to bring the most delightful and useful services and apps to life. You should be comfortable with Objective-C and have extensive knowledge of iOS development techniques and practices.


At Ally, engineers operate with purpose and speed, and help us guide the way in changing financial services one technological achievement after another to help existing and potential customers have the most delightful and useful services and apps.

jobs.title: Senior Backend Engineer
jobs.content:
Job Duties:



  • Work on Fundbox’s newest products from scratch; which will require coming up with prototypes quickly and brainstorming with stakeholders to evolve and drive our upcoming offerings.

  • Develop efficient, reusable, reliable, and scalable software

  • Optimize existing stack and architecture

  • Architect backend, high-concurrency, multithreaded, server-side systems


Requirements:



  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science preferred

  • 4+ years of relevant software engineering experience

  • In-depth experience in Python required

  • Experience with micro-services architecture

  • Experience with relational DBs and Linux environments

  • Experience in AWS

  • Ability to adapt to ongoing iterations and propose solutions quickly

  • Broad architecture and development skills

  • Experience building high-traffic systems

  • Hacker mentality and the ability to work in a fast paced, agile environment

  • Understanding of payment networks and/or payment processing is a plus


Fundbox (https://fundbox.com) is looking for a Backend Engineer to work in our newest group that will focus on brand new initiatives and product development, which is quickly becoming the biggest focus for the business. You’ll be building a product that doesn’t exist in the market. You’ll be dealing with new products to credit SMBs, our current product services sellers but we are now looking to incorporate buyers and expand the credit universe for SMBs.


We believe we’re set up for success because we have the best data in the industry and are extremely well funded. We’ve raised of $100 million from leading Silicon Valley entrepreneurs, finance veterans, and venture capitalists, including: Khosla Ventures, SV Angel, Blumberg Capital, former Citigroup CEO Vikram Pandit and Jeff Bezos.


This will be a full-time position located in our downtown San Francisco office which comes stocked with a full pantry and daily lunch. We are a small, close knit team and enjoy regular team outings and happy hours. If you have a work hard, play hard attitude and love whiskey and hummus you will fit right in; we drink regular whiskey shots to mark company and team milestones.  


We’re experiencing consistent triple-digit quarter-over-quarter growth and are looking for great people to join us in our mission and leave their mark on the company. For more information, visit https://fundbox.com.

jobs.title: Senior Video Streaming Engineer
jobs.content:
Job Requisition Number:49552



A lot of companies think they have high streaming traffic but not many can say they stream more than two million videos per day totaling petabytes of data each month. As the Engineering team behind Bloomberg's multimedia operations, we build the back end of the company's multimedia assets on the Web. What we build is used by Bloomberg's multiple TV and radio channels as well as our Video-on-Demand service. With more than 200,000 assets in our library, it's our job to make sure our end users can watch them wherever and whenever they want.

Our team is not just working on the code but also helping with the delivery of the content itself. To do that, we work with the video producers, the front end developers who are building the websites and the delivery networks. Together, we are industry leaders in quality, features and customization. As part of our team, you'll have the opportunity to learn new technologies and grow your skills. We're constantly learning from each other and always looking for new ways to produce. On our Video team, you will be working with the some of the smartest minds in the industry and helping us stay ahead of the curve.

We'll trust you to:

  • Engineer end-to-end multimedia infrastructure and delivery for web consumption
  • Make improvements to deliver reliable and flexible service for our internal and external users
  • Work independently and as part of a team
  • Own our multimedia generation and delivery


You need to have:

  • 3+ years of experience coding in JavaScript
  • Experience with streaming protocols (RTMP, HDS, HLS, DASH)
  • Knowledge of encoding protocols (AAC, H.264, H.265)
  • Experience with a CDN for video streaming
  • Experience working with AWS


We'd love to see:

  • Experience programming in Java
  • Familiarity with Spring Framework
  • Experience using Flash (ActionScript 3 and/or FMS)


Bloomberg is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and we welcome applications from all backgrounds regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, or any other classification protected by law.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer - Technology Infrastructure Platform
jobs.content:
Job Requisition Number:49540



Our Team:



Engineering is the cornerstone for on-demand software-defined infrastructure. We are the foundation for all aspects of Hybrid IT for Bloomberg. We are building a next generation Infrastructure-as-a-Service solution that encompasses multiple operating systems, private/public cloud providers and various relational databases.

Our mission is to build a unified self-service platform with flexible APIs to automate all aspects of Infrastructure management. This platform will offer a sophisticated multi-dimensional relationship of resources across our large-scale distributed network. We are adding key features such as continuous integration and deployments to our platform in order to rapidly deliver our services. We need your open source expertise to search our historical configuration snapshots in a responsive and intuitive manner to help us improve our infrastructure.

What's in it for you:



As a senior engineer on the Platform team, you will lead the technical design and development of all aspects of our next generation micro services. You will collaborate with engineers, scrum masters, product owners and program managers across Bloomberg to find innovative solutions for complex problems. You will work with various open source technologies to build creative web UX frameworks, scale DevOps efficiently and implement various RESTful Big Data interfaces for our platform. You will have the opportunity to evolve our core infrastructure and grow to new heights in your career.

You need to have:

  • 4+ years of experience in full stack software engineering
  • Proficiency in C++, Scala, JavaScript, Ruby or Python
  • Familiarity with various database technologies
  • Knowledge of open source DevOps automation tools
  • Exposure to Linux, Windows, Solaris or AIX operating systems
  • The ability to troubleshoot complex and ambiguous problems
  • Experience with high-impact, large-scale backend systems


We'd love to see expertise in:

  • Analysis of various algorithms
  • Development of automation platforms
  • Implementation of web UX frameworks
  • Design of next generation infrastructures
  • Decomposition of large technical problems
  • Operational excellence of hybrid SOA environments
  • Mentorship of technical and non-technical aspects of Engineering


We'll trust you to:

  • Do the right thing
  • Move fast and thoughtfully
  • Collaborate and lead by example
  • Learn from mistakes and be bold
  • Know the customer and work hard


Check out how we're giving back to the open source community:



https://github.com/bloomberg

Apply below and help us build a simple and reliable 'Infrastructure Platform.'

Bloomberg is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and we welcome applications from all backgrounds regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, or any other classification protected by law.

jobs.title: Hadoop Infrastructure Engineer - Foundational Services
jobs.content:
Job Requisition Number:49874



Many of the most prevalent applications in Bloomberg need real-time data analysis and business intelligence. Instead of using off-the-shelf applications, we use Hadoop and its ecosystem to provide a large-scale data platform with low-latency SLAs and large storage capabilities. This platform has revolutionized the way we manage and analyze data in a distributed environment.

We design software and hardware systems to support low-latency/high volume requests, security, fault tolerance/high availability and easy customization. Our Hadoop Infrastructure Platform is built to fully automate deployment and operations using Chef; developed and open sourced at https://github.com/bloomberg/chef-bach. With hundreds of applications depending on our platform, we are looking to grow our Hadoop Infrastructure team. That's where you come in.

We'll trust you to:

  • Evaluate Hadoop projects across the ecosystem and extend and deploy them to exacting standards (high availability, big data clusters, elastic load tolerance)
  • Develop automation, installation and monitoring of Hadoop ecosystem components in our open source infrastructure stack, specifically HBase, HDFS, Map/Reduce, Yarn, Oozie, Pig, Hive, Tez, Spark and Kafka
  • Dig deep into performance, scalability, capacity and reliability problems to resolve them
  • Create application patterns for integrating internal application teams and external vendors into our infrastructure
  • Troubleshoot and debug Hadoop ecosystem run-time issues
  • Provide developer and operations documentation to educate peer teams


You'll need to have most of the following:

  • Experience building out and scaling a Hadoop-based or UNIX-hosted database infrastructure for an enterprise
  • 2+ years of experience with Hadoop infrastructure or a strong and diverse background of distributed cluster management and operations experience
  • Experience writing software in a continuous build and automated deployment environment


We'd love to see:

  • 2+ years of DevOps or System Administration experience using Chef/Puppet/Ansible for system configuration, or quality shell scripting for systems management (error handling, idempotency, configuration management)
  • In-depth knowledge of low-level Linux, UNIX networking and C system calls for high performance computing
  • Experience with Java, Python or Ruby development (including testing with standard test frameworks and dependency management systems, knowledge of Java garbage collection fundamentals)
  • Experience or exposure to the open source community (a well-curated blog, upstream accepted contribution or community presence)


We want to work with others who are passionate about community-driven development both within the company and with the wider open source community. If this sounds like you, submit an application, and learn more about the work we do from Clay and Amit's interview at ChefConf2015: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LnMCFxXgDEw

Bloomberg is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and we welcome applications from all backgrounds regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, or any other classification protected by law.

jobs.title: Senior Cloud Platform Engineer
jobs.content:
Job Requisition Number:49658



Our team:



The Platform Engineering team builds infrastructure automation services that focus on configuration management and cloud orchestration. We play an active role in advising other infrastructure engineering teams on the best practices of modern application and infrastructure development.

What's in it for you:



We have a clear roadmap of where we want to be, but we need your expertise in building large-scale distributed systems to develop mission-critical system infrastructure. You will be part of a team that builds the foundation to support a multi-cloud environment. We develop best practices, tools and processes that have a direct impact on how thousands of engineers at Bloomberg interact with infrastructure.

We'll trust you to:

  • Take responsibility for the development and deployment of Bloomberg's platform services
  • Identify and automate manual tasks
  • Implement industry-wide best practices around public and private cloud infrastructure
  • Develop and maintain documentation, training and SLA for managed infrastructure and systems
  • Help replace legacy systems with modern, Internet-scale design patterns


You need to have:

  • 3+ years of experience working on highly available, fault-tolerant distributed systems
  • A strong understanding of operating systems and the nuances of Linux
  • Experience with datacenter network troubleshooting including IP fundamentals, DNS, load balancing, proxies and firewalls
  • Familiarity with configuration management systems such as Chef, Puppet or Ansible
  • Proficiency in at least one of the following languages: Python, Ruby, C/C++, Go or Java
  • A solid understanding of the modern software development lifecycle (SDLC) processes such as Continuous Integration and delivery


We'd love to see:

  • Expertise in analyzing and troubleshooting large-scale distributed systems
  • A deep understanding of web operations and cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, Google)
  • Knowledge of network and application performance analysis using standard UNIX tools
  • Experience with maintaining and managing a community around open source software


Does this sound like you?



Great, apply today! We want to work with others who are passionate about community-driven development both within the company and with the wider open source community.
Learn more about the work we do using the links below:

https://github.com/bloomberg/collectd-cookbook
https://github.com/bloomberg/kafka-cookbook
https://github.com/bloomberg/confd-cookbook
https://github.com/bloomberg/kubernetes-cluster-cookbook
https://github.com/bloomberg/zookeeper-cookbook

jobs.title: VP of Engineering
jobs.content:
You have the unique opportunity to build a technology team from the ground-up for one of the fastest growing e-commerce companies in the food delivery space.


SnackNation is a different kind of B2B SaaS – Snacking as a Service that is.  The Company currently delivers a curated, healthy snacking experience to more than 2,000 of the most innovative businesses across America, all on a membership/recurring basis. As the “Snacking Marketplace for Millennials,” SnackNation is connecting the top, emerging CPG brands with previously inaccessible consumers, and is democratizing the CPG landscape.


We are looking for a hands-on VP of Engineering / CTO with experience leading teams and interfacing with stakeholders to solve the complex operational challenges that SnackNation faces today.


Reporting to the COO, you will have the opportunity to build your own team to expand upon our platform to solve the technology challenges of tomorrow: providing insights to brands, product recommendations to customers, and building a direct-to-consumer relationship through eCommerce & mobile.


Skills:



  • You love to code. And you really love to code in Ruby.

  • On every system you work on, you understand the architecture as a whole, and you’re always striving to improve it.

  • You have a firm grasp of the SDLC and Agile methodologies. You can capture functional requirements in meetings with stakeholders and convert them into clear technical specifications, specifically with UML.

  • You know how to plan resources and set a delivery schedule for your team to meet stakeholder requirements and deliver software on time.


Experience:



  • Significant experience with Ruby on Rails in a professional environment.

  • At least 6 years of overall experience writing software in a professional environment, with significant exposure to Ruby on Rails and Object-Relational Mapping (ORM) tools.

  • Experience overseeing other engineers in a formal management role.

  • Hands-on experience in operations in a Linux environment at some point in your career, demonstrating your ability to deploy and debug a running system (outside deploying via Capistrano or Heroku).

  • Experience with AWS, Azure, OpenStack, or other cloud platform.

jobs.title: Infrastructure Production Developer
jobs.content:
Job Requisition Number:49896



The Infrastructure Production group in Engineering delivers a wide range of technologies to support Bloomberg's development environment. We build out common services that every engineering team can use to monitor, visualize and diagnose their applications and infrastructure. We implement modern technology ideology in the organization and assist all teams with implementation, automation and design.

We are a new team at Bloomberg and one of the most widely used across the entire company. On our team, you'll be part of a large cultural shift within the company. If you like working with large scale systems and grappling with billions of data points a day, ask us where to sign up.

We'll trust you to:

    • Design, architect, automate and deliver large scale production-ready services
    • Build internal tools to monitor, visualize and diagnose all aspects of Bloomberg applications and hardware
    • Work closely with our product and platform teams on their architecture, design and scaling


challenges
  • Help teams replace legacy software and design patterns with modern technologies
  • Develop and maintain documentation, training and SLAs for managed infrastructure




You need to have:

  • 2+ years of experience building similar systems
  • Experience with large scale data processing and automating and implementing large-scale fault-tolerant distributed systems
  • Knowledge of physical hardware and provisioning processes

  • Mesos
