The primary focus will be on choosing optimal solutions to use for these purposes and implementing, You will also be responsible for integrating them with the architecture used across the company.

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
With our steadily growing R&D department the time is now to form a team of DevOps engineers that focus on improving our internal build infrastructure. We have monthly releases and need to optimize the processes for releasing new features.


The tasks are non-customer facing but to support and improve our R&D department. The goal is to make the work of our 70 R&D engineers as frictionless as possible.


Why we like it here:



  • We’re building something new, making stuff up as we go along.

  • All scrum teams have the guiding principle: You build it, you run it.

  • We’re stubborn and like to get to the bottom of things; clear answers are more important than deadlines.

  • We dabble in all sorts of technologies when it takes our fancy. We use Gitlab to manage our repositories. Next to that we use Jenkins to build our product and to run our CI.

jobs.title: Full Stack Rails Developer
jobs.content:
Are you the Full Stack Developer we're looking for?
Are you passionate about creating magical user experiences? Bring that love, and your skillful way of solving usersâ needs to us. We're looking for an experienced full-stack engineer equally comfortable working on greenfield features and refactoring legacy code.

If you love setting others up for success as much as you love stepping up to achieve results, you're probably the type of person we want on our team. We are looking for engineers who can raise the skill level of their teammates and love to give back through tech talks, lightning talks, etc. We would also love it if you were an Open Source contributor.

You will be working closely with our customer success team.  If you love seeing real customers quickly benefiting your work, then this is the role for you.

Please note preference is given to people working within +/- 3hours from our Singapore timezone.

About Us:
Dekeo is a new branded site being spun out of a fast-growing, profitable company. Dekeo is creating a global ecommerce marketplace for promotional products (putting company or team logos on t-shirts, water bottles, and stickers).  While the company is still very much at a growth stage â there's a huge number of technical challenges still to solved, exciting ideas to pursue, and value to be built

How we'd like you to help us:
  • Write clean, maintainable and efficient code
  • Design robust, scalable and secure features
  • Contribute in all phases of the development lifecycle

What we'd like to see in the candidate:
  • BS in Computer Science combined with 1+ years of experience working on the web applications at scale
  • Expert understanding of front-end technologies HTML/CSS/Javascript/AJAX
  • Good understanding of server-side templating languages (such as Liquid, Slim, etc depending on your technology stack)

  • Experience with modern JavaScript libraries and tooling
  • Proficient understanding of code versioning tools (e.g. Git)
  • Possible experience working with large, custom search systems using Solr or ElasticSearch
  • Experience with agile story tool such as Pivotal Tracker

Compensation
  • Competitive Compensation  

To apply: Send your resume together with a cover letter mentioning "We Work Remotely" to: 13F804E05E@jobs.workablemail.com

jobs.title: Creative Director, Experience Design
jobs.content:
Comcast brings together the best in media and technology. We drive innovation to create the world's best entertainment and online experiences. As a Fortune 50 leader, we set the pace in a variety of innovative and fascinating businesses and create career opportunities across a wide range of locations and disciplines. We are at the forefront of change and move at an amazing pace, thanks to our remarkable people, who bring cutting-edge products and services to life for millions of customers every day. If you share in our passion for teamwork, our vision to revolutionize industries and our goal to lead the future in media and technology, we want you to fast-forward your career at Comcast.






Position: Creative Director Experience Design

Location: Philadelphia





The Team:

The Comcast Experience Design (XD) team is transforming how Comcast customers access and enjoy entertainment, communications and home management services across all mediums-online, mobile and TV. By assembling the country's top designers and thinkers, the XD team is rapidly becoming the premier environment for building and launching one-of-a-kind experiences that make everyday life easier and more entertaining for millions of customers.





The Role:

This is an exciting opportunity to revolutionize customer service for the largest multi-media and entertainment company in the U.S. We're looking for a Creative Director to join our team to lead ideation, strategy and concept across various customer experience initiatives. The Creative Director will focus attention on products aimed at helping Comcast achieve our goal of providing the best experience to our customers at every touch-point.





- Provide creative thought leadership and drive visual design by combining industry best practices with your own expertise and insights about human behavior.

- Support the creation and communication of overarching UX strategies.

- Lead UX team in ideation and concept explorations, as well as partner Engineering, Product Management and other internal business units to define the strategy and experience of consumer facing products.

- Ensure consistent, unified user experience across all platforms by basing decisions on industry standard methodologies, user research and adhering to visual language and style guide.

- Engage UX Research team by participating in or consulting throughout research process.

- Ensure design goals align with overarching company goals.

- Manages and leads a team of Designers, Front End Developers, Information Architects, Content Developers, Usability Analysts, and augmented consultants.

- Manages outside vendors, contractors, and related budgets.

- Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.

- Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) as necessary.

- Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.





Qualifications:



- Design professional with 10 or more years of relevant work experience

- Demonstrated ability to design inspiring new solutions to challenges, often in collaboration with end users, frontline workers and stakeholders.

- Expertly skilled in compiling the results of customer research into insights, service opportunities and design principles.

- Expert ability to deliver solid work in a deadline-driven environment.

- Superior communication and leadership skills.

- Outstanding facilitation, brainstorming and collaboration skills.

- A strong portfolio showcasing UX leadership in developing interactive online and mobile products for large consumer base required; broadcast, print, identity, packaging are a plus.








Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer

jobs.title: Director/Technical Platform Owner, VIPER
jobs.content:
Comcast's Technology & Product organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards.





Do you want to be part of the revolution that is reshaping television? Can you set the agenda for how leading-edge technology is applied and work with top-flight engineers to deliver innovation in digital media and entertainment services? Are you passionate, motivated, and energized by big challenges?





As a Technical Platform Owner (TPO) on the Alternate Content team at VIPER, you will develop and manage the roadmap that translates business needs into platform releases for a suite of components enabling Dynamic Ad Insertion (DAI), addressable advertising, and blackout in IP Linear, VOD, and Time-Shifted video services. The VIPER team is a new, small and nimble team of world-class experts who are innovating in end-to-end video delivery. Every day, we do things no one has done before, and we thrive on big challenges, results, quality, and agility.





Who does the Technical Platform Owner work with?



VIPER TPOs straddle the boundary between business and technology. We take business requirements from service owners for VIPER's Linear, VOD, and Time-Shifted video services and work with architects and engineering leads to define solutions and align them with our platform roadmap and priorities. Then we work with development leads and delivery owners to drive those solutions through engineering backlogs, sprint plans, QA testing, and release plans, seeing them through into production in collaboration with service delivery and operations engineers. We have overall responsibility for the roadmap, prioritization, and work queue for our platforms, and cradle-to-grave ownership of the components our platform teams produce. TPOs are a unique blend of business savvy and technical affinity, with strong executive, analytical, and organizational skills for planning, prioritizing, and communicating, and exceptional interpersonal skills for leading, influencing, and collaborating, all paired with the ability to comprehend complex technical problems and solutions.





What are some interesting problems you'll be working on?



In your role, you will develop, maintain, and publish a roadmap for the alternate content platform. You will balance how requests for new features and functionality, technical debt, and innovation are mapped into that roadmap. Collaborate with the platform team to translate functional scope to technical solutions for all roadmap items. Write technical requirements (stories) for those solutions. You will have solid knowledge and understanding of all initiatives within your platform whether in analysis, in flight, or in production. You will collaborate with other TPOs for platforms both upstream and downstream of yours to identify dependencies and assess impact of their initiatives on your roadmap, as well as impact of your roadmap on theirs.





Where can you make an impact?



You'll be working with the best and brightest minds in video delivery to create and deploy video services that will reset the bar for what people expect of television in accessibility, ease-of-use, feature richness, and quality. Success in this role is characterized by increased predictability of platform releases in terms of features, functionality, and timing, and increased cadence of releases / compressed release cycle times as a result of better planning, alignment, and execution against the roadmap.





Responsibilities:




  • Align and prioritize the alternate content platform roadmap with inputs from across the VIPER service roadmaps, in collaboration with service owners and service architects

  • Align functional scope for roadmap items with required technical solutions in collaboration with technical platform team

  • Own technical solutions across the alternate content technical platform group, to include:

    • Project scope

    • Production support

    • Technical debt, innovation, experimentation, and lessons learned activity



  • Accountable for supporting technical definition of work across the alternate content platform group, to include technical requirement definition and awareness of dependencies across development, testing, and deployment, and dependencies across other VIPER technical platform groups

  • Work with development leads/backlog managers as needed to prioritize and make decisions within specific component backlogs





Skills & Requirements




  • Experience:

    • 9+ years' experience in software product development, including:

      • Minimum 2 years' as a product owner in an Agile development setting

      • Minimum 2 years' as a software engineer or solution architect





  • Education:

    • BS in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field

    • MBA desirable



  • Skills:

    • Exceptional organizational skills ability to breakdown and track complex projects, to integrate input from multiple sources, and to identify and track dependencies across projects

    • Exceptional executive skills ability to set clear objectives and focus and motivate teams to drive execution, to prioritize issues and to discern level of urgency and triage appropriately when necessary

    • Exceptional communication skills ability to create clear and concise messages that are audience-appropriate in level of detail and tone, ability to create and maintain process artifacts as required

    • Exceptional collaboration skills ability to build and maintain relationships, to influence without direct authority

    • High level of accountability takes ownership of problems and sees them through to resolution

    • High energy thrives in fast-paced, high-rate-of-change setting



  • Tools and Technologies:

    • Subject matter expertise in advanced advertising and/or blackout technology

    • Detailed understanding of relevant industry standards including SCTE-130, SCTE-35, SCTE-224

    • Proficiency in Jira, Microsoft Office (especially PowerPoint)

    • Familiarity with software development comprehension of programming language paradigms, data structures, version control, networks and systems.

    • Relevant technologies include:

      • Go (golang)

      • Python 3

      • C

      • C++

      • Java 8

      • Linux (CentOS)

      • Git

      • Apache httpd and the Apache Portable Runtime

      • Redis

      • MongoDB

      • OpenStack









About Comcast VIPER (Video IP Engineering & Research)



VIPER(Video IP Engineering & Research), is a startup division within Comcast's Technology and Product Division and spun out from IP Video and online projects originated within Comcast Interactive Media is based in downtown Denver, CO. We are a cloud-based, IP video infrastructure that's been built to deliver a broad mix of on-demand video, live TV streams and an assortment of other digital media to an array of connected devices in the home.

jobs.title: Principal Engineer
jobs.content:
Comcast's Technology & Product organization works at the intersection of media and technology. Our innovative teams are continually developing and delivering products that transform the customer experience. From creating apps like TVGo to new features such as the Talking Guide on the X1 platform, we work every day to make a positive impact through innovation in the pursuit of building amazing products that are enjoyable, easy to use and accessible across all platforms. The team also develops and supports our evolving network architecture, including next-generation consumer systems and technologies, infrastructure and engineering, network integration and management tools, and technical standards.






Summary



Responsible for defining the advanced technology roadmap for the company as a key contributor to Comcast Innovation Labs.Candidate will take part in identifying emerging technologies and trends in consumer usage, research aspects of the field, evaluate and communicate impact to current and potential businesses. The position will require invention, synthesis and analysis followed by evangelism and developing the understanding of others. The research will be conducted through study,and practice. Frequent interaction with outside companies, educational and research entities. Fields of investigation may involve media and entertainment as well as communications technologies, the Internet of things and neural networks. The results of the candidate's work will be first proofs of new fields of product and business, patents and publications that are pivotal in scientific advances.





Core Responsibilities




  • Research, identify and assess emerging areas of science, technology and consumer behavior

  • Analyze potential impact of these areas on current and future Comcast business. Develop prototypes and studies to support the analysis.

  • Communicate opportunities and threats through publications, open source projects, gatherings such as presentations, meetups, and collaboration tools.

  • Make first prototypes of hardware and software elements to prove, demonstrate and evaluate areas of investigation.

  • Tests and evaluates solutions presented to the Company by various internal and external partners and vendors. Completes case studies, testing and reporting.

  • Researches, writes and edits documentation and technical requirements, including evaluation plans, confluence pages, white papers, presentations, test results, technical manuals, formal recommendations and reports. Creates patents, API#s and other intel

  • Represents the work team and organization as the prime technical contact for an area of research.

  • Travel as necessary to meet with technology and research sources, attend relevant conferences and to deliver results at corporate locations and influential speaking events.

  • Flex to work hours and locations as necessary to achieve objectives. Occasional night and weekend work may be necessary. Primary work location is Philadelphia, PA.




  • Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.



Education Level




  • Bachelor's Degree Required, Masters or PhD Desired



Field of Study




  • Engineering, Applied Science, Management of Technology, MBA



Years of Experience





  • Generally requires 7+ years related experience.

jobs.title: Senior Software Developer
jobs.content:
ClarityAd’s software protects from bad ads. We run ads in our custom browser environment in the cloud to gather hundreds of data points. We assess security and compliance for billions of ad impressions daily. Our back-end stores this wealth of data in a way that's usable and efficient, allowing publishers and ad platforms to protect their audience in real time.


You will work with our VP of engineering and back-end engineering team and you will be directly involved in:



  • Setting up a robust and highly scalable backend

  • Optimizing database queries and caching as required

  • Optimizing web server configurations

  • And most importantly, participating in the day-to-day improvement and extension of our product functionalities, for all things backend.


We would love to hire someone with ad tech experience, but we’re ready to train newbies and give you a deep understanding of the ad serving stack and Real Time Bidding (RTB). This environment has grown to such a level of complexity and automation that consuming online media has become an exercise of frustration: Latency, invasive ads, privacy issues, malware/malvertising that exposes users to trojans, ransomware, botnets… The rational option for the audience is to rely on ad blockers. Our unique product suite makes it possible for publishers and ad platforms to protect their audience in real time. We have the secret sauce to disrupt this market for good, annihilate the bad actors and restore confidence in publishers.


We are passionate about solving these issues and we want to grow our team with people who share our vision and ambition.


We use: PHP, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Redis + Lua, Node.js, C++ (browser sandbox). Our infrastructure includes: AWS EC2 (thousands of VMs) / Route53 / ELB / S3 / Bare metal / lots of exotic hardware in exotic places with exotic vendors all playing nice with Puppet.


We value diversity and we’re not looking to hire candidates whose experience is a perfect match to our tech stack. We expect you to bring your own background and experience to the problems we are solving.


Bragging rights:



  • We routinely are the 1st to report on-going live malvertising attacks to ad platforms, including to Google

  • We increased our volumes by 20x last year and keep getting stronger

  • We have have received mentions in Google’s Security Hall of Fame

  • We’re still an “engineer only” startup, even as our monthly revenue passed into six figures less than 3 years in


The position is open to remote candidates in eastern time zone from USA or Canada. Half of our team is working remotely and we meet every 6 weeks in person.


Benefits



  • Competitive salary

  • Health care coverage

  • Health savings account

  • Dependent Care FSA

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
The internet is experiencing a transformation – ad blindness and blocking are forcing media companies and advertisers to rethink the way they connect with consumers. This evolution is changing the way we consume content and how we interact with brands. Nativo is enabling this shift by developing the media and advertising platform of the future enabling brands and media companies to engage consumer with content rather than interrupt them with ads.


For brands, Nativo provides the ultimate technology for distributing content into native placements and measuring its impact across premium publications. For media companies, Nativo is the platform of choice for automating the workflows around native ad serving. From the hands and minds of an amazing team, Nativo has engineered a platform that is recognized as the best in market. Nativo is respected, well-funded, and growing rapidly. Nativo is playing a vital role forging the path of media and advertising’s evolution.


We believe in being smart, innovative, pragmatic, polished, and efficient and are looking for remarkable people that identify and fit with those values. The DevOps Engineer will be an integral part of the effort to develop our next generation platform. We want team members who have a passion for leveraging technology and software to solve problems and maximize productivity and efficiency.


WHAT YOU WILL DO



  • Work as part of a small DevOps team to build and manage a resilient and secure infrastructure for application platform.

  • Collaborate with development team to fulfill each other's requirement, create scripts, modify source codes if needed or workarounds (requires solid knowledge of programming)

  • Scale infrastructure to meet rapidly increasing demand

  • Improve automated deployments, monitoring, management and incident response

  • Monitor site stability and performance and troubleshoot site issues

  • Conduct stress, high availability and proof of concept tests

  • Get up to speed and understand our technology stack

jobs.title: IT Project Manager
jobs.content:
This is a virtual, work-from-home position. Must be a U.S. resident


We are growing! Join a department of developers, business analysts, QA, and support specialists who support an entrepreneurial company of over 80 people with industry-leading web applications in areas of subscription-based continuing education, simulation and training, eCommerce, content management, and more. (www.audiologyonline.com | www.speechpathology.com | www.physicaltherapy.com | www.occupationaltherapy.com | www.simucase.com | www.audiologydesign.com )


ABOUT THE COMPANY


We build start-ups and nurture them into mature, successful companies. We are fast-paced, structured, and laugh a lot. We all work from home offices in various locations across the country. We are dynamic, engaged, highly motivated and highly skilled. We are passionate about our work and our professions and we’re looking for another person to join our cause.


ABOUT THE TEAM


Though we are virtual, we communicate a lot and have a tight-knit group. Our meetings are filled with sarcasm, laughter, and movie quotes. We meet face-to-face several times a year but work primarily on Skype. Everyone works hard, we contribute directly to the success of the company, and we have an excellent work/life balance.


ABOUT THE POSITION


We are seeking an experienced and engaged IT PROJECT MANAGER who is motivated, creative, and fun to extend our current project management capabilities.



  • Full-Time, 8a-5p in your time zone

  • Work from your home office

  • Company-provided MacBook Pro, Internet stipend, etc

  • Must be located in the United States and be legally eligible to work for us without visa sponsorship.

  • Travel is required for an annual company meeting, and may be required once or twice per year for team or project meetings.


 Responsibilities



  • Manage major and minor web application projects from kickoff through development and QA.

  • Produce, organize, and update necessary project plans, documentation, and project asset documents as required by each project.

  • Develop and execute communication plans on a project-by-project basis.

  • Organize and oversee bug and feature request tracking.

  • Work directly with the IT Business Analyst to assist stakeholders in developing project specifications and keeping functional site documentation up to date.

  • Guide projects through effective change control processes.

  • Write and archive final project reports that summarize project successes, challenges, regression analysis and lessons learned.

  • Along with the PMO, help to refine our internal project management process and best practices, meeting the needs of both the start-up and mature business.


TO APPLY


Submit a cover letter with your resume that includes 1) a project you managed that you are particularly proud of and why; 2) a link to a favorite movie clip on YouTube; and 3) your salary requirements. Submissions without this information will not be considered.

With a gesture, Nixie takes off, captures the moment, and comes right back. Here at Nixie, we are looking for individuals who have a passion for difficult challenges and solving problems.


You are a Senior Software Engineer / Team Lead who will significantly impact Nixie's development. You will collaborate with our electrical, mechanical, guidance, and algorithm engineers. You have the scope and understanding to architect the complete UAV software stack, and you have the experience to bring up boards and develop drivers on a variety of SOCs and embedded platforms.

jobs.title: Linux DevOps Engineer
jobs.company: San Francisco Museum of Modern Art
jobs.content: As directed by the Chief Technology Officer, the Linux DevOps Engineer will be responsible for implementing, managing and supporting a growing Linux, OSX, and iOS environments. The Linux DevOps Engineer will also work closely with the museum's Facilities and Content Strategy departments to support Linux-based AV and digital signage systems. The Linux DevOps Engineer will be responsible for the installation, and maintenance of software development and testing environments and be willing to take on a DevOps role when needed. Familiarity with GitHub, Puppet, Chef, Elk, JIRA/ Confluence, and Continuous Integration for AWS will help to get the job done. The Linux DevOps Engineer should also be familiar with Windows; SFMOMA's network is predominantly Windows, but the need for Linux is growing.

jobs.title: Tools & Infrastructure Engineer
jobs.content:
Activision Central Technology (CT) is a group of engineers that collaborate with Activision studios to provide expertise in tools, graphics, systems engineering, and optimization.


The CT tools engineers at times support all parts of the asset creation, build pipelines, and automation across the studios. For example, we provide a centralized server farm, with bespoke systems for continuous integration and testing. We offer expertise in devops-style automation.


Our work also takes us into studio-specific tools, where we help with robustness, optimization, and occasional feature development.


We thrive on finding root causes of instability and slowdowns. We obsess about details and quality.


Today we are looking for engineers at all levels of seniority to help drive these efforts forward. If you are passionate about helping others, excited about unlocking team productivity, and overall love to solve problems, we want to talk with you!



Responsibilities:



  • Assist in designing, developing and maintaining tools, testing frameworks, and build services and infrastructure

  • Maintain a solid understanding of the production pipelines at our studios

  • Write clear, maintainable, well-commented, and highly functional code

  • Profile, analyze, and optimize tools, processes, and pipelines

  • Work on run time engine tasks as needed to support specific project requirements

jobs.title: Senior C# Engineer
jobs.content:
Sr. Software Engineer


(Advertising Technology / Marketing Automation)


We are looking for Sr. Software Engineer an engineer who will revolutionize, lead and own our efforts in delivering new product features and functionality. This is an opportunity to join a fast-growing pre-IPO company with a significant user base and to be a major influencer and team-player in driving a game-changing product with a modern architecture and dev process. We utilize a micro service architecture and docker encapsulation. 


Responsibilities:



  • Shape our web technology innovation as we continuously improve our platform

  • Write elegant and maintainable code in a team environment

  • Select or develop specialized tools as needed.

  • Collaborate proactively as part of a cross-functional team with engineers, product managers to ensure coverage, optimize efficiency and drive improvement.

  • Integrate with continuous integration and deployment stack.

  • Develop dashboards with metrics, trends and KPIs to give real time insight to all aspects of quality.

  • Identify how to capture new classes of defect proactively before they emerge or reactively after.

  • Influence or participate in code reviews and setting of coding standards.

jobs.title: Sr. UI / JavaScript Engineer @ leading data security startup
jobs.content:
• Have an immediate impact building next generation UI features and a world-class dashboard that will drive simple, seamless user experiences

  • Work with cutting edge UI libraries and design new ways for people to interact with security software

  • Give people around the world new tools to help them collaborate confidently on mobile devices

  • Be an early, influential part of the team changing the face of security and data protection for the enterprise

jobs.title: Full Stack Rails Engineer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: New York, NY
URL: http://www.nakedapartments.com

Naked Apartments, a Zillow Group Company, is looking for an exceptional Full Stack Engineer to conceive, plan and build extraordinary features and products.

We're committed to providing fulfilling, challenging and interesting positions, while maintaining a healthy work/life balance. And we're committed to making a difference for tens of thousands of renters, everyday. Sound like fun? Read on...

When you work for Naked Apartments, you'll work in one of our satellite offices – your living room. We enjoy the benefits of working from home, and plan to continue doing so even as the team grows. Say goodbye to traffic, to subway crowds, to office distractions and to endless meetings, but be prepared for aggressive goals, challenging deadlines and the satisfaction of quickly deploying beautiful products to customers.

Responsibilities:
  • Plan, build and launch features and products
  • Software design, architecture and research
  • Collaborate to craft elegant and engaging user experiences
  • Challenge, mentor and learn from your peers
  • Continually broaden and refine your own skills

What we're looking for:
  • Expert knowledge of Rails and Ruby
  • Experience with authoring and maintaining gems
  • Solid understanding of object oriented programming, CS fundamentals, relational databases, and scaling
  • Advanced testing ability
  • Strong knowledge of version control systems (Git preferred)
  • Not afraid to code on the front-end (HTML, SASS, jQuery, and ES6)
  • Stand up for what you believe in and ability to argue your opinions succinctly
  • Direct participation in the decision making process
  • A passion for owning a project from conception to deployment into production

Bonus points for experience with:
  • Elastic Search
  • MongoDB
  • Chef
  • Amazon Web Services
  • Large datasets

Personal traits:
  • Highly productive, passionate, self motivated, and a fast learner
  • A scrappy, entrepreneurial attitude
  • Clear and candid communication
  • You're smart, humble and don't take yourself too seriously
  • Equal willingness to both learn and to teach

About Naked Apartments, Inc.

When you join the Naked Apartments team, you become part of a smart, entrepreneurial group that loves thinking big, moving fast, while working together and having fun. We pride ourselves on our scrappy, roll-up-your-sleeves attitude, and our belief in full product ownership.

Our team is provided with incredible resources to further our careers, plus competitive compensation and exceptional benefits. Our parent company, Zillow Group (Nasdaq: Z), houses a portfolio of the largest and most vibrant real estate and home-related brands on the web and mobile. The Zillow Group opportunity is unlimited.

Join the team and apply today. Help us solve big problems through innovation and incredible technology.

Benefits:
  • Competitive compensation
  • 100% covered insurance premiums (medical, prescription, vision, dental and life)
  • 80% covered dependents’ premiums (medical, prescription, vision, dental and life)
  • Stock options
  • 401k match
  • FSAs
  • Generous vacation days
  • Gym membership credits, plus free Fitbits
  • Citi Bike memberships
  • 16 weeks fully paid maternity leave and 8 weeks fully paid parental leave.
  • Help with emergency backup childcare
  • $5,000 adoption fee assistance

To apply: https://app.jobvite.com/j?cj=o31e3fw5&s=weworkremotely

jobs.title: Cross Platform Engineer
jobs.content:
Bungie is seeking a relentless code warrior, devoted to the pursuit of programming excellence and furthering our ongoing quest for world domination. When you play games do you find yourself wondering how the code functions under the hood? Why that load took so long? Are you obsessed with evaluating your programs for efficiency and performance? Do you dream in x64 assembly and write poems in VMX. Are you the person that others come to when they can’t debug their code?


Bring your thirst for knowledge, your HW expertise and your ability to draw blood from stones and fuse it with our talented team; together we shall forge a dread Engine that will quake lands (of many architectures) underfoot.


As a Platform Engineer at Bungie, you will participate in the design of future generations of our engine technology. You will learn our engine’s capabilities and then help us expand them by building a structure and framework that enables new heights of flexibility and performance. Most importantly you will work with an exciting and energetic team devoted to creating the best and most technically impressive games in the world.

jobs.title: Full Stack Rails Engineer
jobs.content:

We're committed to providing fulfilling, challenging and interesting positions, while maintaining a healthy work/life balance. And we're committed to making a difference for tens of thousands of renters, everyday. Sound like fun? Read on...

  • Collaborate to craft elegant and engaging user experiences

  • Challenge, mentor and learn from your peers

  • Continually broaden and refine your own skills

jobs.title: Engineering Lead
jobs.content: Bungie is recruiting a relentless code warrior, devoted to the pursuit of excellence in programming and furthering our ongoing quest for world domination. Do you enjoy solving cross-team, collaborative problems?  Have you successfully applied these skills to ship a AAA game?  Bring your drive and fuse it with our talented team; together we shall quake lands underfoot. As an Engineering Lead at Bungie, you will work closely with team leads and production to plan and execute on our vision of creating the best and most technically impressive games in the world.

jobs.title: SDET Lead
jobs.content:
Do you enjoy trying to figure out how to break the games you’re playing? Are you obsessed with finding clever ways to combine items and abilities just to see what will happen? Do you like unraveling how things work, sharing that knowledge with others, and then putting it back together - better, faster, stronger? If so, read on, brave soul.


Bungie is looking for a Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) Lead who wants to help us push the boundaries of testing software in games. We need someone who shares our passion for automation and tools that: save time, improve workflows, and allow a large test team to be selective in the areas they focus their time. 


An SDET Lead will learn Destiny inside and out; you will gather the deep knowledge of our systems' internals and apply to solve hard test problems. You'll be expected to understand how code and content changes may result in bugs that impact functionality and the player experience. You'll leverage your desire to be the best and push our testing methodologies to new heights.


As an SDET Lead you will coach, grow and develop SDETs that are developing automation to test and improve test workflow for Destiny gameplay, activities and sandbox. You will leverage your ability to mentor and motivate SDETs nearly every day.


If you believe you have the technical and leadership capability to deliver outstanding code, drive quality and help SDETs achieve their potential, we'd love to talk to you.


Responsibilities



  • Lead and manage a team of SDETs delivering test automation and workflow improvement in Destiny gameplay, activities and sandbox

  • Coach, mentor and grow SDETs. Help SDETs grow their career

  • Work with internal “customers” to understand their needs and help craft user stories. Participate in backlog grooming and prioritization of work

  • Feature area risk analysis and mitigation

    • Converse with engineering peers and test allies to generate effective test collateral

    • Set team standards for efficient yet thorough targeted testing

    • Identify and guide authoring of high return on investment automated tests



  • Develop and update tools and processes that allow our test teams to be more efficient

    • Understand multiple technology stacks and engineering workflows

    • Identify workflow pain points/inefficiencies and propose process and engineering solutions

    • Sets team standards for code reviews, authoring and code maintenance according to our development requirements

jobs.title: Senior Test Engineer
jobs.content:
Do you spend your free time trying to figure out how to break the games you’re playing? Do you see those bugs in games that none of your friends notice until you point them out? Are you obsessed with finding clever ways to combine items and abilities to become the most powerful? Do you like breaking things and letting people know how you did it? We may have a job for you.


Testers at Bungie are grouped into teams, responsible for ensuring that an area of the game is ready to ship. This involves ad-hoc testing, flawlessly executing test passes, rigorous attention to detail, and amazing communication skills. You will work with your lead on a day-to-day basis to determine how to most effectively use your skills.


Senior Test Engineers understand Destiny inside and outside, they have deep knowledge of the internals of the game. They coordinate or lead small test teams responsible for entire systems. They understand how internal changes result in bugs that impact functionality and the player experience. They represent the risks and costs involved in those changes and work collaboratively with their peers to release high quality player experiences within reasonable timeframes. Senior Test Engineers focus on leveraging their technical knowledge to find and prevent bugs from leaking out and educate their peers on the best methods to implement for long term success. They champion automation as part of their team’s daily workflow and identify ways to improve overall team efficiency.


Teams: Bootflow, Graphics, Build Verification Tests, Automation, Platforms, Live, Bungie.net

jobs.title: SDET
jobs.content:
Do you enjoy trying to figure out how to break the games you’re playing? Are you obsessed with finding clever ways to combine items and abilities just to see what will happen? Do you like unraveling how things work, sharing that knowledge with others, and then putting it back together - better, faster, stronger? If so, read on, brave soul.

Bungie is looking for a Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) who wants to help us push the boundaries of testing software. We need someone who shares our passion for automation and tools that: save time, improve workflows, and allow a large test team to be selective in the areas they focus their time.

SDETs must eventually understand Destiny inside and out; you will gather the Deep Knowledge of our systems' internals. You'll be expected to understand how code and content changes may result in bugs that impact functionality and the player experience. You'll leverage your desire to be the best and push our testing methodologies to new heights.

If you believe you have the technical capability to deliver outstanding code and drive quality throughout the team, we'd love to talk to you.

Responsibilities



  • Feature area risk analysis and mitigation


    • Converse with engineering peers and test allies, generating effective test collateral

    • Perform targeted tests against private binary drops

    • Identify and author high return on investment automated tests

    • Guide creation of manual tests for new features to hand off to manual test teams


  • Develop and update tools and processes that allow our test teams to be more efficient


    • Understand multiple technology stacks and engineering workflows

    • Identify workflow pain points/inefficiencies and propose process and engineering solutions

    • Participate in code reviews, author and maintain code according to our development requirements

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer
jobs.content: In addition to making awesome robots that can create almost anything, MakerBot runs Thingiverse, the largest 3D printing repository and social network.  Users have shared over 700,000 projects for things you can 3D print and Thingiverse generates over 1 million downloads a week.  We’ve also built an amazing platform and 3D printing ecosystem built on web technologies.  Our printers are Internet connected to an ecosystem built on Thingiverse using a web REST API providing services such as a cloud storage library and remote monitoring.  We’re looking for a Full Stack Developer to contribute to the new user applications that connect our printers, mobile apps, and desktop app together to provide the best, most user friendly, 3D printing experience.

jobs.title: Professional Services Consultant
jobs.content:
We are seeking a customer facing software engineer to deploy, configure, and customize our suite of commercial software products. The ideal candidate will have experience developing and delivering enterprise software solutions. Candidates should be familiar with understanding customer requirements and developing a technical solution to meet those requirements. This is an opportunity to join a growing organization with a focus on providing customized services and products to our commercial and government customers. This is a customer focused team environment requiring excellent communication and time management skills. Travel up to 15% may be required.


Responsibilities:



  • Works with Sales Account Manager to propose technical solutions to meet customer’s enterprise requirements.

  • Develops, tests, and implements custom software to achieve proposed solution.

  • Deploys and configures enterprise software at customer location, provides onsite support to ensure successful implementation of custom code.

  • Supports product engineering on customer-specific feature requests and bug fixes.

jobs.title: Customer Support Engineer
jobs.content:
Hi there! Seattle based Moz is looking for our first remote employee in Australia! 

We are looking for a positive, outgoing, Internet-loving people-person to join our Help Team! Are you the kid all the neighbors come to when their computers arenât working? Do your customers rave about how awesome your help is? Could you explain the Theory of Relativity to 5th graders? Whether youâre a tabletop junkie or you run your own knitting circle online, you just might be the right geek for the job!

About the position:

The Moz Help Teams got a lot going on! We are branching out to Australia! Your primary role involves using live chat and email to answer customersâ questions about everything from billing problems to product offerings. Youâll also spend a lot of time problem-solving for customers by reproducing their bugs and writing up reports about them for our engineering and product teams.

You will never be bored. By understanding our customersâ needs and working closely with the engineering, product, and marketing teams, you will help us build high quality, delightful products. You'll be working across many different platforms: Firefox, Chrome, Safari, IE, Windows and OSX. You will help drive strategy to make the customer service department more efficient and scalable as our customer base continues to grow. You are creative and passionate about analyzing trends and optimizing business processes. You donât need to be micromanaged; you find your own projects, set your own deadlines, and do exceptional work without close oversight. Rather than waiting for someone else to take action, you do what it takes to get customerâs issues resolved. You learn things as you go and are open to constantly changing as our tools and business operations change.

Lastly, youâre the type of person that doesnât get easily discouraged. The glass is always half full, and despite tough times and hard problems, you never let customer pain get you down. If you can have hard conversations with customers, spend an hour researching and replicating a nasty bug, and still have a smile on your face at the end of the day, weâre made for each other!

Responsibilities:

  • Provide support to our customers and prospective customers via phone, email, live chat, webinar, forums, etc.
  • Advocate for our customers by thoroughly documenting their issues and sending reports to our engineering and product teams.
  • Identify and propose ways we can make our company better, our customers happier, and our jobs easier.
  • Create joy and happiness for everyone involved with Moz, including team members, vendors, and customers.
  • Use your HTML, CSS, programming, copywriting, or other unique skills to initiate projects that improve the customer experience.

Requirements:

  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills. There will be a test!
  • Infectious positive attitude with other team members and customers.
  • Demonstrated ability to resolve conflicts quickly and creatively.
  • Strong organizational skills, attention to detail and ability to prioritize multiple tasks.
  • Independent thinker with the ability to recognize where processes can be improved and who to collaborate with to improve them.
  • Superior analytical skills and problem-solving ability.
  • Experience writing bug reports or other technical documents.
  • Intermediate knowledge of inbound marketing, search engine optimization and HTML.
  • Passionate about technology and the Internet.
  • Experience in technical support and/or customer service roles is a major plus.
  • Experience with customer service software like Intercom, Zuora, Authorize.net, Google Apps, MS Office, Box.net, Docusign, and/or similar applications is a plus.
  • Experience with Google Analytics, any CMS, and other web/production/analysis tools a big plus.

About Moz

We build analytics software that gives our users the technical edge towards better marketing on the web. We are dedicated to the future of marketing analytics.  Weâre obsessed with it.   Weâve been at it for over 7 years and weâre in it for the long haul.  Weâre a leader in our space, growing fast and receiving frequent recognition for our accomplishments (2014 lists include:  Inc 5000, Deloitte Fast 500 and the Puget Sound Business Journal's fastest growing private companies).

Behind our software is a sea of Mozzers with a wide array of personalities, experiences, and expertise.  Weâve worked hard and deliberately to build a cultural roadmap. Itâs not just about ping pong games and company parties (though we have those, too!).  Learn more about it below before you apply:

  • TAGFEE is the glue that holds us together and binds how we do everything at Moz. As Mozzers, we aspire to live and breathe these values.
  • We make the web a better place: (http://moz.com/about) and this is how we do it: (http://moz.com/products).
  • Not convinced we are awesome yet? Check out our video âWhy we love Mozâ.

Moz is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to providing a work environment that is free from any form of discrimination. Moz values diversity and fosters mutual respect among its employees.

To apply: https://boards.greenhouse.io/moz/jobs/240271?gh_jid=240271

jobs.title: Technical Services Engineer Federal
jobs.content:
Our offices are located at Palo Alto, CA - Austin, TX - New York, NY. We will be open to hiring remotely if you have the right type of profile. 



MongoDB is on a mission to change the way people think about databases. Along the way, our customers encounter questions and issues about how our approach to databases works for their use case. In Technical Services, it's our job to help these people.


Cool things you’ll do


MongoDB Technical Services Engineers (TSE), Federal use their problem solving and customer service skills, along with their deep technical experience, to advise Federal customers and to solve their complex MongoDB problems. Federal TSEs are authorities in the entire MongoDB ecosystem - database server, drivers, our management suite, and services such as Cloud Manager (the online product we developed for customers for automation, backup, monitoring, and analysis of their MongoDB systems).  Our engineers combine their MongoDB expertise with passion, initiative, teamwork and a great sense of humor to achieve extraordinary results for our customers.


Why is MongoDB is a fantastic place to work and build your career?



  • Be a part of the company that’s reinventing the database

  • Enjoy a fun, inspiring culture that is engineering focused

  • Work with talented people around the globe

  • Learn, contribute, and make an impact on the product and community

jobs.title: SW Design Engineer Senior
jobs.content:
Are you passionate about software and technology? Do you want to work in an Agile environment that is dynamic, challenging and constantly evolving? Come help us with the continued transformation of our platform into a highly scalable and robust Data Architecture. Your work will reach millions of customers around the world!


In the first 12 months you will:



  • Contribute to an industry leading analytics platform: As part of the team you will be involved in backend data integration that drives our analytics platform and data related features to bring value and insights to our customers and end users.

  • You will be part of an end-to-end service: Working closely with an agile team to deliver your work to our customers.

  • Turn requirements into product: Work with Product Owners to understand customer needs and turn them into product.

jobs.title: Platform Infrastructure Engineer - Trading Solutions
jobs.content:
Job Requisition Number:49673



Who we are:



The Trading Systems (TS) Infrastructure Team, made up of passionate UNIX developers with an eye for superior design. Together we provide platform-level support to more than 50 application teams that build the world's most advanced and award-winning order management systems. We establish best practices, organize file systems and own the disaster recovery, execution management and metrics reporting subsystems. We constantly analyze the condition of our machines, looking for signs of trouble and opportunities to increase their efficiency and capacity.

Our mission is to support the largest banks and investment advisors in the world with a continuously available UNIX application environment that is efficient, scalable, and durable.

Who we're not:

  • Systems administrators
  • 24/7 Operations staff


We'll trust you to:

  • Extend and refactor our framework with innovative designs
  • Work with development, support and business teams to drive capacity planning, performance analysis, instrumentation and other systems requirements
  • Review and add value to the design of TS applications
  • Participate in all aspects of our agile-based development process, from requirements acquisition and system design to automated testing, packaging and deployment


You need to have:

  • 3+ years of experience developing, deploying and debugging distributed systems in a UNIX (Solaris, AIX or Linux) environment
  • 3+ years of experience programming in C/C++
  • A strong knowledge of operating system and networking fundamentals - including IPC mechanisms, multithreading and memory management
  • Proficiency using standard UNIX commands and shell environments (ksh or bash)
  • Experience implementing solutions with standard scripting languages (Python or Perl)
  • A desire to tackle large-scale systems design, troubleshooting and the operation of global mission-critical applications


We'd like to see:

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Ability to handle periodic on-call duties as well as out-of-band requests
  • Familiarity with SQL, JavaScript and basic UI development


Bloomberg is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer and we welcome applications from all backgrounds regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, or any other classification protected by law.

jobs.title: R&D Cybersecurity Researcher
jobs.content:
What Your Job Will Be Like
We are seeking experienced R&D Cybersecurity researchers to participate in efforts to secure government and critical infrastructure systems in support of the Department of Homeland Security and other government Departments and Agencies.  Our group is a unique team whose members develop and deploy operational cybersecurity capabilities, and also conduct cutting-edge research in advanced cybersecurity technologies.  Current research includes vulnerability assessments, countermeasures development and assessment, reverse engineering, malware analysis, VM introspection, intrusion detection, network and host forensics, mobile devices and networks, at-scale virtualization, and enterprise-scale emulation and analysis of cyber events.  Team members are expected to conduct innovative research; to lead projects and also contribute effectively on research teams; to work with customers to understand needs and propose solutions; and to present results as appropriate at open conferences and classified meetings.  Access to knowledge and data in this arena will require a security clearance.  Some travel is expected to meet with sponsors and support successful execution of programs.

This posting will be used to fill openings in both the Enterprise Cyber Security (8965) and Cyber System Assessments (8966) departments.



On any given day, you may be called on to:


  • Apply research advances to challenging multi-disciplinary problems important to national security, with an emphasis on creating a strong cyber environment that can withstand multipronged, highly sophisticated attacks.


How to Apply
Apply by completing an online application at: http://www.sandia.gov/careers
Click on “View all jobs” and enter Job Number“654132" into the Keyword search. 










Qualifications We Require









  • Ph.D. in computer science, computer engineering, or a related technical discipline, with an emphasis on cybersecurity; or Master's degree in these disciplines with at least two years of relevant experience; or Bachelor's degree in these disciplines with at least five years of relevant experience.

  • Expertise in one or more of the following:  cyber vulnerability assessment, intrusion detection systems and countermeasures, network protocols and monitoring, host forensics and memory forensics, malware analysis and triage, Android OS and mobile security, cloud security, network traffic analysis, and emulation of large-scale computer networks.

  • Evidence of relevant research expertise in the form of technical publications, presentations, software, and/or knowledge of applications

  • Software development competence in at least one programming language; e.g. C/C++, Perl, Python, Ruby, Java or a related language.

  • Ability to obtain and maintain a Department of Energy (DOE)-granted Q-level and SCI security clearances.










Qualifications We Desire










  • Demonstrated ability to team effectively in a collaborative research environment and across technical disciplines.

  • Demonstrated ability to obtain and manage research funding, build project teams, write proposals and progress reports and work with sponsors

  • Demonstrated ability to independently bring definition to difficult, ill-defined problems in order to develop workable technical approaches.

  • Ability to obtain customer support for new programs

  • Software engineering proficiency, particularly with respect to best practices and team development of high quality code. 

  • Familiarity with system level development, kernel programming, and binary reverse engineering. 

  • Experience with Intrusion Detection Systems (IDS) and signature development

  • Hands-on network/packet level examination using tools such as tcpdump or wireshark.

  • Strong understanding of inter-domain networking including BGP, layer-2 networking protocols such as OSPF, ARP, DHCP, and TCP/IP networks in general.

  • Working knowledge of TCP/IP, HTTP, SSL, DNS, FTP, SSH, and other common Internet protocols as well as common client scripting languages such as Javascript and VBscript.

  • Working knowledge of multiple operating systems (Windows, UNIX/BSD, Linux, OS X, etc.)

  • Background in solving practical problems in science and engineering that involve encounters with real-world data

  • Evidence of professional service to the community such as service on program committees, workshop organization, and/or editorial or review work






Applicant Searches
































Security Clearance
Position requires a Department of Energy (DOE) granted Q-level security clearance.

Sandia is required by DOE directive to conduct a pre-employment background review that includes personal reference checks, law enforcement record and credit checks, and employment and education verifications. Applicants for employment must be able to obtain and maintain a DOE Q-level security clearance, which requires U.S. citizenship.


Applicants offered employment with Sandia are subject to a federal background investigation to meet the requirements for access to classified information or matter if the duties of the position require a DOE security clearance. Substance abuse or illegal drug use, falsification of information, criminal activity, serious misconduct or other indicators of untrustworthiness can cause a clearance to be denied or terminated by the DOE, rendering the inability to perform the duties assigned and resulting in termination of employment.

jobs.title: Software Engineer - Scala and Python Full Stack
jobs.content:
View Req 7067BR : Senior Engineer - Software














EchoStar’s Digital Broadcast Centers provide advanced online video delivery and satellite video delivery for broadcasters and pay-TV operators across North America. Through our network of uplink centers, these world-class facilities are also home to EchoStar’s 24/7 traffic, technical operations, and satellite access centers. This team is comprised of experienced professionals dedicated to providing customers with an unparalleled level of service delivering content and programming to over 16 million subscribers every day.

EchoStar is seeking an innovative and passionate Software Developer to join an agile team of software engineers located in Englewood, CO and bring value to market quickly. This team uses the scaled agile methodology to create a developer-driven culture via ceremonies such as big room planning, demos, innovation days, and retrospectives. This position is an opportunity for a creative developer to design, develop, and maintain software that will propel the digital TV and movie delivery industry into the future. If you have a sense of adventure, take pride in writing great software, and strive to build the best products on the planet, we want you on our team here at EchoStar.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop full stack solutions using primarily Scala and Python on Unix and Linux around Oracle and Mongo

  • Participate in the Daily Scrum with the Scrum Master and the Agile Development Team

  • Work with the Product Owner to write User Stories that ensure robustness, redundancy, and scalability

  • Contribute to the Emergent Architecture that identifies problems and solves them

  • Design and write software in a functional style combined with object-oriented techniques

  • Write and execute unit tests and automated acceptance tests  

  • Continually integrate code to a common team trunk and continually deploy to a production system  

  • Research, design, and prototype with Spikes and Refactor Stories

  • Promote teamwork and collaboration by participating in paired programming and code reviews

  • Participate in retrospective discussions to help continuously improve our methods

  • Innovate by enthusiastically participating in Innovation Day and patent harvesting activities

  • Help identify and troubleshoot complex production issues in the customer-facing environment

  • Continually populate a team knowledge repository with design summaries, takeaways, techniques, and tutorials

jobs.title: Computer Scientist, User Interfaces/Data Services
jobs.content:
What Your Job Will Be Like


We are seeking outstanding R&D Computer Science professionals to work as User Interface (UI) and related data-service developers for real-time, high consequence systems.  The developers will work on scrum based development teams to design, develop, test and deploy advanced software systems for satellite ground systems.


On any given day, you may be called on to:



  • Design, implement and test UI’s using browser-based technologies (JavaScript) and test driven development methodologies.

  • Design, implement and test data service technologies in Java using RESTful web services and ZeroMQ connections to the business layer with messaging between layers using JSON.

  • Participate in scrum planning meetings, daily stand-ups, sprint and iteration demos and retrospectives.

  • Conduct research in software development methodologies related to UI technologies, for example to enhance the user experience, or develop technologies for cloud computing environments.

  • Identify and implement solutions to software problems with our currently fielded systems.


Qualifications We Require



  • Master's degree in computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering or relevant discipline.

  • Experience in software design, engineering and development skills, including familiarity with modern software development practices and tools.

  • Experience with browser-based software development and tools in a UNIX/Linux environment.

  • Ability to obtain and maintain a required US DOE security clearance and SCI clearance, which may require a polygraph test.


Qualifications We Desire



  • Demonstrated high academic performance measured by cumulative undergraduate GPA of at least 3.5/4.0; cumulative graduate GPA of at least 3.7/4.0.

  • Experience in several of the following technologies: JavaScript – ExtJS, D3.js, Vis.js, Cesium; Java, C++; Test Driven Development – Mocha or Jasmine; Vert.x, RESTful web services, ZeroMQ, JSON, Docker, Kubernetes.

  • Experience with object-oriented software development and tools using Java and/or C++ in a UNIX/Linux environment.

  • Familiarity with Git, Maven, Artifactory, Jenkins; Amazon Cloud technologies, Open Geospatial Consortium data standards

  • Software engineering proficiency, particularly with respect to best practices and team development of high quality code.

  • Experience with current state of the art in infrastructure automation and continuous integration and deployment techniques.

  • Experience with Agile software development methodologies.

  • Experience with relevant application and mission domains (remote sensing systems, satellite systems, satellite ground systems, optical systems, command and control systems, remote asset communications and telemetry).

  • Strong teamwork skills and effective interpersonal and communication skills.

  • An active DOE Q and/or SCI clearance.


Position Information This Limited Term Employee (LTE) position is a temporary position for one year term, which may be renewed at Sandia's discretion up to a maximum of seven years.


Individuals in LTE positions may bid on regular Sandia positions as internal candidates, and in some cases may be converted to regular career positions during their term if warranted by ongoing operational needs, continuing availability of funds, and satisfactory job performance


How to Apply
Apply by completing an online application at: http://www.sandia.gov/careers
Click on “View all jobs” and enter Job Number“654109" into the Keyword search. 


Security Clearance Position requires a Department of Energy (DOE) granted Q-level security clearance.


Sandia is required by DOE directive to conduct a pre-employment background review that includes personal reference checks, law enforcement record and credit checks, and employment and education verifications. Applicants for employment must be able to obtain and maintain a DOE Q-level security clearance, which requires U.S. citizenship.


Applicants offered employment with Sandia are subject to a federal background investigation to meet the requirements for access to classified information or matter if the duties of the position require a DOE security clearance. Substance abuse or illegal drug use, falsification of information, criminal activity, serious misconduct or other indicators of untrustworthiness can cause a clearance to be denied or terminated by the DOE, rendering the inability to perform the duties assigned and resulting in termination of employment.

jobs.title: Front End Web Developer
jobs.content:
WHAT WE OFFER:


1)  The opportunity to help change an enormous industry from the ground up.


2)  A team ­oriented startup culture, with the resources and stability of an established player.


3) The ability to work on the latest technology stacks (MongoDB, Node.js, etc.)


ABOUT US: 


We are an innovative in­house startup at one of the largest life insurance companies globally, that is on a mission to redefine life insurance, making it simple, convenient, and online. 


For the right person this is a unique opportunity that brings the culture of a startup to the stability and backing of a large company. 


You will be part of a small and growing team of experienced technology and customer experience ­focused professionals that values smarts, moving fast, and iterating quickly. You will have the opportunity to work on the latest technology stacks (Node.js, MongoDB) in real production environments and with the backing and resources of a large company.


Their office is based in a WeWork space in New York City and we are looking for like­minded developers, with an interest in financial services innovation, to join our team today.


THE ROLE:


This role includes being one of the primary developers responsible for front­end development on our advanced financial services web application. It also includes working closely with marketing to support customer acquisition efforts requiring technology resources such as blog, landing pages, or campaign needs.


These are essential to success in this role:


      Significant experience developing web­based applications in production environments.


      Thorough understanding of CSS/HTML and modern page layout techniques.


      Experience working with designers cutting up layouts to implement pixel perfect pages.


      Experience with responsive layout and design, preferably with Bootstrap framework.


      Familiarity with website optimization techniques.


      Experience with Javascript as it pertains enhancing web pages, managing 3rd party scripts


      Strong visual design sense and appreciation for developing with a client experience focus


      You must be a high achiever, ambitious, willing to learn and aiming to be a rock star.


      Clear communicator, both written and oral, and able to work with marketing teams effectively.


These skills are a not required but are a plus:


      Programming experience in Javascript or other languages


      Single page app experience (e.g. Angular, Ember etc).


      Some experience with an MVC  framework like Angular, Backbone, Ember etc.


      Experience with web analytics (Google Analytics, Mixpanel, etc.)


      Experience with social media interfaces and related analytical tools


      Familiarity with SEO and how it affects implementation

jobs.title: Web Application Developer
jobs.content:
WHAT WE OFFER:



  • The opportunity to help change an enormous industry from the ground up.

  • A team ­oriented startup culture, with the resources and stability of an established player.

  • The ability to work on the latest technology stacks (mongoDB, node.js, etc.)


ABOUT US:


Our client is an innovative in­house startup at one of the largest life insurance companies globally, that is on a mission to redefine life insurance, making it simple, convenient, and online. 


For the right person this is a unique opportunity that brings the culture of a startup to the stability and backing of a large company. 


You will be part of a small and growing team of experienced technology and customer experience ­focused professionals that values smarts, moving fast, and iterating quickly. You will have the opportunity to work on the latest technology stacks (node.js, MongoDB) in real production environments and with the backing and resources of a large company.


Our office is based in a WeWork space in New York City and we are looking for like­minded developers, with an interest in financial services innovation, to join our team today.


THE ROLE:


You will be joining a small, experienced technology team as one of the main developers responsible for our advanced online financial services application.  Experience with web development is a plus, although more important to us is real programming experience and thoughtfulness about how and why you do what you do.


Your job will require you to work closely with your fellow technology team members, to coordinate with QA resources, and to communicate with business team members in completion of your work.  Working with other developers you might work on items such as: developing components for algorithmic or manual underwriting module, creating workflow tools for routing insurance applications, defining and applying rule sets for third party data feeds, or building customer facing components for taking new business applications. The job will be varied and challenging.


These are essential to success in this role:



  • 3-­5+ years of experience as a developer.

  • Deep knowledge of Google Analytics

  • Extensive experience with past exposure to traditional object oriented languages (e.g. Java, .net, Ruby, Python)

  • A demonstrable experience in building modern, complex customer­facing web applications.

  • Experience with Javascript as a programming language

  • Exposure to modern MVC (Model­view­controller) frameworks

  • Solid grounding in data driven applications and concepts (data/object modeling, database systems)

  • Comfortable expressing and defending points of view while respecting those of others.

  • These skills are not required but are a plus:

  • Testing strategy definition and framework creation

  • Experience with event­driven Java programming (e.g Swing, GWT)

  • Experience and familiarity with financial services or other mathematically oriented applications.

  • Working in a startup or agile development environments

  • Experience in multi­platform web­sites (desktop, mobile).

  • BA/BS in computer science.


COMPENSATION:


Our client pays competitive base salaries and rewards performance. Their salary structure is commensurate with experience. In addition, you will be eligible to participate in their comprehensive benefits program including medical insurance and 401(K).


Our client is an Affirmative Action/Equal Employment Opportunity Employer (M/F/V/D)

jobs.title: Editor in Chief, GrowthLab
jobs.company: I WIll Teach You to be Rich
jobs.content:
Welcome to the future of entrepreneurship. There is a tidal wave of entrepreneurship on the way. Millennials, bigger than the Boomers, eager to turn their passions and skills into profitable and flexible businesses.

But the old paths to entrepreneurship don't make sense anymore. Do you really want to make an app and pray you're the next Instagram? Do you want to chase venture capital all day? Do you want to leverage everything you own for a business loan? Of course not. There's a better way.

At GrowthLab, we teach people how to start, grow and run online businesses. We have tens of thousands of students and millions of readers. We have success stories across dozens of industries. We have a content engine in place and are ready to roll.

Now, how can we make GrowthLab the #1 destination for online business?

This is why we need you
We're looking for someone to lead the www.growthlab.com blog â content, traffic, analytics, and building a best-in-class team of writers and editors.

From there, you'll expand to events, social media, video and beyond to make GrowthLab a household name.

Your two key metrics will be traffic and subscribers, but quality â quality of content and quality of traffic â will be essential every step of the way.

If you had a budget, staff and time to create the best, what kind of site would you build? How would you go above and beyond to make GrowthLab required reading for anyone even considering starting a business?

As Editor-in-Chief of GrowthLab, you'll work closely with the CEO and the Head of Editorial. You'll develop and expand the GrowthLab staff. The GrowthLab that you build will change the way millennials think about business and success.

Projects you'll own
You'll lead the charge, and the team, behind www.GrowthLab.com. This includes:

Vision

  • Providing a vision and roadmap for the next 3 years of success on GrowthLab.com
  • Partnering with leadership to align GrowthLab and company strategy and execution

Building a top grade GrowthLab team

  • Recruiting top internal and external talent to make GrowthLab best-in-class
  • Managing a high performing team to execute on your roadmap
  • Building an efficient, scalable content creation process

Best-in-class content

  • Expanding GrowthLab into new channels and voices, as well as finding new and quantitatively better ways to attract and connect with our audience
  • Tracking GrowthLab traffic and conversion data to discover what editorial is working, what's not, and always being two steps ahead on where GrowthLab.com needs to go next

The experience and skills you'll need to be successful in this role

GROWTH

  • You have a strong background in leading high-performance content-driven teams, and experience with growing mid-to-large sized websites.
  • You have experience building and leading a creative organization, including setting creative guidelines, and managing editorial calendars.
  • Must have experience developing and managing both internal and external talent.

DATA-DRIVEN

  • You must be data-savvy and data-driven. You have experience using traffic and conversion metrics to drive innovation and make decisions.

TRACK RECORD

  • You have a track record â and strong portfolio of â creating compelling, high-quality, well-received content.
  • You understand the difference between what's hot and what's not â and how to create compelling, valuable content without slipping into clickbait or lectures.
  • You are a natural leader and influencer. You are able to define, communicate, and obtain buy-in from the entire team to follow your creative vision.
  • You have a passion for excellence. This isn't about clicks or pageviews or vanity metrics. This is about creating a far-reaching, long-lasting, premium brand.

Weâre a high performance team of exceptionally talented and diverse individuals, and we nurture each otherâs personalities, creativity and obsessions to bring forth unique content, products and services to the market.

We are currently experiencing substantial growth in our business. We are seeking high caliber individuals who want to help push us to the next level. If you like to move quickly and have a bias for action, youâll fit right into our fast-paced, results-based environment. Weâre a 100% remote/virtual team environment where you can work from wherever you are and forge connections with impressive colleagues from around the country.

*Must be US based*

This is a full-time, 100% remote position.

To apply: http://www.iwillteachyoutoberich.com/careers/editor-in-chief/Please indicate that you found this job listing on WeWorkRemotely. Thank you.
