jobs.title: Principal Software Design Engineer
jobs.content:
Are you passionate about software and technology? Do you want to work in an Agile environment that is dynamic, challenging and constantly evolving? Come help us with the continued transformation of our platform into a highly scalable and robust Data Architecture. Your work will reach millions of customers around the world!


In the first 12 months you will deliver:



  • Contribute to an industry leading analytics platform: As part of the team you will be involved in the development of the backend data integration architecture that drives our analytics platform.

  • You will be part of an end-to-end service: Working closely with an agile team to deliver your work to our customers.

  • Turn requirements into product: Work with Product Owners to understand customer needs and turn them into product.


In order to accomplish this you will need to:



  • Build features in our data integration architecture.

  • Good understanding of complex data driven systems and distributed computing.

  • Building systems in a SaaS/Cloud environment.

  • Review of designs and code.

  • Feeling of end-to-end ownership of releases.

  • Ability to be a self-starter with a results driven attitude.

  • Ability to work individually as part of a team.

jobs.title: Mobile Engineer
jobs.content: XOEye Technologies is looking to add a mobile engineer.  You'll be responsible for taking requirements from our product team and turn them into fully implemented features in our Vision mobile applications. We're looking for someone that can own the iOS (and maybe Android) applications and make hard technical decisions to make it a success.

jobs.title: Full Stack Engineer
jobs.content: XOEye Technologies is looking to add another full stack engineer.  You'll be responsible for taking requirements from our product team and turn them into fully implemented features in our Vision platform. You'll get a chance to touch all of the pieces of our architecture, build new services and implement features on a platform that is in production helping people do their job.

jobs.title: Forward Deployed Engineer
jobs.content:
It's an exciting time to work at UpGuard. Our customers are digitally transforming their businesses and they need our help. UpGuard is at the front lines of solving enterprise-scale IT operations and development problems. Our product scans and tracks reams of server and device configurations within any enterprise. Their administrators can then do powerful things with that data—visualize and pinpoint inconsistencies and vulnerabilities, create policies to standardize a configuration, or even create automation scripts based on running machines to replicate and scale their infrastructure. Demand is going through the roof, and we're in search of Forward Deployed Engineers to bolster our ranks.


As a FDE, you understand our customers better than anyone. You work with them directly every day and feel their greatest pain point. You design robust solutions to address them. Projects often start with a nebulous question like "How can I integrate UpGuard with my custom app?" or "How can we identify configuration drift across 1,800 servers on 3 continents?"


You're a fast mover and thorough thinker. You develop solutions and see them through the entire process, from high-level design and prototyping to application development and data integration. You solicit constant feedback from both customers and colleagues, improving our products over time in rapid iteration cycles. You deploy cutting-edge code to solve difficult problems. You work with customers around the world both onsite and offsite, from first contact to successful deployment, and you gain unique insight into the world's most important industries and institutions.


We have three FDE positions open. One in Portland, OR, another in Mountain View, CA, and another field / remote US East.

jobs.title: Technology Lead
jobs.content: R/GA is looking for a Technology Lead for our Data Science and Visualization Group. The Tech lead collaborates across a multidisciplinary team and brings innovative technology solutions and solutions that reflect an awareness of the overall client and strategic goals, as well as an understanding of the target audience. This position creates products and platforms that make data useful, accessible, and meaningful by working collaboratively with the data science and design leads through rapid prototyping cycles.

jobs.title: Java Developer - NoSQL - Catalog Team
jobs.content:
Software Engineer for Catalog Team to design and support Global Expansion.


Software Engineer - Catalog Team (Full Stack, Global Expansion)


Are you an expert of all-things-data? Do you thrive on building cutting-edge technology that processes mass-scale information at blazing speeds? Are you an expert in International Global Expansion? StubHub is ramping-up its Engineering teams and looking for Engineers with a solid Computer Science foundation and the drive succeed. In this hands-on role, you will work with a team of developers to build our next-generation business services systems. We offer an innovative development environment that delivers a world-class online ticketing experience to fans across the US. If you’re passionate about software engineering, enjoy solving complex data challenges and looking for a platform to springboard your career, StubHub wants to hear from you.


Primary Responsibilities:



  • Develop, design and model complex database schema

  • Process data collection and cleansing from a wide range of sources

  • Design Global Expansion Internationalization Strategy

  • Implement code on large scale projects

  • Collaborate with team members to architect, plan and design eCommerce products

  • Ensure unit test coverage metrics are met and nightly builds succeed

  • Manage the project bug queue and ensure QE has a working test environment

  • Provide work status to Project and Development Managers and escalate issues on a timely basis


Requirements:



  • Bachelor’s degree with 7-15 years of experience in the database/software engineering field

  • Experience with Java/ JEE, Spring and Hibernate

  • Extensive knowledge of developing REST API’s

  • Strong database development and analysis skills using Oracle and SQL

  • Experience with front-end development frameworks (i.e. JavaScript, Backbone.js, JQuery, Bootstrap)

  • Knowledge on NoSQL and Hadoop/Spark eco system will be helpful

  • Experience collecting and cleansing data from various sources

  • Ability to conduct Unit testing and to solve complex QE issues

  • Must be passionate about technology and able to introduce new technology-be an innovator!

  • Strong communication skills with the ability to work in a team based environment


Primary Responsibilities:



  • Develop, design and model complex database schema

  • Process data collection and cleansing from a wide range of sources

  • Design Global Expansion Internationalization Strategy

  • Implement code on large scale projects

  • Collaborate with team members to architect, plan and design eCommerce products

  • Ensure unit test coverage metrics are met and nightly builds succeed

  • Manage the project bug queue and ensure QE has a working test environment

  • Provide work status to Project and Development Managers and escalate issues on a timely basis

jobs.title: Senior Java Developer
jobs.content:
As an experienced member of our development team, you will make key technical design decisions as well as key code contributions for new projects and future releases of jBilling. You will mentor members of our technical team, reviewing their designs and implementations in a fast-paced and dynamic start-up environment.



As a Senior Java Developer, you will also be responsible for working with account executives and contributing to our sales process. Your technical expertise and experience, combined with superior communication skills, will be fundamental for your role as a liaison to our customers, answering potential jBilling prospects technical questions, as well as participating in requests for proposals (RFPs). You will also be involved with large implementation projects providing on-site solutions architecture for our customers in Europe and North America.



Please note that you will be required to pass two technical tests before you are given your first assignments. The time spent on these tests will not be paid.


Essential Responsibilities



  • Write critical core code

  • Mentor junior members of the team

  • Evaluate and propose new technologies

  • Contribute to solve the hardest support issues

  • Review code

  • Review designs

  • Participate in sales calls, answering technical questions

  • Advise the sales team on answering RFPs

  • Provide solution architecture consulting, at times on-site

  • Occasional travel may be required

jobs.title: Sr. Application Specialist
jobs.content:
Development and/or modification of procedures, programs or hardware to solve business systems problems, considering computer equipment capacity and limitations, operating costs and business needs. Has technical knowledge of all components of one or more operating systems or subsystems. Has technical skill and experience necessary to develop custom solutions. Works with the technical team and management to propose system strategies to support company needs.



  • Assist with systems administration, database and system design, development and implementation to insure compatibility with existing Architecture;

  • Design and implement next generation web and multi-tier solutions for new applications and existing web-based and client-server application with minimal assistance

  • Perform system development, installation and configuration; Install system software and hardware;

  • Coordinate project plans for development; develop proposals and delivery tasks/issues with minimal assistance;

  • Technical and business writing; including formal/informal oral presentation;

  • 10% Design and development of standards to be maintained; Assist in developing cost models/estimates that are accurate and complete;

  • Performance monitoring, capacity planning, system tuning;

  • Perform testing of software from a performance perspective; Resolve critical availability problems; Monitor, analyze, and tune system parameters

jobs.title: C# Developer
jobs.content: We are looking for a Senior-level C# developer to develop backend web services and infrastructure for gaming.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
The Apptio Cost Analytics team builds services that are the fundamental building blocks used by Apptio SaaS offerings and is responsible for 95% of the company’s revenue. This team creates the technology that collects, stores and analyzes vast amounts of data from our customers.


In the Cost Analytics team, your day to day job involves working on some of our toughest challenges, like:



  • Building a big data ingestion and transformation service to collect our customer’s data.

  • Building a modeling service which captures the complexities of internal economies for large companies

  • Building a high performance data store with sub-second query response time for arbitrary queries.

  • Design and develop advanced analytics to provide insights to our customers

  • Building a visualization and reporting system with 99.99% service availability


 We have a smart, motivated and impassioned team and we are looking for engineers with strong design and coding skills. Solid experience in distributed systems, large scale or high performance data processing and advanced analytics is highly preferred.


We’re looking for a Senior Software Development Engineer with expertise and passion in solving difficult problems, and operating tier-1 online services. You will know what needs to be done and how to accomplish it expeditiously and execute. You are at ease working in an agile, continuous integration DevOps model and are interested in leading the technical direction of a team. If this is you, the Apptio Platform is a unique place where you can build innovative technologies in a rewarding, fast growing and dynamic environment.


Responsibilities:



  • Lead across all major software lifecycle phases including scoping, requirements, design, implementation, testing, and deployment

  • Communicate with users, other technical teams, and management to collect requirements, describe software product features, and technical designs.

  • Review architecture, designs, and code and promote good software engineering practices across the development team and other parts of the organization.

  • Evaluate and test new technologies; figure out how they may help Apptio be better at what it does

  • Monitor environments for reliability and performance

jobs.title: Application Integration Specialist
jobs.content:
Assist with modification of procedures, programs or hardware to solve business systems problems, considering computer equipment capacity and limitations, operating costs and business needs. Has technical knowledge of most components of one or more operating systems or subsystems. Has technical skill and experience necessary to develop custom solutions. Works with the technical team and management to propose system strategies to support company needs.



  • Assist with systems administration, database and system design, development and implementation;

  • Perform system development, installation and configuration; Install system software and hardware;

  • Coordinate and assist with project plans for development; develop proposals and delivery tasks/issues with assistance;

  • Technical and business writing; including formal/informal oral presentation; development of standards, cost model estimates

  • Assist with performance monitoring, capacity planning, system tuning;

  • Perform testing of software from a performance perspective; Resolve critical availability problems; Monitor, analyze, and tune system parameters;

  • Assist in designing and implementing next generation web and multi-tier solutions for new applications and existing web-based and client-server application;

jobs.title: Staff Software Engineer in Performance
jobs.content:
Responsibilities:




  • Evaluate application architectures and design performance and stability tests

  • Measure and analyze performance data, (workload, system and application)

  • Solve complex problems and provide clear and concise reports with recommendations

  • Benchmark new technologies and application platforms before wider adoption at TurboTax

  • Work closely with development teams, architects and engineers to test their products and make recommendations to improve performance and stability

  • Develop new performance test tools for use across the enterprise

  • Ensuring that the resources are appropriately experienced and qualified for the test project

  • Ensuring the development and successful execution of the non-functional element of project test strategies and test plans which must be focused on business requirements, and be risk based, i.e. focused on minimizing the risks to the business

  • Non-functional testing which will include Automation, Performance and Load testing and other types of non-functional testing such as Usability, Security, Backup, Archive and Recovery

  • Providing regular reports on the performance characteristics of the system

  • Coordinating multi-faceted teams across the organization


Qualifications:



  • 8+ years experience designing and developing web, software, or mobile applications

  • Strong programming, testing and debugging skills in Java or C/C++ and Python or Perl

  • Working knowledge of at least one of the Load testing tools (JMeter)

  • Strong self-driven collaborator with ability to work in diverse teams as a contributing member

  • Knowledge of distributed systems

  • Strongknowledge ofLinux (Unix) command

  • Good understanding of SQL and previous experience with ORACLE databases

  • Effective data analysis and problem solving skills

  • Exceptional verbal and written English skills

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Engineering or equivalent experience

  • 5+ years managing/leading a technical team

  • 3+ years professional technical experience, preferably in software engineering or quality assurance – with aspects of performance planning and execution of large scale web applications

  • Experience conducting complex system performance investigations

  • Strong knowledge of software development methodologies and practices

  • Very strong verbal and written communication skills

  • High attention to detail and strong quality orientation

  • Ability to partner successfully across technical and non-technical teams


Imagine a career where your creative inspiration can fuel BIG innovation. Year-over-year, Intuit has been recognized as a best employer and is consistently ranked on Fortune’s “100 Best Companies To Work For” and Fortune World’s “Most Admired Software Companies” lists. Immerse yourself in our award winning culture while creating breakthrough solutions that simplify the lives of consumers and small businesses and their customers worldwide.


Intuit is expanding its social, mobile, and global footprint with a full suite of products and services that are revolutionizing the industry. Utilizing design for delight and lean startup methodologies, our entrepreneurial employees have brought more than 250 innovations to market – from QuickBooks®, Quicken®, and TurboTax®, to GoPayment, Mint.com, big data, cloud (SaaS, PaaS) and mobile apps. The breadth and depth of these customer-driven innovations mean limitless opportunities for you to turn your ingenious ideas into reality at Intuit.


Discover what it’s like to be part of a team that rewards taking risks and trying new things. It’s time to love what you do! Check out all of our career opportunities at: careers.intuit.com. EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability

jobs.title: .NET Developer
jobs.content:
Job Description


Greenshades Software strives to let developers be developers: we keep red tape and meetings to a bare minimum, provide a casual and fun work environment, and work hard to handle the mundane tasks so that developers can focus on tackling challenging problems in production code. We are a growing company with openings for new developers to work with our current team of rock stars:

jobs.title: Principal Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Turnitin is seeking an experienced Software Engineer to join our Search Engine Unit (SEU) team. This group is responsible for creating the backend search and data infrastructure that is the core of our business. More than one million educators use our technology to verify the authenticity of their students’ work against a massive amount of searchable data, scientific literature, and close to 300 million student papers in multiple languages. Our rapid domestic and international growth is pushing this team to refactor our current architecture and infrastructure for speed, scalability, and efficiency.  


Responsibilities:



  • Improve the quality of current codebase and support the move to a microservice architecture by designing and writing new services that can gradually replace portions of our current system with components that conform to current best practices

  • Help identify and move towards good replacements for current proprietary portions of our architecture where appropriate

  • Implement new and support existing features while improving the quality of the current codebase

  • Increase the number, quality, and reach of unit and integration tests

  • Mentor engineers by working closely together on projects (e.g. pair programming, giving constructive feedback on code)

  • Investigate and address production issues

  • Work closely with software architects and database/operations engineers on system infrastructure and design

  • Foster a culture of collaboration and open communication

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer - Full Stack
jobs.content:
What Are We Working On?


The 20+ members of our engineering team are building:



  • Highly Scalable, Distributed Microservices that can handle hundreds of millions of events per day

  • Machine Learning Pipeline leveraging Kafka & Spark

  • 100+ Node HBase & ElasticSearch Cluster that stores Petabytes of global fraud data

  • Distributed Workflow Systems that automate our key customers’ business processes

  • Highly interactive UI leveraged by thousands of fraud analysts around the globe using React.js, ES6, and D3.js.


Who Are You?


You are jack of all trades and very good at a number of things.  You are equally fluent talking about pros & cons of Flux architecture in React as you are writing RESTful endpoints using Dropwizard & Java.  You dream in data structures, SQL is your second language, and you love the challenge of building a perfect API.  You like helping your teammates however way you can, removing blockers, designing things together on a whiteboard, or just being a rubber duck.  You love to keep track of various advancements in technology, and is always looking to bring innovation back into your team.  Finally, you have been looking for an opportunity where you can leverage your passion and skills for good (in Sift Science’s case, helping to eliminate fraud on the internet).

jobs.title: Web Applications Engineer
jobs.content:
As a full-stack engineer here you’ll contribute to everything from our 3rd-Party CoffeeScript deployed across hundreds of publishers like Time Inc. and Forbes, to our self-serve native content exchange with significant growth opportunities - from jumping into our Scala-based data pipeline and microservices to provisioning AWS resources with Chef.


Let’s talk if…




  • You speak (or are interested in speaking!) our stack: Rails, RSpec, CoffeeScript, Backbone.js, HAML, LESS, etc.




  • You take pride in treating software development as a craft and delivering SOLID well-tested code.




  • You derive deep satisfaction from participating in the problem definition and solution process with a diverse group from around the company.

jobs.title: SDK Engineer
jobs.content:
As an engineer on our Client Team, you’ll be responsible for designing and implementing Sharethrough’s SDK in native apps. The software you create will be used by top publishers to power their iOS and mobile web applications.  


Let's talk if...



  • You have 1 year of experience building complex mobile applications using Objective C, C++, JavaScript, or other frameworks

  • You have knowledge of iOS SDK performance tools and optimization

  • You have knowledge of the mobile web environment including design principles and best practices


Bonus Points if …



  • You have experience with Swift, React, or ES6

jobs.title: Full Stack Developer Who Wants to Work With Satellites
jobs.content:
Do you love to solve problems & puzzles and be challenged? If yes, then read more.  


We are looking for software developers that can solve problems with difficult math and physics combined with scheduling algorithms on one/all of desktop, web, mobile, on-board satellite applications.


Candidates will work in small development teams on all aspects of the development life cycle. They will interact directly with customers and have the potential to attend domestic and international conferences. Self-motivation and the ability to work independently or as part of a team are required. They will interact internally with the VP of Software Development, Software Engineers and Systems Engineers. Our ideal candidate is highly motivated, eager to learn, and able to come up with innovative solutions to challenging problems. Orbit Logic offers a casual, friendly work environment and a competitive benefits.


Orbit Logic is  an software engineering company that creates applications related to satellites/space/aircraft for the full tech stack.  We are not keyed into a specific language, but are looking for developers who can design and build good code on a complex subject matter.

jobs.title: Distributed Systems Engineer
jobs.content:
Sharethrough is looking for engineers interested in tackling the problems of building large-scale, distributed- and stream-based processing systems.  As a Distributed Systems Engineer, you’ll work on:




  • Building fault-tolerant micro-services




  • Enhancing a low-latency decisioning engine responsible for complex predictive behaviour (at thousands of requests per second)




  • A streaming data pipeline supervising millions of daily events




Let’s talk if..




  • You have experience with delivering multithreaded and/or distributed JVM-based systems.  No experience with Scala?  Come learn!




  • You have experience with Spark and/or Spark Streaming or similar stream-based processing systems.  Experience with Hadoop-based pipelines, maybe a bit of Cascading or Scalding?  That works too, come give Spark a shot.



  • What you're building is as important to you as why you're building it.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
DISTRIBUTED SYSTEMS AT MICROSOFT


 The scale of platforms and services we are building are by far some of the largest in the world.  From core cloud computing platform development, to the services running on them, we do it all.  We not only consume these platforms to run services like Office 365, Bing.com, Xbox Live, Skype and One Drive, but we sell enterprise level services, such as Azure, SQL, Visual Studios, etc., to fortune 100 customers as well.  We bring the word "scale" to a whole new, well… scale…  Come and:    



  • Analyze complex quality problems, identify and design solutions, and make high-impact improvements in close collaboration with other engineers. 

  • Develop large-scale systems with enterprise-class quality and hone your design, analytical, and communication skills. 

  • Build the foundation for the cloud to power the future of computing and the "Internet of Things". We believe computing holds the potential to shape how billions of people live their lives. We each hold within us the potential to shape the future of computing. Potential is just that, potential, until it is put into a plan of action, obsessed over, worked, refined and reworked again and again until it all comes together in a brilliant work of passion sparking a change in the world. At Microsoft we search relentlessly for the limit of potential in people and computing, but haven't found it yet. Microsoft, where the potential to empower billions is unleashed and pursued!TECHNICAL FOCUS AREAS




    1. Distributed Networking

    2. Distributed Storage

    3. Distributed Computing

    4. Platform Services

    5. Distributed Application Services



CORE SKILLS


Distributed Networking



  • Experience working with the latest networking technologies such as Software Defined Networking (SDN), Software Load Balancer (SLB), NDIS MPLS, Datacenter Virtualization, or Open Wave.



  • Experience working with the overall Networking Stack.


Distributed Storage



  • Experience working with large scale, and scalable systems with specific focus on storage issues.

  • Experience working with technologies such as: Durability, availability, elasticity, and concurrency, Scalable and distributed by the cloud/partitioned cloud storage, Distributed file systems,  Real time- in memory storage and real time storage, NAS, High Available Disaster Recovery (HADR), caching , RAID


Distributed Compute and Database



  • Experience working with large scale, and scalable systems with specific focus on storage issues.

  • Experience working with technologies such as: Performance Monitoring, Scalable Platforms, Security, application hosting, datacenter management, reliability and performance. No SQL, SSD, Relational Databases


Platform Services



  • Experience working with large scale, and scalable systems with specific focus on storage issues.

  • Experience working with technologies such as: Large-scale enterprise and consumer services, performance algorithms, commerce, Cloud Services or Mobile Applications, Service-Oriented Architectures, API's and Web Services


Distributed Application Services



  • Experience building highly reliable software which has been deployed in a distributed environment.



  • Experience building robust web applications.

jobs.title: Head of Technology
jobs.content:
The Head of Technology at the Indianapolis Museum of Art (IMA) is responsible and accountable for the strategy, planning, and execution of all information and technology resources, projects of the IMA, including the IMA Lab.


 ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS include the following.



  • Develop short and long-term plans and strategy for technology at the IMA and IMA Lab in conjunction with the CFO with a focus on identifying and implementing innovative solutions for leading cultural institutions. Lead the departments in developing and achieving their strategic plans.

  • Direct supervision of the IT Operations Department including the support and planning of the IMA's network infrastructure, email systems, network storage, server applications, desktop support, gallery electronics, helpdesk, network security and disaster recovery backup and planning.

  • Direct the efforts of the IMA Lab.  This team of software developers and graphics designers is responsible for the creation and maintenance of IMA's information infrastructure including, the collection management system, digital asset management system, ticketing, membership, and retail systems, as well as the library and digital asset cataloging systems. In addition, this team develops innovative solutions for and with partner art museums, gardens, historic societies, and other cultural institutions.

  • Identify funding opportunities, including grant-based opportunities. In addition, he/she will be responsible for tracking the IMA Lab’s business development client and grant pipeline.

  • Maintain and strengthen the IMA's reputation as a leader in the cultural field in the use of technology and for promoting the IMA’s mission.

  • Develop relationships and collaborations with other leaders in the field.  These collaborations will leverage the IMA's existing efforts to take advantage of synergies and common interests between like-minded institutions.

  • Responsible for the budgeting and financial aspects of operating these departments.

  • Other projects and duties, as assigned.

jobs.title: Full-Stack Web Developer
jobs.content:
We are an innovative marketing services company, seeking a new core team member who has a mix of software development, front-end development, UX strategy, and design skills. You will primarily be working on developing our new marketing analytics platform, as well as working with our team to deliver highly effective marketing experiences for our clients and their customers. You must be an expert in current standards and best practices for technologies such as Scala, Ruby, PHP, MongoDB, NoSQL, CSS3, HTML5, jQuery, JavaScript, AJAX, Github and more. Ideally you have been involved with prior software development projects and/or built dynamic web applications leveraging modern day technology stacks.


You will work in an agile, fast-paced, collaborative environment with a diverse set of professionals who are all focused on one thing: providing exceptional and unique value for our customers. Like us, you will have a great deal of fun, and will love seeing the outcomes of your individual and team efforts.


Please send cover letter, resume, and examples of your work to careers[at]bgcboston.com


Responsibilities



  • Lead in the development of our marketing analytics tool

  • Architect a full-stack scalable solution for the product

  • Be able to communicate timelines and how long specific milestones will take

  • Collaborate with team's marketing strategists, designers, and managers throughout project (discovery, UX, design, development) to identify requirements and to prescribe and implement solutions)

  • Stay up-to-date with technology standards and new platforms

  • Leverage CMS platforms and develop custom configurations as projects require

  • Turn creative prototypes into fully functional web experiences, staying to spec or suggesting more effective alternatives

  • Develop full-stack systems that will withstand high-volume traffic situations

  • Support projects on behalf of our clients, as well as our own marketing and product development efforts

  • Attend client calls and meetings as technical expert and advisor

  • Manage daily communication with our client's development teams and their partners

jobs.title: Backend Engineer
jobs.content:
Farmers Insurance is one of the nation top insurers and providers of financial services. Today, the Farmers Digital Transformation is a new strategic initiative that was formed to drive agility throughout our business and to respond faster to market demands. A critical part of the initiative is to build a new engineering team for mobile and the innovation labs to foster innovation and to promote more lean, agile processes while delivering products in two key areas: mobile and API platform/Big Data. A career at Farmers Insurance offers compelling ways of delivering something that is not only impactful for the organization but also for our customers.


Farmers insurance mobile and innovation team is looking for  backend engineers (junior, seasoned and senior) to help us take InsurTech to the next level.


The role:


    - Work on Farmers Mobile REST API


    - Develop new services and optimize existing ones


    - Research new technologies that will extend your skills and the value that Farmers Insurance can offer to our customers.

jobs.title: Full-Stack Drupal Web Developer
jobs.content:
***Please note, no visa sponsorship is available for this position. Only U.S. residents will be considered***


As a Full-Stack Drupal Developer with Miles you will be working on some of the largest most significant websites in the travel industry. Your sites will reach millions of visitors. The development decisions you make will impact the way users plan vacations.


Miles is looking for two well-rounded lead Full-Stack Drupal Developers for our Web Development teams. We are looking for developers with equal experience in front-end and back-end work who are interested in contributing to pushing ideas forward in the tourism space.


Responsibilities



  • Development and maintenance of our clients’ Drupal-based web sites

  • Developing and contributing to project plans including estimates, scopes, approaches, schedules and expectations

  • Working with other team members to resolve technical issues and problem solving

  • Communicating with technical and none technical team members

jobs.title: Junior Programmer
jobs.content: If you recently graduated from college and have a passion for technology, then you need to apply to this job! We’re looking for an entry level .NET application developer/programmer. The ideal candidate should have knowledge of the design and implementation of C#/.NET web development.

jobs.title: Lead Software Developer
jobs.content:
We are looking for the “Best of the Best” to help take us to the next level. The right candidate is someone that eats, drinks and sleeps agile based fast track, full stack pair-programming and wants to build cutting edge products with Rails.


Outside of being an outstanding developer, you must have strong communication skills, be extremely passionate, have the ability to manage multiple projects, and enjoy working closely with designers, producers and other developers. You'll be creating world-class digital experiences that incorporate the latest industry technologies. Additionally, you will work closely with product to innovate and push boundaries, create prototypes to support concepts, participate in code reviews, mentor developers, and pair program.


Responsibilities:



  • Develop SaaS applications and services that are configurable, extensible, scalable, and highly performant

  • Write code that is scalable, maintainable, reusable, and well-tested

  • Create APIs as a service for your team and customers

  • Optimize complex data models for understandability and performance

  • Collaborate with members of the design team – both technical as well as business owners - to identify requirements and design new products or extensions to existing products.

  • Produce application prototypes with sufficient detail to allow others in the development team to complete the development work.

  • Provide technical oversight to the development process including code reviews and mentoring of the technical team.

  • Must be able to deliver solutions end-to-end with a focus on hitting delivery milestones.

  • Experience in an agile development environment and understanding of agile/lean delivery methods is required.

  • Design and oversee unit and integration tests to ensure application logic is fully exercised for each application component

jobs.title: Web Programmer/Developer
jobs.content:
As a member of our staff, you will work with other software developers to enhance our web site presence, which includes a company intranet and secured web-based applications for insurance agents and policyholders.


The chosen candidate will design, develop, and support web-based systems using the latest web technologies, such as ASP.NET MVC, C#, SQL, JavaScript, JQuery, HTML, CSS, and Microsoft SQL Server. In addition, experience and knowledge in mobile app development is a plus.


We offer a competitive compensation package along with a collaborative work atmosphere that offers the freedom to develop high quality software solutions using the latest technologies.

jobs.title: Enterprise Support Engineer
jobs.content:
More and more companies are using GitHub Enterprise, so the support team is growing. When our customers have problems, they contact us and it is our goal to help them as quickly and awesomely as possible. This person will join GitHub as part of our global support team and support our customers around the world. We're looking for Enterprise Support Engineers, in North America (US and Canada) to support our GitHub Enterprise product installed and managed in the customer's virtualization environment.

Your main responsibility will be to work with our customers to solve support tickets. Tickets are usually opened by internal system administrators, and can include investigating load or networking issues, debugging application errors, and discussing feature requests. You'll also work with our engineering team to prioritize issues and development, and our documentation team to improve customer-facing resources. You donât need to be a Git expert, but you do need to have technical experience and a passion for helping people.
The position reports to an Enterprise Support Manager and works closely with other teams and leaders across the company.

GitHub works remotely and asynchronously as much as possible. While this role does not require you to live near our office, it will require some travel to meet with co-workers or attend company events.

RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Solve complex customer support tickets often involving Linux servers, source code, and web application issues
  • Effectively communicate technical information to customers and engineering groups at GitHub
  • Work proactively with customers on activities such as coordinating upgrades, communicating upcoming features, and ensuring their installation is running smoothly
  • Identify bugs and improvements in the GitHub Enterprise codebase
  • Manage urgent customer outages during business hours
QUALIFICATIONS
  • Must have current legal working authorizaton
  • General understanding of how modern web applications work
  • Prior experience providing technical support
  • Excellent problem solving skills
  • Familiarity with some flavor of production-level virtual machine (e.g., VMware ESX, Xen, KVM)
  • Enthusiasm for working directly with customers
  • Stellar English and grammar skills
BONUS POINTS IF YOU HAVE
  • Worked closely with large complex customer accounts
  • Familiarity with Git and GitHub
  • Experience with phone support
  • Ability to look through and understand code (Ruby / Bash)
  • Previous experience as a System Administrator
  • Previous experience as a Linux System Administrator

To apply: Please apply here: https://jobs.lever.co/github/ebbe8356-3c43-4baa-8b97-a990efd224c4/apply

jobs.title: Software Architect, CMS Tools - Help build our next-gen CMS!
jobs.content:
The Multiplatform Engineering team, responsible for building and supporting Viacom's public facing, award winning mobile apps and Web sites around the world for leading brands in popular culture such as MTV, Nickelodeon, Comedy Central, and BET, is looking for smart, creative people to help grow our presence in non-linear distribution channels.


If you love to solve problems creatively, can work well in a team environment, are interested in building the best software, and want to always be learning, then we want to hear from you.


We are seeking a Software Architect to lead the development of our front end tool used by hundreds of producers around the world to manage content published to our award winning public facing Web sites and mobile apps. These producers use this tool on a daily basis as a large part of their regular workday so it needs to be fast, instantly usable, and a joy to use overall.


This position is onsite in NYC and reports to the Director, Web Front-end Engineering.


Responsibilities:



  • Lead a team of software engineers to build and support web applications for managing, scheduling and publishing our core content to Viacom's web sites and apps

  • Hands on development and design, contribute to the core codebase, and lead by example

  • Be the go-to technical resource for the product for the rest of the organization

  • Collaborate with the product owner and designers on roadmap definition delivering realistic timelines and adapting to change

  • Work with front-end engineers across the organization to continuously improve engineering practices and code quality

  • Encourage and apply principles of test driven development to ensure code quality and good design

  • Improve the speed and dependability of the build and release process working towards Continuous Deployment

  • Oversee effort to automate everything in the development process

  • Facilitate daily pull requests and code reviews with the team, working with them to uncover and implement improvements

  • Give the team room to stay current in knowledge of the latest developments in HTML, CSS, JS, AngularJS, and other front end technology

  • Implement and maintain a system for the collection and display of product metrics and funnel this feedback back to the business

  • Mentor and coach the development team, working with management to identify areas for improvement

jobs.title: Manager, Software Development - Identity and Access Management, Job ID 1029290
jobs.content:
About Pfizer
 A career at Pfizer offers opportunity, ownership and impact. All over the world, Pfizer colleagues work together to positively impact health for everyone, everywhere. Our colleagues have the opportunity to grow and develop a career that offers both individual and company success; be part of an ownership culture that values diversity and where all colleagues are energized and engaged; and the ability to impact the health and lives of millions of people. Pfizer, a global leader in the biopharmaceutical industry, is continuously seeking top talent who are inspired by our purpose to innovate to bring therapies to patients that significantly improve their lives.

Role Description
The Digital Credential Services Engineer is responsible for the development and management of service technologies for the Digital Credential Services (DCS) area. The DCS Engineer will work with the Delivery Manager and Service Lead on enhancements, continuous improvements, and guide the work activities of developers and other technical resources. The role responsibilities include requirements gathering and definition, technical design and specification, development, testing, and implementation support. The DCS Engineer will develop new solutions and maintain the existing technology to engineer world class global Digital Credential Services. This position is responsible for the end-to-end technical management of DCS solutions encompassing Multi-factor authentication and high-assurance credential management processes. The processes and services provided are audited regularly and are required to meet all corporate security policies. This is an Operations role with 24x7 global service support responsibilities along with continual monitoring of the service for quality levels, and response to outages or performance issues with a sense of urgency.

Responsibilities
•Develop and deploy solutions to ensure that Digital Credential services are performing according to specifications, meet defined procedures, and comply with applicable information security policies and requirements.
•Integrate applications and third-party products into internal services and support and upgrade implemented systems.
•Partner with internal teams to define and implement solutions that improve Pfizer processes and end user experiences.
•Collaborate with the Service Lead, Service Delivery Manager, and customers to translate business requirements into technical solutions.
•Maintain highest levels of development practices including technical design, solution development, systems configuration, test documentation/execution, issue identification and resolution, writing clean, modular and self-sustaining code.
•Develop and maintain service patterns used for application integration.
••Manage technical work activities of contingent worker resources to support enhancements and continuous improvements to services.
•Support 24x7 management and oversight of BAU operations.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
The Motus Technology team is looking for an experienced software engineer to join the team in the midst of some exciting expansion. The team is currently working on mobile web application projects, building new systems and supporting new lines of business all while improving the stability, security and efficiency of our production systems. Our web-based applications use Linux, PHP, Java, and PostgreSQL targeting desktop browsers, smartphones like the iPhone and Android, and other businesses through web services.


The ideal candidate for this role will be motivated and excited to take responsibility for large parts of our applications as well as be a strong mentor for the rest of the software development team. Someone who has been successful at building scalable, maintainable and extensible software on a Java stack is preferred.


What You'll Do:



  • Analyze – help gather requirements and work closely with our Product Analysts to define them.

  • Design – create a workable model from the requirements.

  • Build – You’ll be writing the most complex and crucial parts of the system.

  • Teach – Mentor and guide our junior team members.

  • Improve – We’re always looking for ways to do things better, so you’ll be encouraged to take on projects that do that.

jobs.title: E-Commerce Web Developer
jobs.content:
About the Position


SparkFun is looking for a Senior Web Developer to help lead the next phase of development on it’s E-Commerce platform. This will include critical design review of current implementation and architecture as well as building additional tools for internal and customer use. The developer will work closely with the marketing team to ensure the system is flexible and extensible as well as meeting the needs of our customers. The developer will focus on creating flexible, modular solutions designed around best practices.


The ideal candidate will need to be comfortable in PHP and modern JavaScript as well as working with relational databases such as Postgres. They should be comfortable redesigning major features, helping architect new functionality and leading small teams of developers. The developer will be comfortable building out and integrating 3rd party tools through REST APIs. They will be working with internal customers, helping to deliver production code through our development life cycle.


About the Department


SparkFun’s Software Development & Information Technology department is responsible for the continuous development of all SparkFun web properties. This includes the primary ecommerce website (sparkfun.com) and the primary educational resources website (learn.sparkfun.com). Also included is Sparkle, SparkFun’s custom-built ERP system which is used to manage all content on the aforementioned web properties as well as order processing, customer management, shipping, inventory controls, manufacturing, etc. SparkFun’s latest Open Source Software project is Phant. Phant powers data.sparkfun.com which is our open source solution to Internet of Things (IoT) data hosting.


Where possible (which is most everywhere) open source languages and tools are used and where possible code developed by SparkFun IT is given back to the community as open sourced libraries.


If you like the sound of these programs and want to help modify, update and create new open source software to help power the future of the exciting space, this team is your home.

jobs.title: UX Software Engineer
jobs.content:
As a member working in User Experience development team, the Sr. Software Engineer will be responsible for the research, development, and unit testing of industry leading web-based/mobile enterprise software systems. The focus of development will be towards building rich User Interfaces supporting a variety of browser types (and versions), on various platforms (PC, tablet, phone).
• Should be a good team player - willing to work as part of team as well as individual contributor
• Develop features across multiple subsystems within our applications, including collaboration in requirements definition, prototyping, design, coding, testing and deployment
• Understand how our applications operate, are structured/integrated/deployed, and how customers use them
• Proficiency in developing and troubleshooting complex software systems that run in mixed-environments including Linux, Unix and/or Windows
• Provide engineering support (when necessary) to our technical operations staff when they are building, deploying, configuring and supporting systems for customers
• Participate with the engineering and operations teams to define plans for standardizing, scaling and enhancing our products and the services utilized to deploy/install/release those products
• Participate in interactions with customers as a technical expert for product subsystems
• Investigate, analyze and make recommendations to management regarding technology improvements/trends, upgrades and modifications
• Other duties from time to time as determined by management
• Effectively communicate with all stakeholders

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
As a leader in enterprise application software and eProcurement, BuyerQuest helps companies of all sizes and industries innovate through simplification. We are currently seeking the best and brightest talent to join a dynamic and growing team and support our software development and client portfolio.



  • This is where YOU come in:

    • You have a solid understanding of Object Oriented principles and web application fundamentals

    • You solve problems with innovative solutions that meet business requirements with clean and well written code

    • You have experience with architecture design concepts and techniques and the ability to communicate and promote those concepts to a broad based team

    • You have the ability to triage technical issues, use your strong problem solving skills, and then drive resolution by engaging with cross functional teams

    • You have logic and priority based decision-making skills, and an understanding of where projects fit into the overall architecture strategy

    • You have excellent communication, negotiation and facilitation skills

    • You are a great team player who is able to interact effectively with people in all levels of a fun and focused organization

jobs.title: Dev Project Manager - Consulting Services
jobs.content:
Are you passionate about using technology to solve some of the toughest problems facing the largest companies and government agencies around the world?


Are you obsessive about the quality and consistency of the work you do, from the process you follow to the documents you write?


Do you value deploying applications into production with real world impact?


Do you prioritize project success over process adherence?


Are you a project leader who loves app dev?


Microsoft Services’ Modern Apps Solutions Centers (MASC) develop mission-critical solutions for enterprise customers. Operating from purpose-built studios located at Microsoft Offices, the MASC’s app dev wizards work hand-in-hand with customers to deliver solutions that delight users. 

The MASC Project Manager will be responsible for successful execution on one or more projects at a time, providing guidance, coaching, and project leadership. By mentoring and influencing, the Project Manager will drive the highest quality and the strongest sense of customer focus on each project. The Project Manager is responsible for keeping the development team working on the highest priority tasks each sprint, removing risks and impediments, and leading the communication with the end customer. Part Scrum master, part mentor, and part consultant, the Project Manager role requires an unusual mix of project management and consulting skills, along with a passion for technology. If that describes you, we’d love to have you join our team!


The MASC Project Manager’s primary responsibilities include:



  • Leading one or more dev teams at a time to successfully deliver on customer projects

  • Ensuring adherence to cost, schedule, and scope constraints by tracking consumption and forecasts

  • Advocating for Agile development processes, which can require translating Agile outputs into traditional PMI-style artifacts

  • Leading envisioning workshops to translate a customer vision into a product backlog

  • Providing actionable coaching feedback to team members to foster continuous improvement in the spirit of a growth mindset

  • Up to 50% travel to customer sites may be required

jobs.title: Full Stack Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Headquarters: Springfield, MA
URL: http://www.systemone.id

As a Software Engineer at SystemOne, you will build the services that power our web and mobile apps as well as our public API. You will also develop the React/React mobile front-ends that utilize our APIs. You will be a key member of the team, making technical decisions that will shape the company's future. We're looking for people who love to code as well as work with other developers to build meaningful products.

Day-to-day responsibilities include:
  • Building the next version of our API
  • Building intuitive, highly efficient and performant interfaces for the next version of our medical device application
  • Optimizing back-end services for performance and scale
  • Integrating with medical devices and software products around the world
  • Working alongside our Chief Product Engineer on core engineering challenges

We are looking for people with:
  • A product-first approach to building software. You care about the real world functionality of your programming.
  • 5+ years of professional software development experience building, deploying, and maintaining apps at scale
  • Experience with Node and Express
  • Experience with SQL and/or MongoDB
  • Experience with modern javascript tools/frameworks like react, webpack, and babel
  • Experience with REST and HTTP/HTTPS protocols
  • Deep understanding of user-interface and user-experience concepts and design
  • Deep experience with JavaScript
  • A passion for working as part of a team
  • Devops skills are a plus

Tech:
Front-End
  • Javascript ES6
  • React
  • Redux
  • Material UI

Back-End
  • Node.js
  • Express
  • MySQL

DevOps
  • AWS

To apply: Send an email to stefan@systemone.id

jobs.title: Ruby on Rails Full Stack Developer
jobs.content:
We are looking for an experienced Ruby on Rails Developer to join our little web team. This position will provide support in all phases of development for all GWP web and mobile products, which includes planning, implementation, conversion and maintenance of both current and future projects.


We'd like our new teammate to have solid experience with rapidly developing web applications, and the ability to deliver projects on time with high-quality results. Our programming is primarily Ruby on Rails. Some of the websites you would be working with include ApartmentShowcase.com and NewHomesGuide.com.

jobs.title: Software Engineering Manager
jobs.content:
Tenable Network Security, founded in 2002, delivers comprehensive security solutions that provide continuous visibility and critical context, enabling decisive actions to protect organizations.  Our products are relied upon by more than 20,000 organizations, including many of the world’s largest companies and governments -- we call this a start! 

Our global expansion is creating job opportunities for creative thinkers who are wired for action and delivering big results. We’re also stacked with industry rock stars that are just as comfortable keynoting a conference or delivering a podcast as they are mentoring up-and-coming colleagues. But what our employees are most excited about is our products. Transform security with Tenable, the creators of Nessus and pioneers of continuous monitoring.

Tenable now has over 600 employees globally and 24,000 customers in 150 countries. Tenable Network Security is recognized as one of the fastest growing security product companies by SC Magazine, Red Herring, Info Securities, Deloitte, E&Y and as a Best Places to Work by the Washington Post, Baltimore Sun, Baltimore Business Journal and Expert Marketplace.


Tenable is looking for a Software Engineering Manager to join the Passive Vulnerability Scanner (PVS) engineering team. The Passive Vulnerability Scanner is the only vulnerability scanning product that delivers continuous real-time network monitoring in a non-intrusive manner. As a Software Engineering Manager, you will manage a team of engineers working on several projects related to the PVS product.


Can you do this consistently?



  • Manage day-to-day activities of the PVS modules engineering team through the development, unit testing and maintenance phases.

  • Directly manage engineers and provide feedback and guidance to them.

  • Work within an Agile development environment and passionate about researching and designing network data acquisition techniques.

  • Maintain clear and effective communication within the PVS engineering team.

  • Provide and maintain accurate project schedules for the modules development team.

jobs.title: Lead Developer - Consulting Services
jobs.content:
Are you passionate about using technology to solve some of the toughest problems facing the largest companies and government agencies around the world?


Are you obsessive about the quality of the work you do, from the code you write to the process you follow?


Do you value deploying applications into production with real world impact?


Do you want to work on projects using the latest (including pre-release) Microsoft technologies, including Xamarin mobile development?


Are you a technical leader who loves to pay it forward by helping junior developers hone their craft?


Microsoft Services’ Modern Apps Solutions Centers (MASC) develop mission-critical solutions for enterprise customers. Operating from purpose-built studios located at Microsoft Offices, the MASC’s app dev wizards work hand-in-hand with customers to deliver solutions that delight users. 

The MASC Lead Developer will be responsible for design, development, and DevOps on one or more projects at a time, providing guidance, assistance, and technical leadership. By mentoring and leading by example, the Lead Developer will drive the highest technical quality and the strongest sense of customer focus on each project. The Lead Developer is responsible for assigning technical tasks to the team, often personally taking on the most challenging or risky tasks each sprint. Part Scrum master, part mentor, and part coding guru, the Lead Developer role requires an unusual mix of hardcore technical chops and people skills. If that describes you, we’d love to have you join our team!


The MASC Lead Developer’s primary responsibilities include: 



  • Writing code that solves customer problems in consulting engagements

  • Mentoring project teams across multiple projects 

  • Leading a testing strategy that prioritizes quality

  • Leading envisioning workshops to translate a customer vision into a product backlog

  • Identifying IP for reuse across projects 

  • Contributing to process improvements  

  • Providing actionable coaching feedback to team members to foster continuous improvement in the spirit of a growth mindset

  • Up to 50% travel to customer sites may be required

jobs.title: Software Test Engineer
jobs.content:
The Software Test Engineer will be responsible for software testing for our Wave Relay® products. This includes providing special analysis required for initial software testing, quality assurance, and regression testing. The Software Test Engineer will be responsible for ensuring that our products meet customer and management requirements, as well as Persistent Systems' quality standards.



POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES




  • Testing the software development and equipment for the Wave Relay® system

  • Development and implementation if a wide range of low-level software, hardware development, and testing of application software (including device drivers, Linux kernel modules, network stack development, and other low-level programming activities)

  • Supporting in-house and in-the-field engineering activities including travel to customer sites

  • Integrating other systems, senors, and components with the Wave Relay® system

  • Writing technical proposals

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer III
jobs.content:
DevOps Engineer III (Reg FT)

Community College of Allegheny County

General Summary:

Install, support and maintain server software and hardware and applications to assure integrity and reliability. Integrate applications and services with college operations in support of the ITS strategy and college mission and goals.

Work location and additional information:

This position will remain open until filled. However, in order to ensure consideration for an interview, please submit your completed application, cover letter and resume by no later than June 13, 2016. The College cannot guarantee that application materials received after this date will be considered or reviewed.

Campus: Office of College Services

Days and Hours (for hourly position):

Job Specifications:

Bachelor's degree in computer science or related field and a minimum of four years of experience. Experience in Windows Server 2008 or above and/or Linux CentOS 7 server deployment; Server virtualization (Hyper-V desired). Deployment and maintenance of Microsoft on-premise enterprise systems such as Active Directory, DNS, Exchange, SharePoint, Lync, System Center, SQL Server, MDT and IIS. Automation of system tasks using Microsoft.NET, PowerShell, Bash, Perl, and/or Python. Knowledge of TCP/IP and networking fundamentals. Hands-on knowledge and maintenance of server and storage technology, SANs, hardware and system components. Experience with ASP.NET web development, learning management and content management systems is desired. Microsoft Certified Professional, Security+, and/or Linux+ certifications preferred.

Job Duties:

1. Gathering requirements from stakeholders for the purposes of system implementation.
2. Develop Requests for Proposals (RFP) and work with Purchasing, team members, internal customers and vendors on the selection of hardware and software.
3. Install, maintain, and harden systems following industry best practice recommendations.
4. Diagnose, research, resolve and troubleshoot hardware and software problems.
5. Provide integration and automation through the use of scripts and software development languages.
6. Work collaboratively with internal and external customers to provide consultation on planning, implementation, interface and use of systems.
7. Participate in network security to protect the college's system and information resources.
8. Provides necessary documentation, training and guidance to network engineers and technical staff. Assists with documentation for end users.
9. Work in teams on highly visible and time sensitive projects.
10. Work outside normal working hours on downtime tasks such as patching, upgrading, and/or implementing new systems.
11. Provide timely, on-call assistance on emergency issues that arise outside normal working hours.
12. Travel to other campus locations for purposes of system implementation and maintenance.
13. Perform other duties as assigned.

Job Category: Administrator

Job Type: Full-time

Department: Information Technology Services

Job Open Date: 05-27-2016

Job Close Date:

All applicants must apply online at: http://apptrkr.com/836239. The College's online application system will allow you to complete a college application, apply online, answer screening questions, and attach a resume, cover letter and other documents.

jobs.title: Senior Embedded Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Persistent Systems is looking for an Embedded Software Engineer with extensive experience in a Linux environment. The position involves the development and implementation of a wide range of networking software. The ideal candidate has recent, demonstrated, hands-on development expertise with Linux. The position involves a significant level of autonomy in which a self-motivated applicant will work independently to develop solutions.



POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Developing and implementing a wide range of low-level embedded software (including device driver, Linux kernel modules, network stack development, porting existing software to new embedded platforms, and other low level programming activities), hardware development, as well as the development of application software running on the Wave Relay® network

  • Supporting in-house and in-the-field engineering activities including travel to customer sites

  • Traveling to test locations, military facilities, and customer sites to directly supporting the testing, evaluation, and deployment of the Wave Relay® system

  • Integrating other systems, sensors, and components with the Wave Relay® system

  • Writing technical proposals

jobs.title: Senior Network Engineer
jobs.content:
Senior Network Engineer (Reg FT)

Community College of Allegheny County

General Summary:

Works on a collaborative team to design, implement and operate secure, complex and large-scale local and wide area networks, internet and intranet services and data communications to ensure availability, reliability, serviceability, performance and responsiveness that meets the needs of a broad constituency.

Work location and additional information:

This position will remain open until filled. However, in order to ensure consideration for an interview, please submit your completed application, cover letter and resume by no later than June 13, 2016. The College cannot guarantee that application materials received after this date will be considered or reviewed.

Campus: Office of College Services

Days and Hours (for hourly position):

Job Specifications:

Bachelor's degree in computer science, information science or related field and a minimum of five years experience. Extensive experience in design and configuration of large, multi-site/campus networks and security technologies. Extensive working knowledge of Cisco IOS and HP Comware command line. Design and implementation of Quality of Service (QoS0) on LAN and metropolitan area optical networks. Experience with wireless technologies, carrier services, voice-over-IP, routing, switching, network cabling required. Deep understanding of core networking protocols (e.g., TLS, IPSEC, BGP, OSPF and 802.11a/b/g/n/ac), infrastructure monitoring and trending systems, data center facilities management. Solid understanding of OSI or TCP / IP model.

Physical Requirements: Must be able to move, lift, carry, and push multiple heavy objects each weighing up to 50 pounds within scope of job duties.

Job Duties:

1. Provides project leadership and technical direction to the implementation of network projects or upgrades.
2. Collaborates with campus leadership, stakeholders and end-users in the planning and implementation of network and wireless services.
3. Installs, maintains, and troubleshoot routers, switches, next-generation firewall (NGFW), Wireless Virtual Controllers, wireless AP's, Application Delivery Controller, network encryption/decryption, site-to-site and user-to-LAN VPN.
4. Installs and supports network hardware, micro-code upgrades, operating systems, applications and internet service.
5. Diagnoses and resolves network hardware and software problems associated with the College's information infrastructure.
6. Provides final-tier support for problem determination and resolution for networks and attached devices and services.
7. Participates in investigation, design and implementation of new technologies, automation, procedures and standards for the central management of the College's network, internet services and distribution software.
8. Provides day to day management and monitoring of network devices and servers.
9. Develops solutions for operational problems.
10. Participates in the development, monitoring and response for the information security program and maintains network security to protect the College's information resources; assists in maintaining disaster recovery/ business continuity processes.
11. Provides necessary documentation, training and guidance to network engineers and technical staff. Assists with documentation for end users.
12. Work in teams to collaborate on time sensitive projects.
13. Work outside normal working hours on downtime tasks such as patching, upgrading, and/or implementing new systems.
14. Provide timely, on-call assistance on emergency issues that arise outside normal working hours.
15. Travel to other campus locations for purposes of system implementation and maintenance.
16. Performs other duties as assigned.

Job Category: Administrator

Job Type: Full-time

Department: Information Technology Services

Job Open Date: 05-27-2016

Job Close Date:

All applicants must apply online at: http://apptrkr.com/836232. The College's online application system will allow you to complete a college application, apply online, answer screening questions, and attach a resume, cover letter and other documents.
