jobs.title: DevOps Engineer -- SF/DC/Chi
jobs.content:
Rally Health improves health and saves money with our friendly, easy-to-use products that help people improve their diet and fitness, shop for health benefits, and find the best doctor at the right price for their needs.


We do it at scale, with millions of reachable accounts and thousands of concurrent users, figures which are roughly doubling every year. The Operations team drives the systems that power this growth in a stable, secure, and performant way, and we are looking for YOU to join our team.


Our technology stack is modern and always changing, but we are thoughtful and deliberate about bringing new technologies. Currently most of our services are fat-JAR Scala deployments to Chef-configured Ubuntu's that end up directly on AWS or on Mesos, with lots of RabbitMQ traffic between them, backed by MongoDB, ElasticSearch, Postgres, and you should be comfortable in that sort of environment, using Python to automate everything you can. Or Ruby if you have to. Where we can, we make decisions based on data, and the ideal candidate would know how to use tools such as Librato and Splunk to get a global understanding of the system but also be able to get down and dirty in the shell on individual machines. On-call rotation is part of the role, as you might expect, but we work hard to make that not suck.


Since we manage health-care data, we must comply with HIPAA and related laws, and good decision-making and data-defensive thinking are critical for our team members. We are especially interested in candidates who have DBA experience with a relational or NoSQL database and/or who have worked in a HITRUST-guided or regulated environment.


Our culture is important to us and we cultivate it carefully. We do not strive for heroism and while we recognize and reward individual accomplishments, we know that ultimately, teams win. Most of our projects are paired work and several of our team members are embedded in development teams. I almost wrote this whole job posting without saying DevOps. Oh well! Yeah, we do that too, whatever it is. 


In addition to a typical startup benefit package, we offer free health care for individuals (families prorated and highly discounted), catered lunches every day  and snacks, unlimited PTO, and competitive compensation including stock options. We are a nationally distributed team and welcome applications to our Washington, D.C., Chicago, and San Francisco locations.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer
jobs.content:
What We’re Looking For
A passionate full stack senior software engineer to take part in the ruckus going on at Spartan. We want an engineer who is an excellent communicator and team player, who understands users, who can think differently and solve problems creatively. We’re after someone who values bettering themselves and their team, is passionate about continually learning new technologies, and who cares deeply about the quality of code they write.


Spartan engineers are confident, multi-talented, accomplished at architecting complex applications, writing clean code, continually refactoring, using modern methodologies and good engineering practices like continuous integration and deployment. They will also actively participate in collaborative teams that embody mutual respect and that share in both the successes and failures of the project as a team. 


We Fully Embrace Working Remotely
We offer a remote-friendly work environment if relocating isn’t appealing to you. We believe a great team shouldn’t be restricted by geography.


Technologies We Are Currently Using
While this is what we’re currently using on our production systems, we’re always exploring new technologies to add to our toolbox so we can pick the best tool for a given job. 



  • Ruby / Ruby On Rails

  • Elixir / Phoenix

  • JavaScript / React / Redux / React Native

  • SASS / SCSS / Bourbon / Bitters / Neat

  • Webpack

  • Java / Android

  • Swift / iOS

  • Postgres / MySQL / Key-Value Stores

  • Heroku / AWS / CircleCI / Loggly

  • InfluxDB / Grafana

  • RSpec / Mocha / Cucumber

  • Git / Github

  • Lots of Linting


About Spartan
Spartan is located in Chattanooga, TN—recently featured in Inc. Magazine as a technology magnet, due in part to our city wide gigabit fiber network. You read right, we have super fast, super cheap internets. Chattanooga is also an outdoor mecca surrounded by mountains and bisected by the Tennessee River. Add to the list a ton of local restaurants, microbreweries, coffee houses, music venues, low cost of living and a walkable metro area with beautiful views and you have a fantastic quality of life.


Are you ready to work with a talented team of passionate designers and engineers in an up-and-coming, self-governed company located in the middle of a perfect city? Let’s make awesome together. 


Full time team members at Spartan Systems have access to the following benefits:



  1. Health/Dental/Vision

  2. Life Insurance

  3. Unlimited Personal Days

  4. Company funded continuing education resources


How To Apply


This is a full time employment opportunity for a single individual. We’re not looking for contractors, part-time individuals, or agencies of any kind. Applicants must be located in the contiguous United States. Thanks!


To apply, please fill out our application here:


https://spartanhr.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=2

jobs.title: Senior Front End Engineer
jobs.content: Like all Engineering roles at Hover, this is a cross-functional role at its core: you will work in coordination with our other engineering teams (backend, graphics, automation, devops) and non-engineering teams (product, design) to build and ship the highest quality products possible. You will be a member in the small but growing front-end engineering team, and you will stay at the cutting edge of your discipline through communication, collaboration, and friendly competition. Nearly everything you build and ship will be critical to the business (much of it customer-facing), so you will be constantly finding just the right balance to ship as quickly as possible while maintaining the highest standards of quality. You'll be surrounded by driven, exceptional teammates that will be sure to make it fun along the way.

We are building world-class applications that drive the technical design of Runzheimer’s mobile offerings.  This team is very passionate about designing and deploying products that leverage the power of iOS and Android devices that will shape the future for our customer’s business travel.




INNOVATION


If you are passionate about awesome apps that users love and you enjoy creating unconventional solutions to the most challenging business requirements then you will want to work for Runzheimer, a leader in the workforce mobility space.  We constantly push the boundaries of what is possible in this fast-paced industry that is evolving daily. We want you if you know the modern mobile development techniques and are constantly pushing the envelope.

OUR GIG


Work directly with the Manager of Product Development, talented Sr. Application Developers, and the leadership team to design, implement and deploy mobile apps for iOS and Android. Participate in feature design, working with product, UX and business experts. Build out features that make the mobile experience something you want to show off to your friends and family. HOW WE LIKE TO WORK



  • Collaborative, super-productive teams

We do our best to acknowledge our employees by providing opportunities in an organization that values work / life balance, extraordinary wellness programs, top-notch health benefits and great on-site amenities. Below are just a few of our unique benefits:

jobs.title: Backend Engineer/Architect
jobs.content:
The Primer team started as a growth consulting company working with clients to fuel exponential growth. They found that every single app needed to overhaul the first time user experience. However, each iteration took 2-6 months to launch. For apps, that’s an eternity. The Primer team saw a massive problem that needed to be solved.

With Primer, gone are the days of having to design, engineer, QA, and submit a new release to improve your native app’s first user experience. Primer’s visual editor is the only way a single team member can come up with an idea, design it and deploy it in less than 30 minutes.

Primer enables apps to welcome users with native screens containing content that matches why users are trying the app. Invite referrals are welcomed by their friends, Facebook ad installs are shown the item they installed to buy and all users get a great first impression.

In this position, you report directly to our CTO and work closely with every team at Primer. You'll be responsible for the growth and engineering of our backend systems which are primarily in Rails.




CHALLENGES




    • Develop the systems to allow us to provide real-time analytics for our customers

    • Ensure our systems stay reliable and secure with significant increases in traffic

    • Make our API endpoints faster for our SDKs and client-side dashboard

    • Establish processes that allow systems to gracefully degrade when infrastructure becomes temporarily unavailable

    • Build out our socket servers to provide real-time updates to mobile applications from the dashboard







SKILLS




    • 3+ years experience in commercial, enterprise-level development environment

    • Architect-level backend skills:  building reliable, secure, fault-tolerant, and highly-scalable systems

    • Able to clearly articulate desired outcomes and motivate engineers to develop simple solutions to complex problems

    • Excellent communication skills and can demonstrate having collaborated with product managers, designers, other engineers and other disciplines to deliver multiple projects in a timely manner







PERKS




    • Great SF location in the heart of SOMA - close to public transportation (Bart/Muni/Ferries) - restaurants/nightlife

    • Competitive salaries with early-stage stock options

    • 100% Health, Dental and Vision premiums paid for the employees and DEPENDENTS!

    • Flexible work schedule which includes life/work balance

    • Pick your own equipment including a pair of Bose headphonesFree lunches with the team

    • Friendly dogs are allowed in the office

    • Public transit reimbursement







PRESS




    • http://blog.goprimer.com

    • https://eng.goprimer.com/

    • http://firstround.com/review/this-is-how-you-design-your-app-for-maximum-growth/

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer - DevOps
jobs.content:
As our Software Engineer in DevOps you will work as a member of the technology team to create, manage, and monitor our application infrastructure, release pipeline, and continuous deployments that enable nonprofits world-wide to execute on their mission. You will work with other engineering and operations team members to develop, maintain, and optimize multiple levels of infrastructure, lead conversations around application implementation, and help make engineering pipedreams possible. In this role you will help build an agile operations model to support Blackbaud’s entire product line while maintaining the high level of reliable services our clients need. This is a highly visible and challenging opportunity that will bring you to the next step in your career.


Responsibilities:

  • Ensure application performance in production to scale, provide infrastructure and architecture guidance to engineering teams, and trending monitoring to find and address issues before clients even know they exist.

  • Developing self-service reporting and automation tools for various teams to leverage

  • Ability to setup MySQL, PostgresQL MS SQL Server database, troubleshoot DB issues and improve DB performance

jobs.title: Help Good Take Over as a Software Engineer with Blackbaud
jobs.content:
So you’re a happy, dedicated engineer, but what if you could be even happier? Imagine if your dedication helped ensure that non-profit organizations were able to continuously deliver their vital services to the groups they serve.


What You’ll Do:


As a Software Engineer, you’ll play a key role in building and testing new features for emerging products. You’ll work as a member of the technology team to collaborate with UX and product management to define new features, as well as our support team to troubleshoot bug fixes and build tools that improve the internal developer experience.


The Job:


We practice continuous delivery and work in a consistent (but not fanatical) agile environment. We believe that teams should have ownership of their solutions from inception to delivery, and have built a dev-ops culture around that belief.


We’re not too worried about experience with a specific stack – instead, we value curiosity, creativity, and experience shipping a real product using contemporary technologies. Our ideal engineer is pedantic about details but pragmatic about decision-making; self-directed in their work but collaborative in nature; opinionated about contemporary software development practices but open-minded to contrasting views.


About us:


Our People


Our employees are passionate about doing good and helping others with their own philanthropic missions. They love the arts, culture, wildlife, feeding the hungry and helping to save lives. Philanthropy is in our DNA. If you support a non-profit, chances are you’ll find someone here who supports that mission too. In other words, you’ll find a friend here (and we hope you bring your friends too).


Our Place


Blackbaud’s Charleston headquarters, located on Daniel Island, provides an environment that helps our employees achieve balance, with opportunities to step away from the office for a little personal time. Parks, a fishing dock and miles of trails surround the office. Onsite amenities include a full-service café, a complete gym facility and access to recreational space for gaming or social gatherings.


Other Things You Might Care About


We offer a competitive salary, four weeks of PTO (plus more if you volunteer with a non-profit), Medical, Dental, Vision, 401k, flex spending or health savings accounts, tuition reimbursement, and community involvement.


Curious?


Come in and check it out. Worst-case scenario: you learn a little more about us, we learn a little more about you, and you keep us in mind for the future. Best case, you get to help empower organizations that are actively making the world a better place.

jobs.title: Lead Java/PaaS Engineer
jobs.content:

Honeywell Enterprise IT Services is an internal professional services organization delivering business results through technology, processes, people, and relationships. Our group has oversight over the Enterprise IT infrastructure for Honeywell worldwide and is actively building out our Cloud computing capabilities. 



Design and implement the cloud computing solution for Pivotal Cloud Foundry, aligned to Honeywell requirements and IT Strategies, including platform (PaaS) capabilities leveraging standard cloud platforms, both internally and externally.



Develop supportable controls to address all aspects of cloud computing such as service segmentation (Dev/Test/Prod), service tiers, monitoring and alerting, business continuity, capacity planning, cost recovery models, network and storage optimization.



Coordinate and/or complete the development of all necessary documentation associated with the Pivotal platform, including resiliency, disaster recovery, and, as applicable, other service support documentation.



YOU MUST HAVE




  • Bachelors’ Degree in Engineering, Technology, Business or related discipline

  • Minimum 8 years Java/J2EE development experience

  • Minimum 2 years experience of IP networking setup and administration including firewalls and load balancers.

jobs.title: Sr. Account Executive, E-Commerce Platform Provider Business Development
jobs.content:
About Amazon

Amazon.com opened on the World Wide Web in July 1995. The company is guided by four principles: customer obsession rather than competitor focus, passion for invention, commitment to operational excellence, and long-term thinking. Customer reviews, 1-Click shopping, personalized recommendations, Prime, Fulfillment by Amazon, AWS, Kindle Direct Publishing, Kindle, Fire phone, Fire tablets, and Fire TV are some of the products and services pioneered by Amazon.



About Amazon Payments

Amazon Payments provides consumers and merchants the simple and trusted way to pay and get paid online through multiple access channels. Amazon Payments allows more than 250 Million Amazon buyers to login, pay and get items shipped to their preferred destinations on a merchant’s website securely using their payment and address information that is stored on Amazon.com. Login and Pay with Amazon is a service that makes it easy for millions of buyers, who have established a relationship and stored their shopping details with Amazon, connect and transact with merchants, on external merchant sites and applications. Login and Pay with Amazon helps merchants quickly turn visitors into high-value customers, lower acquisition costs, improve conversion rates, and rapidly boost sales revenue. Login and Pay with Amazon is now offered in countries in North America, Europe, and Asia, and continues to grow.



Our goal is to become the method that every customer chooses to pay a merchant, worldwide. Amazon is bringing together its unrivaled customer data, world-class personalization technologies and unique positioning within the ecommerce value chain to enable other retailers, partners and enablers to create a unique commerce and purchase experience that benefits buyers and merchants globally. With a relentless obsession for our customers - both merchants and buyers - we are growing rapidly and offer a unique opportunity to join a small, high-visibility organization that has the potential to contribute to a sizeable part of Amazon’s overall growth.



Amazon Payments Sales & Business Development

The Amazon Payments Sales & Business Development team is responsible for engaging and developing strategic partnerships with E-Commerce Platform Providers that enable merchants to sell their products through online and mobile channels. The team is responsible for accelerating growth, expanding the adoption and usage of Login and Pay with Amazon across multiple platform providers. The Account Representative will play a key role in shaping the future of the Amazon Payments E-Commerce Platform Provider partnership program.



Job Description

Amazon Payments is seeking an experienced, business development professional who will be lead and develop Amazon Payments’ E-commerce Platform Provider new partnership efforts. The Account Representative will be identify and execute partnership deals with E-commerce Platform Provider’s platform and grow their business with Amazon Payments. The E-commerce Platform Providers represent Amazon Payments’ most valuable partners, and their capability requirements and contribution to the evolution of Amazon Payments is critical. The individual will work across Amazon to utilize other products and services to create new and powerful value propositions for these E-commerce Platform Providers.



Roles & Responsibilities

Leadership:

· Be responsible for building strategic relationships with the E-commerce Platform Providers at the most strategic level within the account and develop a broad strategy for building the business.

· Become a thought leader in defining success criteria and understand business needs of the E-commerce Platform Providers and their merchants in an ever-changing business environment.

· Partner with internal teams and other Amazon services teams to align programs and initiatives to drive growth. Partner closely with internal and external cross-functional teams to guide the direction of our product offerings.

· Prepare and conduct business reviews with the senior management team regarding progress and roadblocks to closing new customers



Planning/Analysis/Execution

· Evaluate the E-commerce Platform Provider landscape and identify potential strategic partnership opportunities. Develop a framework for prioritizing partner engagement based on various evaluate criteria and business levers

· Work with Platform Provider to develop a compelling partnership that helps drive Amazon Payments adoption among their merchant base, define opportunities and input and output goals for each E-commerce Platform Provider and coordinate with the extended team to deliver results for every merchant account utilizing the E-commerce Platform Provider

· Manage complex contract negotiations

· Work closely with account management team and assist the team to develop account plans for E-commerce Platform Providers to increase merchants adoption of Amazon Payments

· Conduct deep dive analysis on issues affecting the E-commerce Platform Provider and their merchant’s business performance and establish a periodic business review with the merchant that addresses key business issues



Communication & Reporting:

· Lead the development, updating and delivery of key E-commerce Platform Provider business development plans to a senior management audience.

· Achieve immediate resolution of high priority issues through stakeholder teams and appropriate escalation

· Drive content for internal business communications highlighting various initiatives, successes, and platform improvement opportunities through voice of the merchant.

· Successfully prioritize the needs of E-commerce Platform Provider and their merchants in a manner that balances merchant’s needs and internal priorities.

· 8 - 10 years of experience in sales/business development, ecommerce, payments and retail experience indirectly leading operational and project teams

· Bachelor's degree

· Positive attitude and willingness to roll up sleeves and dig deep to achieve goals

· Proven track-record creating successful multi-million dollar deals and in executing B2B sales contracts

· Analytical approach to problem solving and a track record of driving results through continuous improvement

· Excellent cross-group collaboration skills, ability to impact and influence outcomes in matrixed environment

· Demonstrated ability to negotiate high-value deals with a C-level audience and positively influence the outcome

· Ability to think and react in a high-energy, fast-paced environment

· Demonstrated track history of working with nascent products/services in new markets

· Excellent written and verbal communication skills

· Program management experience with good organizational skills including prioritizing, scheduling, time management, and meeting deadlines

· Strong problem-solving and service orientation



· M.B.A. is preferred

· 12+ years of work experience

· Success managing strategic clients or accounts and dynamic account portfolios

· Problem-solving passion and service orientation

· Effective in dealing with C-suite of large merchants

· History of effectively managing external customers and successfully working with internal teams to build new capability and implement projects

· Show independence and flexibility in dealing with multiple complex issues

· Demonstrated strategic thinking and team leadership

· Ability to execute on programs and projects with minimal resources

· Proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously

· Composed, poised and professional demeanor in all situations

· Tenacity to keep issues top of mind of relevant stakeholders and conviction to make the right decisions

· Being vocally self-critical

· Strong problem-solving and service orientation



Amazon is an equal opportunity employer

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer - Analytics
jobs.content:
This position is with the analytics team at Sonian, the premier cloud-enabled content collection, archiving and data insights provider. We make software that helps businesses archive, organize, preserve, search, discover and analyze their most important files and messages. Our suite of services lets us do that on public cloud platforms like AWS, Softlayer and Azure in ways that are scalable, durable and efficient. We are focused on helping our customer derive meaning and insights from data we are helping them to protect.



  • Design and implement analytics on communications and files (e.g. email, IM, etc.) to help customers understand trending topics around collaboration and security, to name a couple.

  • Architect and implement distributed and concurrent systems at scale.

  • Adapt analytics to understand new types of unstructured content (e.g. business social activity streams, files, etc.) and SaaS repositories (e.g. Salesforce, ERP, etc.).

  • Build redundant, high-availability systems with failover mechanisms.

  • Explore new open source or commercial analyzers to plug into the application.

  • Work on cutting edge UI/UX and data visualizations (D3.JS or HighCharts) to create award-winning user interfaces.

  • Help design and develop the platform and its component services, using languages/technologies like Elasticsearch, React, Clojure and other related functional development targeting a JVM ecosystem.

  • Work closely with other passionate developers deeply steeped in cloud and microservices(Docker) technologies.

  • Be on a team that values code quality, good communication, sound testing practices and diverse opportunities for mentoring.

jobs.title: Software Development Manager - Global eCommerce Firm
jobs.content:
Our Client is a parent-centric retail technology company. They deliver delightful experiences, products, and expertise by offering a curated selection of products, lightning-fast delivery, incredible customer service, and an easy-to-navigate shopping experience.



Their sites are host to millions of daily visitors and our warehouses are run by hundreds of autonomous Kiva robots. Their entire operation from our websites/apps, to our fulfillment centers and customer care center is focused on creating an enjoyable end-to-end customer experience. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright and driven people who are energized by "what if." If you'd like to help us build the place where people can find and buy anything online, come and innovate with us!

We are seeking a Software Development Manager to lead technical direction and develop solutions to advance the goals of the business. You'll have technical ownership of a functional area and manage a team of talented engineers. This is truly unique career opportunity for a technology leader who likes to invent as well as dive deep. The ideal hire is a hands-on team leader who has previous experience overseeing a broad range of platform integrations, improvements and some customer-facing features. Their SDMs operate at all levels of the technology stack, supporting a broad set of clients and collaborating with a wide range of internal and external service providers.

Key Responsibilities:



  • Guide development teams and be responsible for overall systems development life cycle

  • Translate functional and technical requirements into detailed project plans and schedules

  • Manage the day-to-day activities of the engineering team by defining, implementing and maintaining a coherent, progressive development strategy for our product line

  • Manage process and quality of service improvements, planning, project management of software deliverables within the team, and management of resources across teams

  • Maintain current technical knowledge to support rapidly changing technology

  • Possess architectural depth to steer teams toward highly performing systems

  • Communicate effectively with your team and with stakeholders at all levels of the company

  • Create and execute appropriate quality plans, project plans, test strategies and processes for development activities in concert with business and project management effort

  • Build an effective development organization by driving the recruiting and hiring of senior level engineers, developing and managing the group, and conducting performance reviews of team members

  • Delivery of quality applications on-time and on-budget


Qualifications:



  • BS in Computer Science or related discipline

  • 5+ years of software development experience in Java or C++ and object oriented design

  • Minimum of 3 years leading, mentoring, and developing a team of technical talent


Preferred Qualifications:



  • Results oriented person with a delivery focus and demonstrated ability of achieving stretch goals in a highly innovative and fast paced environment

  • Demonstrated ability to make data-driven decisions and manage complex initiatives from conception to launch

  • Experience building and operating highly available, highly scalable, high-volume systems

  • Working experience with UNIX/Linux and service oriented architectures

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills

  • Ability to work well with people and be both highly motivated and motivating

  • Strong analytical skills with excellent problem solving abilities

jobs.title: Account Executive, Amazon Payments, North America
jobs.content:
About Amazon

Amazon.com opened on the World Wide Web in July 1995. The company is guided by four principles: customer obsession rather than competitor focus, passion for invention, commitment to operational excellence, and long-term thinking. Customer reviews, 1-Click shopping, personalized recommendations, Prime, Fulfillment by Amazon, AWS, Kindle Direct Publishing, Kindle, Fire phone, Fire tablets, and Fire TV are some of the products and services pioneered by Amazon.



About Amazon Payments

Amazon Payments provides consumers and merchants the simple and trusted way to pay and get paid online through multiple access channels. Amazon Payments allows more than 250 Million Amazon buyers to login, pay and get items shipped to their preferred destinations on a merchant’s website securely using their payment and address information that is stored on Amazon.com. Login and Pay with Amazon is a service that makes it easy for millions of buyers, who have established a relationship and stored their shopping details with Amazon, connect and transact with merchants, on external merchant sites and applications. Login and Pay with Amazon helps merchants quickly turn visitors into high-value customers, lower acquisition costs, improve conversion rates, and rapidly boost sales revenue. Login and Pay with Amazon is now offered in countries in North America, Europe, and Asia, and continues to grow.



Our goal is to become the method that every customer chooses to pay a merchant, worldwide. Amazon is bringing together its unrivaled customer data, world-class personalization technologies and unique positioning within the ecommerce value chain to enable other retailers, partners and enablers to create a unique commerce and purchase experience that benefits buyers and merchants globally. With a relentless obsession for our customers - both merchants and buyers - we are growing rapidly and offer a unique opportunity to join a small, high-visibility organization that has the potential to contribute to a sizeable part of Amazon’s overall growth.



Amazon Payments Direct Sales

The Amazon Payments Direct Sales team is responsible for engaging directly with merchants who sell their products through online and mobile channels. The Direct Sales team is responsible for accelerating sales growth, expanding the adoption and usage of Login and Pay with Amazon across merchants of all sizes. This team uses established sales techniques and innovative ways to identify new merchant opportunities for the launch of Login and Pay with Amazon and deliver increased conversion on the merchant’s website. The team is focused on creating success for some of the top-tier and well known merchants and brands as well as the small and medium merchants in the US across multiple industry categories using Amazon Payments. The Account Representative will play a key role in shaping the future of the Amazon Payments Direct Sales program. The Direct Sales team is responsible for forecasting and delivering established sales targets and is measured on established input and output goals.



Job Description

Amazon Payments is seeking an experienced sales representative who can identify and engage with small and medium merchants in different categories across multiple industry verticals to adopt and launch Login and Pay with Amazon in North America. This individual will be responsible for communicating the merchant value proposition, understanding the merchant’s platform capabilities, determining the best possible onboarding option, negotiating and finalizing sales contracts and launching programs with merchants to achieve Amazon Payments’ sales objectives.



The Account Representative will focus on the adoption of Login and Pay with Amazon by small and medium size merchants and increasing the payment transaction volume processed by Amazon Payments. These small and medium merchants represent the majority of the merchants in each vertical and their participation and contribution is critical to the growth and evolution of Amazon Payments. The Account Representative will play a key role in the coordination of teams to ensure that the merchant has a superior experience throughout the sales engagement and onboarding process. The Account Representative will also represent the new merchants’ needs and experience back to internal stakeholders.

Roles & Responsibilities

Leadership:

· Be a thought leader in defining success criteria and understand business needs of small and medium merchants in a dynamic business environment.

· Engage the appropriate stakeholders in the merchant organization and build a relationship for future growth

· Work with internal and external cross-functional teams that include representation from Marketing, Product, Operations and Technology to deliver feasible Amazon Payment solutions for merchants.

· Partner closely with internal and external cross-functional teams to guide the direction of our product offerings.

Planning/Analysis/Execution:

· Execute the Login and Pay with Amazon sales plan for small and medium merchants across multiple verticals.

· Execute sales strategies based on various e-commerce platforms utilized by merchants.

· Develop and execute a comprehensive plan for assigned sales territory and increase revenue and market share in a defined territory.

· Develop a target list for addressable categories and maintain a robust sales pipeline with a goal of meeting or exceeding weekly/monthly/quarterly revenue targets.

· Identify sales opportunities and close sales deals for Login and Pay with Amazon through a strong understanding of the merchant's business including payments.

· Understand reasons for closed and lost sales opportunities and present feedback to the sales management to improve success rate.

· Lead the development of proposals by working with various internal stakeholders such as Product, Finance and Legal and negotiate contractual relationships with merchants.

· Continuously review merchant and market landscape and recommend, develop and implement new and creative approaches that ensures that the merchant’s business objectives are met through use of Login and Pay as well as grow the Amazon business.

· Actively participate and lead various ad-hoc internal projects as assigned

· Support the Sales Partnerships and Innovation executive team in developing the overall group strategy

· Help develop the North America Payment Sales group strategy, focus areas and growth opportunities.



Customer Management:

· Foster in-depth and productive relationships at all levels with the merchant organization with equivalent stakeholders within Amazon.

· Manage price and contract negotiations and technology implementations

· Manage onboarding of merchant on supported solution provider platform or custom integration.



Communication & Reporting:

· Report sales performance and customer satisfaction targets.

· Report to and interact with senior management and executives on a periodic basis to provide the status of the sales engagement.

· Provide business reviews to the senior management team regarding progress and roadblocks to closing new customers

· Drive content for internal business communications highlighting various initiatives, successes, and platform improvement opportunities through voice of the merchant.

· Systematically communicate business performance to the merchant and review portfolio performance with Amazon senior management teams regarding progress, opportunities and issues

Be accountable for driving, measuring, and reporting on key inputs and outputs in Salesforce.com and other reporting systems.

3 - 4 years of experience in sales in the payments, financial services, e-commerce, mobile, software, hardware or technology industry.

· Bachelor's degree

· Committed work ethic, positive attitude and willingness to roll up sleeves and take ownership of multiple tasks to achieve goals

· Demonstrated negotiating skills and influencing abilities

· Proven track record creating large value deals and executing B2B sales contracts

· Analytical approach to problem solving and a track record of driving results through continuous improvement

· Program management experience with good organizational skills including prioritizing, scheduling, time management, and meeting deadlines

· Ability to think and react in a high-energy, fast-paced environment

· Experience working with nascent products/services in new markets

· Excellent written and verbal communication skills

· Team oriented, collaborative, diplomatic and flexible.

Provide high-level of detail in every action

 



·M.B.A. is preferred

· 8+ years of work experience

· Demonstrated track record of sales deal execution and launches with merchants whose revenues are greater than $10 Million.

· Demonstrated track record of planning, managing and closing a complex, competitive sales effort and managing deals from negotiation, to closing and through delivery.

· Product management experience is a plus.

· Success managing dynamic account portfolios

· Excellent cross-group collaboration skills, ability to impact and influence outcomes in matrixed environment

· Problem-solving passion and service orientation

· Effective in dealing with C-suite of small and medium-size merchants

· Show independence and flexibility in dealing with multiple complex issues

.Proven ability to partner, communicate and manage/navigate through multiple disciplines and organizational groups

· Ability to work within a complex, matrixed and often ambiguous environment, and to influence senior management and other relevant parties.

· Accomplished range of skill from high-level strategic thinking to creative and detailed team leadership

· Ability to execute on programs and projects with minimal resources

· Proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously

· Composed, poised and professional demeanor in all situations

· Tenacity to keep issues top of mind of relevant stakeholders and conviction to make the right decisions

· Being vocally self-critical

· Strong problem-solving and service orientation



Amazon is an equal opportunity employer

jobs.title: Android Developer, SI Play
jobs.content:
Job Category:


Android Developer, SI Play


Overview:


Sports Illustrated Play is a Sports Technology company that has a simple yet ambitious goal: to serve the vast market of amateur and youth sports leveraging innovative technology and the Sports Illustrated Brand. This is where every major athlete starts their career, and two out of three players say it’s the most important thing they do.


As a stand-alone subsidiary of Time Inc., one of the country’s largest and most iconic media companies, Sports Illustrated Play is a rare blend of being a fast-paced, entrepreneurial venture with the support and reach of its affiliation with a major company.


What’s in it for you:


As a part of this team, you will be building a new digital platform for one of the world's most recognized sports brands, Sports Illustrated. What you build will be used by hundreds of millions of people every day, making real impact on their lives. This is what we as a team have signed up for. This is why we are here!


What you will be doing:


* Design and develop native, consumer facing applications operating on the Android platform as part of a team


* Collaborate with product and design teams to create best of breed applications


* Use best practices to deliver high quality code (document code, unit tests, performance tests, security of data)


* Work in an iterative manner to produce results quickly and keep a feedback loop going with the product team


What you need to be considered for this position:


* Strong software development background


* 2+ Years experience developing native Android applications


* Proven experience integrating front end application with back end data


* Ability to take a design / mockup and turn it into a functioning module


* Strong Java programming skills


* Experience with web services - REST, JSON, XML


* Understanding of asynchronous programming models


* Understanding of various Android SDK and APIs available as well as differences between Android versions


* Strong communication skills to effectively work in team environment


* One or more applications available in the Google Play marketplace that show work candidate has done - code samples desirable


Big pluses:


* Work on products that will make a real difference


* Product you are building will be used by friends, family, and neighbors


* A chance to innovate and solve some of the most fundamental coding and computer science problems that come with real time large scale systems


* Working with a fast-paced development team that is focused on pushing through hurdles and getting our code into the hands of users


Perks:


* Flexibility in pretty much everything


* Competitive compensation package


* Small company mentality but a large company’s benefits plan


* Great people, great products, great brand, great place to work

jobs.title: Wordpress PHP Developer
jobs.content:
Job Category:


Technology/Engineering


.


We are seeking a high energy, self driven WordPress PHP Developer to come join one of the fastest growing sports, entertainment, and lifestyle networks on the Internet.


.


FanSided started back in April of 2007. Years later FanSided garnered the attention of media giant Time Inc, and in 2015 FanSided became one of the prestigious Time Inc brands. Time Inc. is one of the largest branded media companies in the world. The company reaches more than 130 million people globally each month across multiple platforms, with influential brands like Time, People, Sports Illustrated, InStyle, Real Simple, Travel + Leisure, Food & Wine, and Wallpaper. Time Inc. is home to celebrated events and franchises including the Fortune 500, Time 100, People's Most Beautiful, Sports Illustrated's Sportsman of the Year, Essence Festival in New Orleans and the Food & Wine Classic in Aspen.


.


The FanSided team manages websites, the FanSided API, iOS apps, Android apps, customizable daily email newsletters, and integrations between brands and third party tools. If you like sports, movies, TV shows, video games, or superheroes … we have something you are interested in!


.


In this role you will:



  • Design, implement, and maintain high-volume sports products using multiple languages including but not limited to: PHP, JS, SQL, CSS3, HTML5

  • Report to the VP of Technology, who will be your managing team member. At FanSided you work with us, not for us.

  • You will work on PHP WordPress themes and plugins, MVC Frameworks (FanSided API), mobile apps, daily dynamic email newsletters and more!

  • Develop using the newest technologies and methodologies including SASS, Vagrant, Docker, Grunt, No-SQL, and more. Creative solutions that scale will be considered, regardless of the technology used for implementation.

  • Working in a lean, fast-paced, creative environment that reaches millions of website visitors!

  • Able to work remotely, on a flexible but agreed upon schedule, with the intent of coming to the office in North Scottsdale when it becomes available.

  • Work in a team, using tools and training provided to you to communicate and organize your tasks, projects, and code.

  • Use collaborative tools like GIT, Github.com, Asana, Slack, and Google Apps email.

  • Use technical tools like terminals, ssh tunnels, RSA keys, 2-factor authentication, 3rd party API integrations, IDEs, and New Relic.

jobs.title: Solutions Architect
jobs.content:
Are you passionate about technology and constantly seeking innovative ways to solve problems? 3Pillar Global is searching for a Solutions Architect with a broad background in building dynamic web properties and applications. 3Pillar Global provides clients like PBS, Carfax, and many others with services that span the entire software product life cycle, from product strategy to product development and product support.


3Pillar Global has a strong history and great strength in building globally distributed teams. Our approach to agile product development is specialized to enable efficient collaboration between 3Pillar and customer staff and between onshore and offshore team members.  Our highly skilled team in the US is key to making this happen.


3Pillar is searching for an experienced Soutions Architect to join our growing US Engineering staff.  This person will be a key member of our global team, working directly with our US clients and offshore team members on mission critical engagements.  Key to this role are the abilities to quickly understand our clients’ needs and bring to bear deep experience with building software to help define the best solution. Our team works with our clients and with each other using a strongly collaborative approach to make sure that we get to success as a team.

jobs.title: Scientific Application Developer
jobs.company: Computational Memory Lab, University of Pennsylvania
jobs.content:
The Computational Memory Lab (http://memory.psych.upenn.edu/) at the University of Pennsylvania has an outstanding opportunity for a Scientific Application Developer, with an interest in developing new software technology for brain research.

The selected candidate will develop new software tools for cutting edge brain and cognitive research. In addition, he or she will analyze large multivariate datasets on human memory and electrophysiology, and program experiments in Python. Other responsibilities include: general lab systems administration, including website, file server and computer cluster; using computer systems to run analyses of data collected, as well as simulations of memory processes in computer models of memory (Data analysis and simulations are done in Python). Experience with Unity is a plus, but is not required.

jobs.title: .Net Developer - Leading  Lease to Purchase provider
jobs.content:
Do you see binary while you dream, or think of programming first and coffee second when someone says Java?  Would you take the red pill?  If so, then Progressive Leasing has an amazing opportunity!  We are currently seeking an .Net Developer to work within our development team, and need someone who is committed to creating high-quality, stable, and fluid applications.


This role can be based in our headquarters location (Draper, Utah) or remotely in the Detroit, Michigan area. We are rapidly implementing new projects taking an API-first approach using ServiceStack with native mobile, NodeJS/AngularJS, and ASP.NET MVC reference clients.


We’ve established a friendly and collaborative development environment where all contributions are valued and rewarded. Innovation and creativity are of paramount importance, in order to take our platforms to the next level. If you want to help refine processes and technologies that will reinvent technology in a constructive and collaborative environment, this is the place for you!


What You’ll Do:



  • You will play a very active role in the design and decision making for our applications. Progressive respects new ideas and innovation and we are empowered to run with ideas

  • Every engineer plays a part in the development and evolution of our technology roadmap and we get to try out a lot of new and exciting emerging technologies as well as contribute to product evaluations as we select new software to deploy in our environments

  • Collaborate and participate in pair programming; we all work on problems together


You are:



  • Someone with a visible appetite for technical learning, discussion, and experimentation

  • Self-driven. You have superior organizational skills, integrity, and great follow-through on tasks

  • Dynamic. You’re innovative, creative, and constantly looking for ways to deliver

  • You love working on a cohesive team and like the fact that our people genuinely care about each other, their projects and Progressive; they go out of their way to educate and support each other

  • You like when your ideas are respected by your teammates and business leaders


Compensation, Perks & Benefits


We know that talented people are attracted to companies with long term success, an amazing culture and one that provides competitive pay, comprehensive benefits and outstanding career advancement opportunities. If hired you can expect;



  • Work/life balance is real here. Engineers occasionally voluntarily work after hours because they're excited about a project or want to try something new, but in general, we respect the non-work lives of our team members

  • Highly Competitive Base Salary plus annual bonus potential, paid QUARTERLY!

  • Medical/Dental/Vision Coverage available the first of the month following your hire date

  • Tuition Reimbursement, 401K, Paid Time Off and Holiday Pay

  • State-of-the-art onsite gym, Basketball court, BBQ Area, Game room

  • Team events and on-going work-site activities, food events, games events and movie nights at the theater for the whole family

  • Paid training including off-site conferences and OJT technical training


*All new hires must pass a pre-employment background check and drug test.


Founded in 1999, Progressive Leasing, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Aaron’s Inc. [NYSE: AAN], is a steadily growing company, already surpassing $1B in revenue. Our scalable, customer payment software product provides lease-purchase technology solutions through 16,000+ retail locations in 46 states


Progressive Leasing does not discriminate in any aspect of employment on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, age, veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local employment discrimination laws where Progressive Leasing does business. All new hires must pass a pre-employment criminal background check and drug test.

jobs.title: Software Engineer in Test
jobs.content:
We’re looking for a smart Software Engineer in Test who’s fun to work with, passionate about automation and gifted with programming skills in Java, JavaScript or both!


What is GoEuro?


GoEuro is Europe’s leading travel platform. In a single search it connects you to any city center in Europe via train, bus and plane. GoEuro’s smart technology makes international travel comprehensive, convenient and cheap.


Who are we?


Headquartered in Berlin, we’re a bunch of more than 180 travel enthusiasts with 35+ different nationalities. We believe in the power of technology and travel to transform people’s lives. We value healthy work relationships, creative problem solving and, naturally, fun.


As a Software Engineer in Test at GoEuro, you will...


...be part of an agile, crossfunctional and self-organized team, working hand-in-hand with Software Developers, PMs and Designers. You will represent QA in that set-up, teach your teammates about how to build high quality solutions and develop the needed tools to make everyone´s life easier. Apart from that, you will work on some common projects in our QA chapter. To sum it up: You will have lot´s of freedom, ownership, a challenging and very rewarding job.


Your Role:



  • Automate, automate & automate: regressions tests, API contract verification, load tests and all aspects of our large and quickly changing system

  • Maintain and extend our existing suite of functional tests (Selenium, Calabash, Cucumber, CasperJS)

  • Iterate through process improvements in order to deliver a quality product faster and consistently

  • Maintain and create integrations with our CI (Jenkins and Travis)

  • Track, document, and share known behaviours with product and engineering teams

  • Find bugs, assist the developers on fixing them and work on preventing bugs in the future by promoting the quality culture

  • Interface with product managers, developers, engineering managers, and stakeholders to prioritise problem resolution and ensure release readiness

  • Become an expert on our products and their use from a customer perspective to ensure a positive end user experience

jobs.title: Web Application Engineer

Who we are:


At Ecocion, we build web applications to help solve hard problems like environmental compliance, emission tracking and reduction, resource conservation, and environmental impact. We seek people who want to have a direct impact on these challenges. Come help us tackle these issues!


What we're doing:


We're growing our Software Engineering team, so we're on the lookout for sharp, motivated software developers -- from new grads to mid-level -- to help build brand-new versions of our environmental compliance web applications. If you want to make an immediate impact on our major software products, we'd love to talk to you. 


What's in it for you:

  • Yearly expenses-paid trip to Microsoft Build conference in San Francisco.    

  • 100%-subsidized employee premiums for health and dental; 401k match.

jobs.title: Embedded Software Engineer
jobs.content:
Thrive Bioscience is building the machines that make stem cells. As scientists get closer to using stem cells in humans, there is an ever increasing need to automate the process of making, modifying and growing stem cells. Thrive's mission is to deliver that automation.


Thrive's instruments involve robotics / automation, image acquisition & analysis, fluid handling, refrigeration / heating and centrifugation. These are complicated devices that manipulate living cells. All of this is controlled from a web browser. We are looking for an experienced software engineer, especially skilled in programming low-level hardware, to join our team of scientists, software and hardware engineers in designing and building our line of novel instruments. The successful candidate will be a talented software engineer who is energized by the challenge of bringing a complicated piece of hardware to life and enjoys writing code in an agile, start-up culture.


We use Linux and modern MVW UI frameworks.


Thrive's founders, management and board each have decades of experience building and growing successful, technologically innovative companies. We work with world-class scientists at leading institutions to develop the instruments and software they need to push their research forward.


Thrive is a small, but growing, company and its instruments are still in the design phase.

jobs.title: Drupal/PHP Developer
jobs.content:
Science Magazine seeks a Drupal/PHP Developer to be responsible for general development of Science's web and digital products in an agile environment. Duties may include site building, module/plugin development, and theme building, and general web development. This role assists senior developers and project managers in planning project requirements.


Major duties and responsibilities:



  • Contributes to the development of Science's primary Drupal and WordPress sites

  • Assists in planning and maintenance of new and existing web sites

  • Writes clean, readable code with an extreme focus on overall performance

  • Documents new and existing functionality

  • Works collaboratively to foster innovation, learning and creativity within the team

  • Ability to clearly communicate technical concepts to non-technical users and stakeholders


Minimum qualifications:



  • Proficient in Drupal including custom and contrib module development

  • Experience with PHP 5.4, MySQL 5.5

  • Experience working with Amazon Web Services

  • Experience working in the LAMP stack with frameworks such as Symfony, CodeIgniter, etc.

  • Experience integrating content APIs with Drupal and WordPress

  • Experience participating in and conducting code reviews

  • Experience with version control (Git, HG)

  • Eagerness to embrace emerging web technologies


Ideal, but not required:



  • Extensive university or college-level training leading to an Associate's degree

  • Proficiency in Drupal themeing

  • WordPress theme and plugin experience

  • Understanding of modern front-end technologies and best practices

  • Experience working in a DevOps culture utilizing automation, continuous integration and release management

  • Node.js experience

  • Experience migrating content to Drupal 8

  • Experience working with Headless/Decoupled Drupal sites

  • Experience integrating Drupal with other technologies, such as Memcache, Varnish, SOLR

  • Experience with Docker/containers


Please visit our job information website http://www.aaas.org/page/employment-aaas to get more information, and to apply to AAAS online.


AAAS is an EO employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or other protected category. AAAS uses E-Verify to confirm the employment eligibility of all newly hired employees.

jobs.title: Software Engineering Manager
jobs.content:
There’s incredible excitement and urgency around developing secure software.  But today’s security tools are unwieldy and expensive to implement, fit poorly in modern agile development processes, and often simply pile up bugs of questionable value.  


We’re reinventing software security by replacing assessment tools with development tools that build security into software as it’s developed. We scale secure development in today’s app-focused, DevOps-centric, continuous-deployment world.


We are looking for a creative and experienced Software Engineering Manager to be the progressive, technically experienced leader of our team of highly skilled Senior Engineers. You've spent a number of years rising through increasing roles of responsibilities in engineering, and now you're an effective manager of a full-sized team.


Codiscope is the home you've been looking for building very cool technology. In this small but well-backed company, you won't be just managing: you'll be designing, writing code, and architecting systems. You will manage large revenue-impacting products and will deliver high-performing, extensible microservices systems. You will bring your experience in driving innovation in this uncharted territory of scalable secure software. You are both a highly technical, hands-on coder and code reviewer--able to tackle challenges--and an effective people manager.


Boston is our headquarters, and your distributed team members are both onsite and offsite, with some outsourced engineers located internationally.  You will be part of an open, success-driven, progressive culture where you can apply your expertise and learn a lot as you work!

jobs.title: Master of the Universe
jobs.content: Universe is expanding. We're looking for passionate back-end developers to join our team. Do you get the kicks of developing superb API that caters all frontend client needs? What about the feeling when you manage to reduce the SQL queries to half? Or is application architecture your passion? If you answered yes to any of those question, or you would like to learn to do them, you are the one we are looking. We are team full of talented developers looking for a good teammate to work with and to bring ideas and to make them alive.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content:
There’s incredible excitement and urgency around cybersecurity software right now.  But today’s security tools are unwieldy and expensive to implement, fit poorly in modern agile development processes, and often simply pile up bugs of questionable value. We’re reinventing software security by replacing assessment tools with development tools that build security into software as it’s developed. We scale secure development in today’s app focused, DevOps centric, continuous deployment world.


We’re looking for a software engineer to bear primary responsibility for the development of approaches to help detect program vulnerability, provide targeted security guidance, and where possible, assist in the generation of secure code or packaging of deployment assets. At Codiscope you will redefine how millions of developers write secure code. You will learn the state-of-the-art mechanisms to secure software. You will work with analysis and security experts on advanced techniques to some of the toughest code analysis problems in the industry


Responsibilities


You will work closely with the engine team to help create:



  1. Front-end parsing of popular programming languages

  2. Modeling of popular frameworks in Web and mobile programming


These involve source code compilation and model generation. Working hand-in-hand with research staff members, the software engineer will be responsible for implementing and testing the approach of semantics preserving complication of source programs into intermediate representations.


Specific Responsibilities:



  • Develop front-ends for popular programming languages

  • Develop and maintain the universal intermediate representation

  • Built models for frameworks and libraries

  • Work with other software engineers and security researchers to develop high quality solutions.


In this role, you will advance Codiscope’s productization of Intellectual Property by making sure that popular source languages and frameworks can be compiled properly.

jobs.title: Senior Software Engineer, Web Apps @ high-growth DC tech company FiscalNote
jobs.content:
About the Position
As we continue to reinvent the future of law, You will be jumping headfirst into a team of passionate and motivated individuals. As a senior member on the engineering team, your role will challenge your skills as a leader as you assist in the development and mentoring of other team members. Beyond enhancing and pushing forward the capabilities of our client-facing application, you will be critical in guiding and developing the API that powers our client applications (web, mobile, and general API) as we move toward a polyglot micro-services oriented architecture.


You Are
Ambitious. Detail-oriented. Thoughtful. Although proud of how far you’ve come in honing your craft, you look forward to constantly growing in your technical abilities. Even more excited to share your skills and experiences, you thrive in collaborative environments in which the free flow of ideas serve as the catalyst for bold results. Feeding off of a highly competent engineering and product development culture, you yearn to contribute to the foundational growth of a company with unlimited growth and market capture potential.

jobs.title: Monitoring Engineer
jobs.content:
As a global player in mobile learning and entertainment services, we are looking for a Monitoring Engineer to improve the quality of our dashboard monitoring and issues detection process. You are a strong communicator and you feel comfortable working with multiple teams and communicate with external partners. You will be mainly responsible for the continual improvement of the monitoring and visibility of our platform. 


Requirements



  • Performing daily data analyses by writing complex SQL queries.

  • Checking alerts on dashboard monitoring tool. Extending and updating alerts and tools to improve reliability of issues detection.

  • Communicating with partners and Customer Care team on requests related to complaints or logs/history acquisition.

  • Back-end testing and working with developers and QA engineers under issues checking.

  • Strong analytical skills. Capable of tracking and analyzing cases with suspected issue from A to Z. Not just to bounce it to another team. 

  • The capability of learning and working in sophisticated domain.

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.content: We are seeking a highly motivated web developer to help expand as well as maintain our Act! web product and windows application platform.  The candidate will work closely with a team of developers, quality assurance engineers, and technical support analysts. The candidate must be a strong contributor with a high-quality mindset, one that always reflects a customer focus in their work.

jobs.title: DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
The DevOps Engineer develops tools, processes and procedures in support of our Software Developer and Sysadmin teams.



  • You will configure and perform initial deployments for Linux based production systems and services for new and existing projects.  

  • You will work closely with Software Developers in defining system architecture and services for our applications.

  • You will work closely with our Sysadmins to define processes and procedures that allow them to monitor and ensure the stability, security and availability for our applications.



Here's what the role entails:



  • Work with members of the Internal Development team to understand requirements for development, testing, staging, and production tiers for new and existing applications.

  • Automate system and application deployment using Puppet.

  • Develop, configure, and maintain system and application monitoring using Nagios, collectd and other in-house tools.

  • Work with Developers, Sysadmins, and Technical Writers to define system and level support documentation.

  • Perform periodic infrastructure audits to ensure proper monitoring and failover are in place and functioning for all systems.

  • Manage and develop tools for managing Xen, Free BSD Jails virtualization



Here are the abilities, skills, and experience you need to have in return for all the above, we offer the following:



  • Technical Skills -

    • Advanced *nix / Linux administration experience:  Linux/FreeBSD/OpenBSD, Apache, MySQL, Firewalls (ipfw, pf, iptables)

    • Strong working knowledge and demonstrated ability with Perl, Ruby, Python, or similar scripting languages

    • Strong working knowledge of automating system deployment and maintenance using Puppet, Chef, or similar automation tools.

    • Experience with writing monitoring tests to use with Nagios or other monitoring software

    • Experience working with virtualization platform, say, EC2, VMware, or Xen.



  • Iterative Development - Comfort with Scrum, or other agile methodologies is a plus
     

  • Communication skills - able to effectively transfer thoughts and express ideas written or verbally in individual or group situations; presents oneself clearly and articulately when speaking; checks for understanding
     

  • Problem Solving skills - able to take a logical approach to address problems or opportunities or manage the situation at hand by drawing on one’s knowledge and experience bases
     

  • Time Management - able to manage work time in such a manner that ensures the accomplishment of specific objectives; sets priorities, goals, and timetables to achieve maximum productivity
     

  • Attention to Detail - able to accomplish a task with concern for all the areas involved, carefully monitoring the detail and quality of own work
     

  • Results Oriented - has a concern for achieving or surpassing results against an internal or external standard or objective
     

  • Interpersonal skills - able to get along with others effectively
     

  • Conflict resolution - able to bring disagreements into the open and attempts to manage them collaboratively
     

  • Travel - Occasional overnight travel 

  • Education/Experience - High school diploma or equivalent

    • Five years of Systems Administration experience

    • Two years of software development or automation experience




In return for all the above, we offer the following:



  • Competitive Salary

  • Full Health, Vision, and Dental coverage

  • Flexible Spending Account

  • Free on-site lunch

  • Paid Time Off

  • Tuition Reimbursement

  • Casual Working Environment

  • 401K Matching


EEO Statement


 At our company, we take great pride in our diverse and talented workforce. We recognize that our continued success as a company depends largely on the collective strengths of our employees.


cPanel provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religious creed, sex, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, pregnancy, childbirth, physical disability, mental disability, age, military status or status as a Vietnam-era or special disabled veteran, marital status, registered domestic partner or civil union status, gender (including sex stereotyping and gender identity or expression), medical condition (including, but not limited to, cancer related or HIV/AIDS related) or sexual orientation in accordance with applicable federal, state and local law. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including, but not limited to hiring, placement, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.  Privacy is taken seriously at cPanel, Inc. Information submitted is kept internally and not shared with third parties.

jobs.title: Principal DevOps Engineer
jobs.content:
The Cloud Operations team is responsible for delivering $170B annual business commerce to thousands of Ariba global enterprise customers and suppliers 24x7.


If you are excited about experimenting, innovating and being an avant-garde and want to grab the opportunity to make a BIG difference as we transform our Dev Ops architecture, this is the job for you. You will be responsible from defining the architecture, implementing the solution to seeing it successfully rolled out to all the products. If you are excited about being hands on, lead the team, be able to carry the designs and solution conversations cross organizations, you will enjoy the work.


Being a forerunner at this work, you would have opportunity to speak at internal and external forums about the architecture and solution.

jobs.title: Cloud Engineering Manager
jobs.content:
The Cloud Engineering Manager will be responsible for tactical management of engineering and execution for DreamHostâs Cloud platform â the OpenStack-based DreamCompute and Ceph-based DreamObjects products. The Cloud Engineering Manager will work closely with developers and systems engineers on the Cloud team, coordinate with project managers, and collaborate with Infrastructure, Network, and Security teams to deliver on the Cloud teamâs objectives.

__Responsibilities__

* Lead by example by being an active contributor in the day-to-day engineering and operation of DreamCompute and DreamObjects.
* Work with Product Owners to define, track, and manage agile sprints to ensure delivery.
* Solution-engineering activities such as defining technical specifications, prototyping, and leading dev teams through product delivery life cycles.
* Participating in cross-departmental brainstorming sessions for deploying other DreamHost applications and services on DreamHostâs Cloud platform.
* Maintaining deep technical and business knowledge of the various DreamHost cloud solutions and ensuring continuous upgrade and integration of new technical features and capabilities.
 
__Requirements__

* Deep experience with deploying and managing OpenStack clouds.
* Strong UNIX/Linux Operating System skills.
* Good understanding of virtualization and infrastructure solutions including hypervisors, storage and network.
* Detail-oriented with good organizational skills.
* Excellent communication skills.
 
__At least 6 years experience in architecture and implementation in one or more of the following related areas:__

* Multi-Tenant and Enterprise Application Architectures
* Good understanding of OpenStack and a knowledge of its codebase (preferably at a contributor-level)
* Deep understanding of application development, deployment lifecycles and automation through scripting and tools
* Expert-level knowledge of DVCS, Agile Development Methodologies
* Deep experience with deployment and configuration management technologies such as Chef, Puppet, and Ansible
* In-depth, working knowledge of both Relational and NoSQL Database Technologies such as MySQL, MongoDB, and Cassandra
* In-depth, working knowledge of deploying and scaling web technologies and microservices
* Ability to hold conversations with developers and architects, in other departments or with strategic partners, to extract their best practices

jobs.title: AWS Trainer Engineer
jobs.content:
__DESCRIPTION__

At Cloud Academy, weâre builders. Learning new technology is just as exciting for us as building it. We do this through utilizing and developing cutting-edge technology and empowering students, developers, engineers, and companies to build and grow products with robust and constantly updated cloud skills. Now is your chance to join our talented team that delivers unparalleled educational content to developers worldwide.

As a member of our content team, you will be challenged to produce new educational content for Cloud Academy, which has become an incredible resource for thousands of people worldwide. Our customers vary from Fortune 500 companies, to IT professionals in Japan, to small teams of developers from the UK. Youâll report to the Head of Content and your time will be divided between creating new learning content yourself, managing contractors who are creating learning materials for you, and collaborating with our internal content, product, and engineering teams to make sure Cloud Academy creates the best possible product and learning materials for our users.

__Responsibilities__

* Design and create new online courses, quizzes, labs, and learning paths related to Amazon Web Services and DevOps tools for our B2C and B2B audiences based on data and customer feedback.
* Manage contractors to ensure they are meeting deadlines and our standard guidelines for educational content development.
* Collaborate with the Head of Content and the rest of the content team to define the strategy and related paths for Cloud Academy.
* Work with our marketing and sales teams to support their efforts to promote Cloud Academy content, including through creating blog posts as well as helping to build our network and community.

----

__REQUIREMENTS__

* 2 or more AWS Certifications
* In-depth understanding of the cloud computing industry
* Teaching experience and/or a background in educational content development
* Experience managing contractors
* Superior oral and written communication skills
* AWS (of course!)
* Docker (or other containerization technology)
* CoreOS/fleet (or similar cluster scheduling technology)
* NoSQL, especially Redis and MongoDB
* Python
* Chef (or other configuration management technology)
* Public Cloud Deployments on AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform
* Private Cloud Deployments on VMware, OpenStack

__Bonus Points__

* Knowledge of more than one cloud computing platform

----

__BENEFITS__

* Competitive compensation
* Stock options
* Full benefits, including medical, dental and vision
* Yearly budget for conferences/courses for your personal development
* A very exciting environment with unlimited snacks and drinks
* Your personal workstation (up to $2000)

_We value diversity and are an equal opportunity employer at Cloud Academy. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status._

jobs.title: Senior Dev/Ops Engineer
jobs.content:
We're looking for a few good humans.

Utilizing in house and cloud infrastructure we support the software that powers tens of thousands of sales every day for our store owners. The right person for the job has a good breadth of experience in the areas of networking, linux administration, performance tuning, automation, and security. We’re looking for someone who loves getting their hands dirty and leaves a trail of awesome in their wake. Our existing stack consists of

  • Rails, Ember, JSON API
  • MySQL, Elasticsearch, Redis, Riak, Redshift
  • Haproxy, Nginx, pf
  • Linux, FreeBSD, MacOS
  • Xen, Bare metal hosts

We’re also eager to explore new technologies that can improve the agility and flexibility of our in house infrastructure. Our team is small and our ops team is smaller yet. If you want to make a big impact this is the place for you. More than anything we need someone who wants to help artists make a living doing what they love. Big Cartel is home to nearly a million designers, musicians, makers, and other artists. Your work will be a critical part of keeping them happy and productive.

This is a full-time and salaried position that includes all of our awesome benefits like paid family leave, solid insurance, 401(k), and a generous PTO policy (we encourage you to take 4 weeks off!). You can work remotely from anywhere in the United States, but extra credit for joining us in SLC.

We also feel it’s important to point out the obvious here – there’s a serious lack of diversity in our industry and it really bugs us. That’s why we’re doing everything our small company can do to change that. We hope to continue to build a company whose culture promotes inclusion and embraces how rewarding it is to work for artists of all types all over the world.

Please tell us about yourself! We are as interested in what you bring to the company in terms of personality, life experience, and empathy for others as we are about your technical abilities. Don't worry if you don't have a resume or cover letter to upload. Our questionnaire covers most of the things we're interested in.
